Reviews.Title: “Heaven isn't too far away”
Reviews.Author: 79kmo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea was amazing. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The view from the luxury suite was gorgeous and we saw beautiful sunsets from it! The grounds are impecable and very well maintained. The staff is very friendly and available to help at all times. The pool was small but perfect for laying out and getting some sun away from beach at Grand Wailea which can be very windy in afternoons. The shuttle service to beach was great and timely. Overall we had wonderful time and hope to be back at Hotel Wailea sometime in future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wailea is our #1 choice in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Heathernelson707
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea is a fabulous place to stay during your vacation in Maui. Every one of the staff members are eager to help and so kind. The grounds are gorgeous and very well maintained. The free shuttle service and valet parking makes it easy and convenient to check out the area. We will most definitely be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Big Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The staff all very helpful in everyway. The grounds are wonderful as is the room. We had a partial ocean view and it was great. There have been reviews that I read that were not good...ignore them this is a great get-a-way with awesome service and great beds. You have to remember that it is a hotel and with the amount of guests they serve of course you are going to see some wear and tear in some places in the rooms but have seen much worse in places that cost twice as much. Emily at the front desk was so helpful in getting the things I needed for my special needs daughter. We can't thank her enough. All of the staff is very helpful in a genuine manner and make you feel right at home. Don't think twice about staying here you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Tranquil”
Reviews.Author: johnwalt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Wailea on our first trip to Maui. We looked at most of the hotels in the Wailea - Makena area and chose the Hotel Wailea for the price and room size. We were not disappointed in any way. The room was very spacious and clean; we did not encounter any of the problems others have reported on this site. The pictures of the rooms on the hotel website are very accurate so there were no surprises. We loved the large tub and shower, and found the kitchen small but adequate. The bed's pillow top was a little too soft for our liking, but few hotel beds compare to ours at home. We selected a panoramic ocean view room and the view from our lanai was spectacular. We had great ocean views, and overlooked half and acre of the grounds and garden. We watched a chef pick fresh vegetables! The hotel grounds are beautiful and expertly maintained. The gardens and fountains are wonderfully relaxing and tranquil. The breakfast buffet was as advertized, and we supplemented it with yogurt we bought at the Safeway in Kihei. We ate breakfast one morning at Sarento's and highly recommend it. All of the staff members were warm, friendly, and eager to help. The valets gave us several rides to the beaches and restaurants in Wailea, and we never had to wait more than 10 minutes. We learned that the hotel was originally built as condos exclusively for Japanese vacationers, and turned into a hotel about 3 years ago. That explains the phone instructions in Japanese in our room. We walked past the Four Seasons and through the Grand Wailea. Both had hundreds of guests – many, many more than the Hotel Wailea – and walking through the Grand Wailea was like walking through a combination Las Vegas casino and Disney World. Everything was way over the top and miles from anything else. We ate at Capische the night we arrived. We ate at the bar and enjoyed the meal; the only critique was that the by the glass wine prices were very steep, especially for the wine offered. The Hotel Wailea is perfect for those that don’t have to be on the beach and want a quiet, peaceful, large room with amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Best Possible Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Hotel Wailea for our honeymoon last May and we decided we would never stay anywhere else on Maui. We loved that it didn't have a normal hotel feel. Rather than being door to door with your neighbors, there are four rooms per building. You cant just walk out of the hotel and be on the beach, but it was so much better just being by ourselves. ZIts probably a 15 minute walk to the beach but it just takes a second to drive down there and the bellboys will always be willing to take you down in the shuttle for free. (which is an escalade btw) The hotel premises are awesome. The pictures really dont do any justice. We had an amazing view of the ocean and the crescent island from our room. Every bit as good as oceanside IMO. The grounds are covered with native plants and flowers. One day we even went out and picked fruit with some of the staff. Depending on the season, they have mangoes, avocados, bananas, and apple bananas among others that can be picked. The staff at hotel wailea couln't have been friendlier to us. They were all just super nice and always had a genuine smile on their faces.They would ask us what we've done so far and what we liked as well as tell us what they recommend. They were also very helpful in telling us where to shop and get good local deals on food. While we were in Wailea, we went to the marriot for a luau, the kea lani, for a meal at the fish market, and walked by several other hotels on the beach front, but there is no where we would rather stay on maui than hotel wailea. Plus, hotel wailea is among the least expensive hotels in the area. Assuming your in the market for the same things we were (quiet, beauty, fun, comfort, relaxation), you would be foolish to go anywhere else. Seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Hotel Wailea”
Reviews.Author: ftlauderdalenative
Reviews.Content: NOT on the ocean, but still a nice hotel with a great view. Quiet & relaxing - nice continental breakfast. Nice sized rooms, very clean & nicely appointed. I'd stay here again in a minute. Just be advised, NO gift/snack shop - so get your treats in town.

Reviews.Title: “dreary room”
Reviews.Author: Alec17
Reviews.Content: Ok so here are a few facts: The carpet in our room was badly stained, worn out and not routinely vacuumed.The furniture is dated. The tile in the shower is painted and the paint is peeling. There was a section of base board trim that had been torn off. The bottom of the doors were chipped. The bracket on the bathroom door was falling off. The light in the living room was too dim to read by. The safe was in the bottom of a cabinet so I had to get on my hands and knees to use it. We returned from a day at the beach and found our back door standing open. If you are in a unit at the bottom of the property you will awaken to traffic noise. The parking spaces are very narrow and require passengers to get out before parking. The koy pond at the bottom of the property is very shallow and full of moss. The flagstone in the lobby floor is painted black. Breakfast was bagles and banana bread. All of the reviews that are a 4 or 5 either minimize or don't mention these features. And a few personal observations; Last fall when I booked this hotel I did so because the reviews on this site were consistently positive. Just prior to my vacation I returned to this site to see how reviews were running. I want to acknowledge my appreciation for those reviewers who commented on the same issues I listed above and offered ratings of 2 or 3. Had they not I would have felt set up and misled by the reviewers who failed to comment on these concerns. Its very apparent to me that these reviews reflect a very broad range of standards. So if you book a room here be aware of that. Needless to say, my wife and I were disappointed with the room. The comments of the manager, in reponse to the same concerns raised by previous guests, feels weak and manipulative to me in veiw of the conspicous level of disrepair of the room we stayed in. Overall the interior spaces were just off. Painting the flagstone in the lobby or the tiles in the bathroom is like something I would expect to find in a motel in the Ozarks. I will say however that the grounds (other than the koy pond) were very nicely done.The exterior of the buildings were nice and I enjoyed walking through the property in the evenings when we returned from dinner. The shuttle service to the beach was helpful and the drivers were friendly and courteous. Having access to beach chairs, towels and dining at the Grand Wailea was also very nice. I visited West Maui during the week and was glad that I had chosen to stay in the Wailea area. Its also fair to say that by staying a few blocks off the beach we probably saved $2000. So at this point I would not recommend staying here. But if the rooms were renovated, the paking issues addressed, the koy pond filled and attended to, the lobby redesiged and the breakfast made more adequate I would. TRIP TIP: I highly recommend a raft ride with the Pacific Whale Foundation. it was the highlite of our trip. Staff was friendly and informative and being in a raft is the way to go. They cautioned people with back problems from going in a raft. My wife and I both have moderate back issues but neither of us had any problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable resort”
Reviews.Author: DSMtravel
Reviews.Content: The facility is less expensive than the resorts on the beach. Very quiet and relaxed compared to the Marriott and 4 seasons. The facility has a shuttle service that works very well to take you to the beach and other attractions in the area. The kitchen, bedroom and bath are all top notch. The view from the balcony is excellent. The excellent free breakfast includes fruit, bagels and muffins.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique resort, great value”
Reviews.Author: nattiwong
Reviews.Content: Beautiful 1bdrn suites with a view. Modern furnishings, enormous bathrooms, good kitchen (but who wants to cook anyway?) Very private with only a limited number of rooms. Very convenient shuttle to anywhere within wailea. Arrangement with mega resort grand wailea for those inclined. Not the best for kids (no kiddie pool), but perfect private escape for couples. Also much much much better value than staying at the mega resorts. We loved the special service you get from all the staff - due to limited guest numbers they can really pay attention to your needs. The team arranged seatin at a private table under the stars at their amazing restaurant. We got shuttle service and recommendations for restaurants offsite. We never went to grand wailea as we were satisfied with the pool and doing other activities that got us around Maui. Thanks to Ann and her team for making out stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “A true retreat in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: Sure, there are many hotels down by the beach, where hundreds of families clamor for a spot on the sand and make whatever noise one associates with beach activities. The Hotel Wailea never pretends to be a beach hotel. It is a retreat. When the bellhops/valet personnel drive you to your unit, you will notice several acres of flora and zen-like streams. And in your room you will find huge space. If you are intent on cooking in the unit, please notify the desk before you arrive. There is virtually everything that the desk personnel will provide. We asked for and received a microwave along with enough dishes and cutlery for a quick meal. Because the unit is also equipped with a stove top, you might wish to ask for a pan and a knife and spatula. We noticed several guests bringing back juice, fruit, breads to their unit to enjoy on their lanai. With cereal and yoghurt purchased from any of the stores, a sufficient meal is made. I particularly like the General Store in the Shops of Wailea for its freshly made meals. For our first night, we purchased a Bento salmon and chicken along with a bottle of pinot grigio. This was a wonderful first night's supper. The shuttle drivers are all too eager to drive you to the Village or anywhere in Wailea. We took advantage of this service almost every day--sometimes twice--and left our car in the lot. With gas approaching $5 a gallon, it makes sense to use the car only when leaving the area. Since this service is included in the resort fee, tipping is entirely optional. One never "had to tip." Many activities are planned each day, from a fruit picking walk on the premises to yoga classes, the guest can do as little or as much one desires. The pool area is safe and well stocked with towels and complimentary cabanas. Although not entirely connected with the hotel, Capische? offers each guest a complimentary appetizer at the bar. We highly recommend the bar not only for the appetizer but for an opportunity to sample local dishes at great prices. House wines are a bargain at $6 for red and white (a chianti was poured one night, a pinot grigio another). Those who blanch at $200-300 tabs can sample the fare at the bar during happy hour (5:00-6:30) for a fraction of the cost at the restaurant. If you are indeed fortunate, you might run into a supremely gifted hoteliere, Ann Ikuta, who works at guest relations and just about everything else. In fact, it was she who caught us exactly a year ago exploring the grounds. She offered to show us a unit, the only one not occupied at the time. It was a partial ocean view on the ground floor, but it was still wonderfully spacious. Her kindess convinced us to reserve a week this year. And we are still smiling! There is only one thing I would change--immediately--and that is the choice of newspaper. We come to Maui to escape the Wall Street Journal. We implore the management to at least have the Maui News as an alternative. After all, if one wants to learn where Willie K is performing or what the local weather will be like in a few days, the local paper is the better choice. Of course, we "used" the shuttle drivers for our daily paper run in the Village. Yes, rooms are indeed being renovated and more will be updated in the future. But I would rather stay in a place that has heart and soul than in a place in which one remains a number. Your room at the Hotel Wailea is waiting!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but disappointing. NOT a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 30stravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Wailea for two nights in mid-January of this year. The lobby was beautiful with an open-air reception area and a breathtaking view of the water. The room, however, was a bit disappointing. We were expecting a boutique hotel-quality room when what we got was a converted condo. The bedroom was nicely decorated, but everything else needed a facelift (peeling paint, dated fixtures, a shower with a hose that eventually gave way mid-shower). We were also disappointed to see that although there was a large sliding glass door in the living area, the only window in the bedroom was a small, square panel that resembled a drive-through window (which is what we called it throughout the trip). You couldn't even see the ocean from the bed. We also had a bad experience with the ocean club. The Hotel Wailea doesn't have direct beach access, though they will gladly shuttle you to an area of the beach that is directly behind the Grand Wailea. So far, so good. What didn't work, however, was the communication between the hotel and the company they have hired to manage their beach service. We only had one afternoon to go to the beach during our stay, and when we got there, the company that was supposed to provide us with towels and boogie boards was closed, about an hour before they were supposed to be. BIG bummer because by the time we figured this out, the hotel shuttle was long gone. When we mentioned it later to a couple different hotel employees, their reaction was less than satisfactory. We have discussed our complaints regarding the hotel and ocean front with the manager and were satisfied with his response. It's just disappointing that Hawaii doesn't seem to offer any small, modern, trendy boutique hotels. We have been told that the hotel owners in Hawaii don't need to modernize their hotels because many of the people that go there don't care about modern amenities, and those who do still seem to go anyway. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and grounds; Paradise in Maui”
Reviews.Author: denisestr
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks at The Hotel Wailea, and did not want to go home. The grounds are lush with vegetation, and you have panoramic view of the beach. Although not directly on the beach, the views are fantastic. The hotel is less than a mile from Polo beach, but no worries; you have the best off both worlds - the quite of the remote location yet great views and easy access to the beach. You can be driven by the staff to the beach, which they share with the Grand Wailea. Since Hotel Wailea has an agreement with The Grand Wailea, you are provided with chairs, umbrellas, towels, and bottled water at the beach. The suite and the lanai are both a good size, so you do not feel you are cramped in a hotel room. The kitchen area is not equipped for cooking, but it was great for breakfast, light lunches, and snacks, when needed. The bed and the linens were amazing and made sleeping a pleasant experience. The actual furniture and floor coverings could use a face lift, but I heard rumors,that they may be renovating soon. We would definitely return to this property over the larger, less intimate beachfront properties in Wailea. The value, views, and the wonderful staff ensured us our best Maui vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: is small in size, quietly located on a hillside. The nicely kept grounds, the views, and the tranquility won me over immediately. Still it has been convenient to go everywhere The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Amy5354
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly when we arrived; the asian woman at the reception was very attentive and friendly, also the valet guy who took us to our room in a golf cart was very patient. The people at the reception on the next few days where quite indifferent to our questions and would rather see the back of us. Livingroom with tv and sitting area was spacious and on first glance quite luxurious. Lights are sparse though. Kitchen area: has stove, but no pan. Didn't know you had to ask for pots and pans till I read the reviews at TA! Had salamander visiting our kitchen the first night; even though it was a small one, it creeped me out! So was bit paranoid during the whole stay. Bedroom was separated from the living room thought sliding panel doors, has second tv. Bed was great, linnen was luxurious and with lots of cushions. Bathroom is big, but needs maintenance: some bathroom tiles on walls and floors are cracked and have been poorly painted over, but overal adaquate. Bathrobes are provided and Aveda shampoo/conditionar/soap. We had our room on the ground floor; it was supposed to have a partial ocean view, but it was obscured by large trees, so only saw a tiny bit of that. As mentioned by other reviewers, grounds are very well maintained. Only In the morning did we see that the living room carpet was bit rundown and grubby. Also the sofa seat has seen its best days. Location: in very quiet neighbourhood, but definitely not convinient when you don't have a car. It is near nothing. Breakfast: hostel like. Maybe I would recommend this hotel for couples who stayed in bed all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, average room”
Reviews.Author: frances3
Reviews.Content: After staying there, so many of the reviews ring totally true to me. We arrived to a super friendly & helpful staff (and they were that way the entire time), were given tix to a manager's evening drink reception, enjoyed the common spaces, and then were taken to our room. Hardly the expansive view we had paid extra for -- 3 rooftops, a street light, trees and street (yes some street noise at night) plus a strange little uninteresting pond in front gave us a partial ocean view. The carpet had lots of stains, the couch was dirty, the room a little dark -all a little bit disappointing. I love it when things are either just as described, or even better, but this is not the case here with the rooms. Breakfast was good, and we didn't mind the long walk down the hill to the beach (we drove to most sights anyhow)...they need a good updating, and they need to honor the "expansive ocean view" that people pay extra for (some of the upper rooms did seem to have a much better view). All in all, I probably wouldn't stay again, although I did love the staff - didn't find it a bad place, just not as good as I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “very nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: landscapechaser
Reviews.Content: What a good place to stay in Maui... pros, the grounds are really well maintained, good selection of breads and fruits for breakfast (included), room very clean, spacious and comfortable. Nice and quiet pool. The view is magnificent and is well located if you have rented a car, near to beaches, other attractions and shops. Cons, no much variety for dinner or drinks during the day or at night, the restaurant and bar were under remodeling, and the menu of the restaurant (Capishe) very limitedâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: DrewyR
Reviews.Content: I followed comments on TripAdvisor to find this more reasonably priced yet outstanding hotel. Without the shuttle, it would have been a different experience, but being able to get driven to the beach and back daily made this an easy stay. Everyone was very friendly and the cost was much less than some of the beachfront hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the rooms”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the pictures do not let you see what you get. As with most places they show a really nice room but when you arrive...it's not what you get. We stayed at the Honua Kai for part of our stay which is a little more but the rooms are out of this world! As for Hotel Wailea, poor furniture, bad carpet, bad paint, kitchen does not have a utensils, has a mini fridge, had a really bad parquet floors in the bath area, toilet room that was less than inviting & the tv cables were hanging off the wall. The workout room is dated as well. I will agree some of the positive reviews that the grounds are very nice & the folks are nice but it's not worth the 350 to 400 dollars per night...you can find a much nicer place to stay for the money. I'm hoping the folks with the positive reviews paid less than we did. We should've stayed in Kaanapali at the Honua Kai instead of leaving. We thought this being a "Luxury Boutique Hotel" that there would be some luxury...we were wrong. Sadly enough, we won't be coming back. If you liked it, I'm glad, but if you're going on a vacation looking for a nice get away, go somewhere else.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Second Time Staying at this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjl3045
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago when it was still called the Diamond Hotel or Resort. Although it is not on the beach, that is fine! We visited the hotels on the beach in Wailea and found the beach to be not so great. The rooms at the Hotel Wailea are huge and very comfortable, granted there is some dated furniture but it wasn't a big deal for us. Our advice is to stay at this wonderful hotel, and then drive to big beach or little beach, which is what we did for three days straight. The staff if very accommodating, warm, and really try to make your stay fantastic. Would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: scholarma
Reviews.Content: An overall nice place to stay. The only negative, the walk to the parking lot is far.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & concept but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: I think I might have rated the Wailea higher if it hadn't raised my expectations so high by calling itself a 'true luxury boutique hotel'... The location is great if you dont mind not being right be the sea. The rooms are super spacious, have a great view and because the resort is so big it feels very relaxed and serene (only 4 rooms in one building). The service was very good, especially the valet guys at the front desk - genuinely lovely - at the main reception is was mixed. 2 things though that you cant have if you want to be a luxury boutique hotel: the really outdated bathrooms and fittings (our shower lead was actually rusty and everything looked like early 80ies), and the breakfast (average quality bagels, banana bread and coffee with paper plates, paper cups and plastic cutlery). So what if it was complimentary or included in the 'resort fee' - either you offer breakfast and do it properly or you dont. I think with a bit of updating and effort this could be a spectacular hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wailea is Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Trina K
Reviews.Content: Wow! This place is beautiful. The grounds are immaculate, there are fresh red hibiscus flowers put everywhere each morning, there's a creek running through the entire property with beautiful bridges over the creek. The hotel is on a hillside so there are views of the ocean everywhere. The 70 rooms are actually split into quad buildings, so it's all spread out, and very spacious. Beautiful lit pathways to your quad, flowers all over the place, palm trees, on an on. The staff is over the top friendly, from the guys who meet you when you drive up, to the people checking you in, to the maintenance people. The breakfast (included in the price) is just right. Great banana lilikoi bread, papaya, pineapple, juice, bagels, coffee, etc. Since this hotel is not on the water, but just a couple short blocks up the hill from Wailea, they provide a free shuttle service down to the town of Wailea. This worked out perfectly. We called from our room, walked up to the top of the property, and the cadillac escalade was waiting for us. Also, included in the price (which includes a resort fee) is the use of the beach in front of the Grand Wailea (chair, umbrella, and water by an attendant). Perfect :-) We will be coming back to Hotel Wailea

Reviews.Title: “Neighborhood Boutique..Service above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: CindyH38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed that this boutique hotel was set in such a nice neighborhood setting. Higher up the hill above the big resorts enabled us to really feel as though we were getting away from it all to enjoy what we went to Maui for: peace and quiet, the warmth of the sun, and incredible views of the whales getting frisky in the sunset every night from our lanai. Our only location request if we were to stay again, would be to stay in one tier higher building, as ours was on the front, closest to a somewhat busy street. Service is what sets this hotel apart. We couldn't ask for a friendlier, more helpful staff during our stay. They all became fast friends, remembering our names, sharing recommendations, asking how our adventures were, and genuinely expressing their joy in what they do in contributing to their guests stay. The rooms/suites are large and comfortable, linens divine! Loved the large open shower and could see all they way out to the ocean while washing my hair!..Updating is needed in the bath (stained) and kitchen (only 1 burner worked), but I hope they don't change the layout. Grounds are absolutely lovely and even saw a nene strolling in the yard one morning. Never swam in the pool, but the area looked comfortable and inviting. We did enjoy the unusual, but not-to-be-missed spa after the long "Road to Hana" and again our last day on the island to freshen up after we had checked out before our late flight home. All in all our stay was well worth the money and would stay again, looking forward to the updates in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to Relax and Enjoy Maui”
Reviews.Author: ed13k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed the Hotel Wailea. The rooms are quite large, situated on a beautiful property. The breakfast is free, but lacks variety in the type of food and from day to day the selection is the same. They offered a small variety of fruit (all fresh), cereal, breads and cakes, juice, coffee and tea. The hotel provides a shuttle which takes you everywhere nearby including the beach which is about a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Overall, the service was great. We needed our luggage moved, and the bell person showed up immediately. We had the same experience with the cleaning staff as well. We would definitely recommend this hotel to other people, but would like to see the breakfast improved. The Hotel Wailea is associated with the Grand Wailea which is located on the beach. As a guest of the hotel, you are entitled to use some of the facilities (bathrooms and towels) near/at the Grand. The restaurants at the Grand are also available to Hotel guests, but seemed pricey. On a side note, the restaurant in the hotel seemed pricey - we did not eat there, but it does have good reviews on Yelp. There are other restaurants nearby and plenty of places to golf in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury up the hill”
Reviews.Author: Ysnan
Reviews.Content: Because this hotel is up the hill and not at the beach it's a bit more affordable compared to the luxury. The place and gardens are beautiful and well kept. Our suite with sea view was really nice with views all around. Even at night the pool is still open and well taken care of with flowers, candles and towels. A downside of being on the hill is the way down to the room and back. I noticed I planned a lot of things because you don't wanna do the hill all the time in this temperature. Some things in the room could be updated being loose or old (for instance some spots in the bathroom). Wailea is not great fun. It's resorts only and no real centre of the town. The hotel Wailea does have umbrellas at the beach but they close at 3 pm. Overall a great romantic gem! Suited for a honeymoon, like ours.

Reviews.Title: “We Really Wanted to Like This Place But....”
Reviews.Author: peregrinegirl
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quiet location with some space on Maui and chose this hotel and an "upgraded" suite after an extensive search. In terms of positives, the location is just fine, the grounds were pretty and the unit had a small screened patio with two chaises and an incredible, elevated view of the ocean, including Molokini, with amazing sunsets. (The hotel is not beachfront.) The units seem to be primarily condo style, with four to a building. Now about the space. While there is plenty of room, the decor is very tired and the carpeting and furniture are worn. The combination kitchenette/dining/living space had inadequate lighting - ceiling fixtures only and no lamps. In fact, it was too dark at night to read while sitting on the sofa. There was a mini fridge sufficient for holding sodas and some orange juice, but not much space for anything else. There was a bar sink, and an old electric burner stove. We were hoping to cook some local fish, but there was no way given the size of the kitchenette and dearth of kitchen equipment. The bathroom, while comprised of a large shower and tub, a separate toilet, and a sink area, was also very dated. There was a really weird, large attachment to the toilet relating to water flow with instructions in Japanese. Although the bath area had a large closet, the configuration was such that it felt pinched, with too many doors. The lobby area was almost always (oddly) vacant. There was no "nightlife" during our stay - not even a bar for a drink in the evening as the restaurant was closed for renovation during a good part of our stay. The complimentary breakfast was comprised of stale bagels and an urn of not so great coffee. The pool area was small, but nice and also quiet. The pool area bar was not open at all, so no tropical drinks by the pool. There apparently is beach access near another oceanfront hotel, and although the staff touted "signing privileges" at that (unrelated) hotel, one must pay a fee for recreational activities and spa access privileges. We had ongoing difficulty with wireless access. This place is a good value for anyone not wanting to be cramped in a hotel room, but it felt akin to camping. In retrospect, we wish we had paid more for a nicer resort or a condo rental. If you are looking for a luxury stay, this is not it!

Reviews.Title: “It has potential.”
Reviews.Author: live4thebeach072
Reviews.Content: I regret to have to write this because we had an amazing trip full of family, friends, and lots of fun! Our friend got married in Maui. It was such a highlight that the room didn't matter, but one couldn't help but notice a few things... What you see on the website is not what you get. There is a reason why they don't have more pictures of the rooms. I don't know how everyone rated this hotel as excellent. They call it a Luxury Boutique Hotel. Yes, some things are what you would consider luxurious, like valet, bathrobes, nice bed linens, and a very well manicured property. The rooms are far from luxurious (aside from the size) - the bathrooms are not luxurious at all - the shower head went up to only half my head so I had to dunk in order to wash my hair. There is no chance I would ever use the bathtub...it was stained and uninviting. The Aveda products are the simplest Aveda products, in fact not very good for my hair and very small, if you have long hair, you better buy some of your own. We didn't mind that, but again it's about being luxurious. There were stains on the carpet (which was gross by the way), there were stains on the couch, the terrace door didn't lock, and both, the doors and screens are very, very old. The lounge chairs on the terrace are extremely old, the whole living room is old, the closet had a different carpet than than the regular carpet, even worse looking and smelling. We seem to also get water bugs in old rooms that are not well kept. This time we found 2 of them! They are huge! We had ants in the bathroom, I think that's enough, really! We had the Panoramic view, but didn't really get a view as there were so many trees blocking it, not worth it! I think 'panoramic' is a misrepresentation of what it actually is. Our teenage kids were in the room below us and they had the same problems with ripped couches and rust...to mention a few. I rated cleanliness as average because of the state of the rooms, there is no way that carpet was clean.... The good - the bed, pillows and linens were fantastic, hence I gave the room an average review! The grounds were nice as well. Beware, there is Nothing going on at the hotel, it is very quiet, I think the bar closes at 10 or something like that. Spend a little more money and stay somewhere else. The chances are you won't spend that much time in the room, but when you do, wouldn't you want to feel comfortable? we didn't feel the luxury unfortunately as, among other things, every time we went to the bathroom in the middle of the night, we had to turn on all lights just in case there was a bug around, so that we don't end up stepping on it...not very pleasant. This spot has so much potential, if they were to renovate the rooms and incorporate some fun music at the bar and actually create a night life for their guests and atmosphere, it would make such a big difference, and we would pay more to stay there. At this point, we will not be staying there again. In the end you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married on the Sunset Lawn at the Hotel Wailea. The hotel staff and wedding coordinator were amazing. We stayed at the hotel, along with our wedding guests; everyone commented on how friendly and helpful the staff were. The Hotel Wailea is tucked away from the larger resorts, which makes it an ideal place to stay for those who enjoy quiet evenings. It's even ideal for those that enjoy resort life since the hotel shuttle will whisk you away to anywhere within the town of Wailea. The pool, spa, and grounds are gorgeous. The Sunset Lawn was the perfect location for our wedding. As implied in the name, the lawn overlooks the ocean and provided a picture perfect backdrop for our special day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jando1
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We didn't want to stay at a big resort in Maui, so happened upon this hotel. The rooms are large with luxurious bathrooms. The grounds are lush & the staff was amazing. It has a nice pool area & also a nice spa. We had a gourmet dinner one night in their restaurant. The hotel shuttle will take you to the beach, to other hotels, etc. We also thought it was very reasonably priced for the area.

Reviews.Title: “very very nice”
Reviews.Author: DeborahEastman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went in September. If you like the smaller hotel venues...this is a really nice spot...very low key..not a spot for children. There is one restaurant there..for dinner, which is very nice. They offer a continental breakfast..but we went off site to get healthier options. We love the smaller hotels and if you do..you will love it..All suites..very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, great service”
Reviews.Author: Katlic2
Reviews.Content: Grounds and facilities amazing. Very friendly and helpful staff. In fact, they even learned our names. Not directly on the beach but amazing views and the hotel would gladly drive you to the beach or wherever else in Wailea that you would like to go in their very clean Escalade. The room decor was slightly dated but the rooms where huge, clean, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “unique”
Reviews.Author: janeandgeorges
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, loved the open air lobby and amazing resturant. The view was outstanding. A little further from the beach then I was expecting but shuttles are very accomodating. Due to an unforseen problem with our room we were graciously upgraded to a panaromic view room and I would say if you stay there make sure you get one of these rooms, makes a big difference. We loved coming back to the room in the evening and having wine and dinner on the balcony. The barside pool lacked drink options but then again we only hung out there a couple times since there was so much more to do. I very much enjoyed the hotel and would book again. Beautiful property and romantic

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Excellent value for Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Skip45
Reviews.Content: This six day stay was our second at the Hotel Wailea. We now prefer it to the Kea Lani, where we have stayed previously...even though it is 40% less expensive. The staff is genuinely friendly and accommodating. If something wasn't right, they fixed it immediately. The grounds and public areas are lovely. The suites are very comfortable and spacious, even though they could use a little updating. While there are cooking facilities in the rooms, you need to arrange for cookware and a microwave from the front desk. [The cookware set they provided was initially incomplete. The microwave worked fine, but it was ancient.] The Japanese style spa is wonderful; and pool area is quiet and very nice. We either walked to the beach [about 15 minutes] or drove to a public parking area [about 3 minutes], but the hotel will also drive you down on request to their own beach center at the Grand Wailea [about 5 minutes]. All options are just fine, and we felt no disadvantage in not being right on the beach. I think of this as a couples hotel, but our grandchildren [ages 4 and 7] stayed with us about half the time; and preferred it to the much more expensive hotel their parents were at on the beach. The Hotel Wailea is not perfect, but it is a very nice facilityl with good amenities and an excellent value for this area of Maui. We will come again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best.....”
Reviews.Author: CrystalWater
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Hotel Wailea in the past, it's our favorite hideaway from the big corporate hotels. Once again they did not disappoint! The staff is so attentive, the rooms are all suites, the views are amazing as the hotel is set just above the shoreline. The rooms are in need of some updating but with so much room and a huge lanai overlooking the ocean view we felt it wasn't a big deal. The resort fee covered free Internet, free parking, a free and wonderful light coffee and local muffins, bagels, fruits ,etc. If you enjoy the auberge experience in Europe you will enjoy this hotel, we will be back time yet again! Special thanks to the staff at Hotel Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better...”
Reviews.Author: pickypickyme
Reviews.Content: I wanted so much to love this hotel, but shortcomings in maintenance and housekeeping keep me from giving it top marks. It could be so much better than it is. It should be better. Hotel Wailea has many things going for it: excellent location, beautiful grounds, private beach access (access to a private section of a beach with generous public access), spacious and quiet rooms (many with knockout views), a Japanese-style "hot spring" spa, friendly staff (if not quite enough of them). With the suite-style units, you get the feel of staying in a high-service condo, without the usual crowding or pool party scene. You have access to beach services -- and a hotel bathroom, which is a huge plus -- without having to stay at the massive, crazy-busy, noisy, beachfront Grand Wailea Resort. Unfortunately, my husband and I encountered some issues. The bathroom in our unit was split into a toilet room with a door, a sink area with one door and an open side, and a tiled "wet room" done in the Japanese style where the hand shower is mounted on the wall next to an extra-deep tub. There was no door on this, which led to both privacy and moisture problems. The unit's only closet was directly across from this bathing area -- in the same room, if you consider a pass-through area to be a room -- and the back wall of it showed signs of extensive mold. A slapdash attempt had been made to disguise the damage, but the paint was bubbled and peeling, badly patched, and falling off in bits onto the carpet. The carpet in the closet did not match the more recently installed carpet in the rest of the unit, and was dirty and not vacuumed. There was a plainly visible hairpin on the floor in there when we checked in, and it was there when we left. (Yes, I keep tabs on things like that in hotels). In the kitchenette, the drain in the small sink had slime in it, as did the bottom of the drain plug. The coffee machine smelled sour. Ants appeared. I rewashed all the dishes we used and scrubbed out the coffee machine myself. The Japanese-style spa was both the greatest surprise and the biggest frustration. The facility is fabulous, but there is no attendant and no posted instructions on how one should bathe before entering the soaking pools. People will behave badly when given there is no one around to keep them in line. We saw people bypass the bathing stalls and go straight into the water. We encountered a couple who were soaking naked (forbidden), and we were forced out one evening by a rowdy group of guests who decided to party in there. But where the lack of an attendant was most evident was in the mess thoughtless guests left behind. Used towels were strewn about, used soaps and their wrappers were left in the bathing stalls (in the waterfall shower, many days-worth of old soaps were stacked on the divider). I went around and collected dirty towels and put them in the baskets before I soaked just so I wouldn't have to see them. Some spa features weren't operational. The general impression was "deferred maintenance." Definitely not what you want to see in a spa. It could, and should, be so much better. Hotel Wailea is showing its age, but a hotel can age gracefully, or at least try to. I left there feeling that management was taking shortcuts. I'm not sure whether I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Serene”
Reviews.Author: mauilala
Reviews.Content: Maui has it all, quiet or busy. Lots of shopping, hiking, tours, activities, beach or pool lingering. Hotel Wailea is on the Kihei side of Maui below the Haleakala Mtns. which is an extinct volcano and great for hiking. It is at the Wailea end of Kihei which hosts a number of pricy hotels but very exclusive. The properties are very manicured but lovely and has the best beaches on Maui. Further is the Makena end which is the very end of the island. Hotel Wailea sits at the top of Wailea with very gorgeous panoramic views of the ocean and the other side of Maui known as the West Maui Mountains which has Lahaina on the other side. Hotel Wailea has very clean and roomy rooms, with a small kitchen containing a two burner stove, small refrigerator, sink and a few dishes. The hotel will bring cooking needs if you wish to cook meals. The staff are more than pleasant and very accommodating. The buildings have a total of four units each so it isn't a big hotel and noisy . Most rooms have views, separate bedroom, living and kitchen area and a separate bathroom with a toilet closet. There is a separate tub with a large shower area for whichever you desire. There is a beautiful waterfall at the entrance which runs throughout the hotel property and projects a serene atmosphere, very pleasant. My stay was very pleasant and am very happy to have found this hotel for the price. I lived on Maui for twenty years so I was very familiar with this area and this particular hotel. Check it out, make reservations and stay to relax and enjoy Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay All our need were catered to.”
Reviews.Author: Goldenbear10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November for our first Anniversary. Meegan at the front desk was exceptional, arranging for us to check in early and booking us our dinner at Spago. We arrived to a beautiful large room with a good size balcony and full lounge chairs. A card, chocolates and orchids awaited our arrival very nice touch. The view was amazing overlooking Molokini crater and this hotel was very quiet. The complimentary breakfast was very nice held in an open aired foyer with big comfy chairs. Spa was amazing nobody in it as well as the pool area. We felt like we had rented the entire property. All the staff here were excellent very accommodating and professional. We enjoyed watching the yoga from our Cabana perched up on a little hill overlooking the pool. Very close to the best storkel place with turtles and also to the shopping center, golf etc. The aveda products were a nice surprise. After alot of research on Trip Advisor I was not disappointed and would go back in a heartbeat. As for the comments about the rooms being outdated, they are not bad it's by no means ugly, very tasteful and even then I hate to say outdated as it would be a shame to not stay here based on that as the rest of the facility is very much tres chic. especially the little blue buggy outside the waterfall pond area. We will definately come back !!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Canuckle007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in early December 2011. The service was excellent with friendly staff who were always available to help. The property is set on a hill and the common areas - restaurant, lobby, spa, pool, fitness centre, garden areas are all well appointed. The hotel shares pool/beach ammenties with the Grand Wailea and a shuttle services runs between the two hotels which is a short drive away (3 min).The rooms are all suites and are very spacious, with a full kitchen (but no microwave). The room decor could use an update, but it was very clean. There are also resort activities offered if you care to take advantage of them (yoga, various receptions etc) and a nice continental breakfast each morning. It was very quiet during our stay - perfect for adults with no kids. We'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cgashti
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful, good people, great location, very unassuming, close to the beach with great service. They serve a simple but adequate breakfast. The pool area was empty the whole time. Great spa and workout room. The rooms are a bit outdated but very large and all have at least partial ocean view. Most of the resorts around this area are much more expensive just because they are on the water and with the beach access they provide, this is by far the best deal. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value in high-end Wailea”
Reviews.Author: rar1960
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a short stay in Maui after several days on the Big Island, to celebrate our anniversary. We very much enjoyed Hotel Wailea. It's better, I believe, for adults, as opposed to families with younger kids, because the Hotel itself, other than a modest swimming pool, doesn't offer much to keep young kids happy--that's what the beach is for; or if the kids would prefer a big resort with sprawling pool, slides, etc., this is not the place for that. The grounds are immaculate, the property is quiet, and the views are wonderful. When you're on the upper level of the two level units, the lanais offer a beautiful view of the ocean in front of Wailea Beach--a wonderful way to wake up, have your coffee, and plan your day. A tremendous feature of the place is the shuttle service to anywhere in the Wailea Beach area, from the beach access to the Shops at Wailea. We never had to take out our rented car (and if I'd have known this, probably wouldn't have rented a car--just taken cab to/from Kahului Airport). But we chose not to travel the island (since we'd been there before). Obviously if you choose to ascend Haleakala, drive Hana coast, visit Lahaina, Kaanapali, Kapalua, etc., you'd need your own rental car. But if it's the beach and the Wailea area you are interested in, it's much more convenient to use their shuttle service and avoid the parking hassles. They would meet us to take us back to the hotel with virtually no wait time on our part. The rooms themselves are spacious--our king-suite had a separate seating area, large bathtub, separate shower, and separate sink area and closed-off toiled. There is also a kitchenette with burners, sink, and small fridge. Good for basic food storage, not heavy food preparation. Wi-fi in rooms is included, as is use of fitness center (somewhat limited in terms of number/type of machines/equipment, but awesome view), and sauna/jacuzzi/spa. The staff was very accommodating. I called the front desk when I couldn't get my wi-fi connected to my iPhone. Within a couple of minutes, I received a call from their local Time Warner carrier to walk me through the issue. As for beach use, the Hotel has an arrangement with the Wailea Beach Club to use their location (directly in front of Grand Wailea hotel, mixed in with their residents), beach chairs, and umbrellas, and you can charge food/drink at the Grand Wailea to your Hotel room if you desire. This served our needs perfectly each time we went to the beach. Although there was some limited space/umbrellas/chairs, we never observed anyone not able to get chairs and umbrellas. You can also rent water services/sports (snorkeling, kayaks, canoes, etc.) from that Beach Club. It seems the main issue to me are the following choices: is being beach-front a necessity (ie, the ability to walk downstairs and out of your hotel onto the beach)? If so, Hotel Wailea won't work for you, but you'll pay perhaps twice as much to get that in the Wailea beach-front hotels. The second issue is that some areas of the Hotel Wailea could use some modernization/sprucing up. For the most part, I was fine with the "dating" of some of the features (such as parquet wood floors in rooms and common areas, and the classic designs of some of the common spaces, such as cocktail/breakfast area--oh yeah, they offer a modest but tasty and adequate breakfast included...something you won't see at many places). But some of the areas could use updating, like the toilets in the rooms and showers in the spa/sauna area. However, these were not significant issues to us considering the vast different in price point between Hotel Wailea and the Wailea beach-front properties. It comes down to what is most important to you. There are many nice touches here--the beautiful fish pond as you enter, and the excellently groomed grounds and flowers, for example. I would definitely choose this hotel again, OVER the mega-resorts in Wailea, because I prefer the quiet and groomed grounds to the long walks at the mega-hotels, and because I really valued the shuttle service. Also, the restaurant at the hotel, Capische? is reagarded as one of the best in Maui. We ate there and had two of the best fish dishes we've ever eaten anywhere. Not inexpensive, but nothing in Wailea is...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: slcpsych
Reviews.Content: This was one of our first real vacations in a long time, and we weren't disappointed. We upgraded to a panoramic view room, which was spectacular. The room was nice enough, but the view was fabulous. Nice little breakfast each morning too. We loved relaxing by the ocean (although the beach area is small and they drive you there) and even more so by the pool. And the spa facilities were a fun and relaxing break from all the other relaxing we were doing! The staff couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating, they were great. The one downside was that there was a wedding party staying there and they took over the lawn in front of our room one afternoon as we were trying to watch a quiet sunset, however the group was loud and playing a rowdy game of bocce. Despite that, it was great! Highly recommended to others.

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU!”
Reviews.Author: Jon T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend, younger brother and his fiancee. I thought that it was an awesome place to stay. I loved the vibe I felt once I walked into the lobby area. It was very calming and relaxing. My girlfriend and I also work at Aqua properties but in Waikiki. I just wanted to thank Ayumi at the front desk as well as the other gentlemen that assisted us with the check in. The bell guys were a great help by taking us on the golf cart with our luggages to the room, which seemed like would've been a long walk to the room itself. We didn't get to enjoy all of the features of this hotel. I will definitely stay at this hotel the next time I make my way to Maui. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating.....but nice grounds.”
Reviews.Author: rll314
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very quite and the grounds are well kept, but the rooms need updating. Sprayed paint coating is on the vanity area and peeling, i took pictures. The bathroom had small black ants and the furniture was very dated. This could be a really nice place if they would spend the money to update the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Retreat.... better than a Resort”
Reviews.Author: T K
Reviews.Content: My bf, mother in law, 7 month old son and I visited Maui February 2011. After much research, and pin pointing, we chose Hotel Wailea. We found it to be a perfect get-away! The property was beautiful, quiet, and clean. Our room had all amenities needed in regards to traveling with a baby. Upon request, we also received a kitchen set which was great for preping snacks on our outings. The staff was very friendly and professional. The continental breakfast was fresh and tasty. With an assortment of fresh fruit, POG juice, and amazing jalapeno cheese bagels. We were able to see the whales playing in the ocean from the 'lobby' area which was also very serene and beautiful. Not one single complaint. Perfect for a quiet retreat. And when you want excitement.... its not hard to find everywhere on the island. Plus there is umbrella service at the Grand Wailea beach. Would return in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BrettnMelissa
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel I thought it was going to be great...it wasn't or should I say isn't I have only just checked in. I have only just checked into this hotel after having to wait 3.5 hours, which in fairness we did arrive before check in time. However we were only able to check in 40minutes after they are suppose to guarantee the room being available. Being a self contained resort we had brought food with us which we will have to thrown ou now, again not entirely the resorts faultt. After finally checking into the room it defiantly isn't one of their best (frustrating as while we were waiting for our room we overheard someone had been upgraded) the carpets felt wet, their were stains on both the kitchen and bathroom benches and general rushed maintenance work i.e paint not covering walls properly. The rooms are beautifully elevated so you do have views of the ocean however overly noisy air conditioning units means you don't want to sit outside or have windows open. Being self contained they do not come well equipped with kitchen items we even had to ring reception to see if the place came with frying pans apparently they do but they have to send them down to you, which as I write this I am still waiting for them to come and deliver them which they better because both their restaurant and in room dining are closed for renovations! So far I am very unhappy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like it was our private hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights at the beginning of our ten day vacation! It was so quiet, peaceful and serene that we felt like we were staying at our own private hotel! The staff was amazing, and made honest and tasteful recommendations for activities and restaurants on this side of the island. While it was not beachfront, the view of the ocean was beautiful and it was nice to be just a bit away from the more resort-ish hotels. The spa was beautiful, the breakfast was amazing, and they had lots of free daily activities for everyone! We will definitely go back! The rooms were a bit outdated, and difficult to find initially, but they are very spacious. Our room felt like a suite! Another great feature to this property, is that the pool is never crowded, and they have complimentary cabanas on a first come first served basis! I felt so spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to the pricer Wailea resorts”
Reviews.Author: tdumpling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is like "hotel junior". The pool is small and pretty empty, but with nice chairs. The rooms are very spacious--suites with lots of room which was great. However, it's a bit of hike since they are located downhill. We were fine, but a couple of drinks in, the path gets pretty dark and those who don't like hiking may not love it. The beach access is interesting--they drive you down in very nice vehicles, but once you're there, the Grand Wailea (I think it's "their" beach) staff treat you like second class citizens. The Hotel Wailea staff were so nice and helpful too. The breakfast was great too--something we didn't get in some of the bigger, more expensive hotels we stayed in around the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, setting and privacy at Hotel Wailea outshine others”
Reviews.Author: Hokiecouple91
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th or so trip to Hawaii (and second to Maui). We have stayed at full service 4 and 5-star hotels and condos and by far this was at the top of our list and will definitely return. The Hotel Wailea is located away from the busier hotels at Wailea Beach up the hill just a short drive to the beach. Our family of 4 arrived a day late due to our airline and also had problems with our rental car (having accidentally locked our keys in the car). Needless to say this wasn't the best way to start a vacation, yet the staff at Hotel Wailea (Meegan, Emily and others) were very accommodating upon check-in adjusting our reservation, allowing us to check-in early AND greeting us with a complimentary meal and drinks (service recovery for something that had nothing to do with their hotel is certainly a step above). We stayed in 144 which is on the second level and on the edge of the property with beautiful views of the Pacific, Molikini and Lanai. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. As mentioned in other reviews, certain elements of the room could use some updating (countertops, modern toilets, etc). The kitchenette is small but adequate for beverages and light snacks. If you prefer shopping at grocery stores and cooking every meal on vacation this isn't your place. BUT if you value privacy, quite and beautiful setting and top notch staff then look nowhere else. During our visit, we enjoyed the pool and spa on different occasions and felt like we had the place to ourselves. At most we saw 2-3 other couples (honeymooners) and one or 2 other families with small children. The Japanese style spa is a definite bonus with a large hydro-therapy jacuzzi pool with beautiful views of the ocean and Northwest Maui -- again we rarely ever saw anyone else using it. The pool is smaller but offer complimentary cabanas and a bar -- complimentary mai tai happy hour on Tuesday. The beaches at Wailea are just a short shuttle or drive down the hill from the hotel. If you are a family, inquire with the bell staff as they provided us during our stay complimentary boogie-boards, umbrella and beach buckets for our kids (leftover from prior guests) -- well worth the tip and saves a trip to the ABC store. The large 5-star resorts at Wailea sit on the beach and Hotel Wailea has a beach club (which we never used due to crowds) and signing privileges at the Grand Wailea. My only problem with these hotels are they are very crowded and you have to walk forever just to get to the beach and to/from your rooms. Its hard to feel like you're "getting away from it all" with all of the commotion, towel carts, fighting for chairs and umbrellas, etc. It was simple to drive our car to the less crowded section of Wailea beach closer to the Four Seasons or Polo beach near the Fairmount (public access with free parking). Complimentary breakfast at the hotel is catered by the Aloha Coffee shop in Wailea (fresh bagels, breads, fruit and coffee). We ate at the Monkeypod kitchen, Pita Paradise and Cafe O'Lei in Kihei -- upscale casual restaurants recommended by the hotel and all excellent. The hotel has a 5-star restaurant onsite (we never ate there) but it looked excellent and has received numerous awards. I rated this hotel 5 stars as the staff, setting, privacy and grounds well overshadow the few simple updates needed in the rooms and some of the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Molefeet
Reviews.Content: After staying at the fairmont in the big island I guess I got spoiled. This place is not beach front...and yes there is shuttle but it is very inconvenience especially when the beach club closes at 3pm. The room was ok...it needed to be updated. The pool was small and they put way too much chlorine. What bothered me the most was at the compliment breakfast, there was always a staff standing there and overlooking the food table...I felt like he was watching my every move..so uncomfortable. The ground was amazing...extremely beautiful, but this place still need more improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the crowds in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: mgtravles
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds and peaceful location make this a gem overlooking Wailea. Rooms are comfortable and simple. Great views of Lanai, Molokini and Kahoolawe from throughout the property. We loved the small kitchen and refrigerator as it allowed us to brew coffee each morning and keep our wine and cheese cold for each evening's sunset. The co-ed spa and gym have spectacular views and new equipment. We used the gym a number of times and rarely had to share the space with anyone else. It has spin bikes, bow flex equipment, free weights, exercise balls and full size stretching mats. The spa has waterfall showers, soaking tubs, sauna and Japanese style shower area. The continental breakfast served in the lobby each morning was the perfect way to start the day. Staff was friendly and helpful throughout our stay. There is a shuttle service to nearby Wailea Beach, where towels, umbrellas and chairs are available to guests. Although there were cars in the parking lot, it felt as we had the place to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: After seeing the photos, we decided we had to stay at the Hotel Wailea for a couple of nights of our 10 day vacation. The grounds were gorgeous, the hotel was quiet, and the staff was very attentive. We wished the hotel would have been closer to the beach or had a better view of the ocean, but we were able to use all hotel services and found this hotel to be very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, rooms need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: Formiga
Reviews.Content: I stayed Nov 17-19 at a 1 Bedroom Panoramic Ocean View Suite. Even though it was an amazing view and a huge space the suite was dated. It definitely felt like the 70s. The shuttle service was great, the staff was nice. Will probably find somewhere else to stay the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to a perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: jenmont
Reviews.Content: Having travelled around mainland America we travelled to Maui for the last 6 nights of the journey. We stayed in the partial ocean view suite - massive and well kitted out with an amazingly comfortable bed - very clean and tidy. The staff/scenery/service and food at this hotel are all faultless. We ate in the restaurant Capische on our first night and returned 2 nights later as it was so yummy - even if your not staying in Hotel Wailea I recommend a trip to this restaurant - very romantic. Having priced all the hotels in Wailea this one is be far the best value and from what I can see by far the best hotel all round - the only drawback is that its not directly on the beach but everything else is so wonderful you dont even notice. Tips: - get up early if you want to get the best of the breakfast provided - take advantage of the free morning yoga - dont bother with the Grand Wailea beach if you have a vehicle there are much better (less crowded) beaches to be found - definitely drag yourself out of bed at 3.30am to see the sunrise over the volcano

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mindy S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea is a beautiful hotel with amazing customer service! We felt so very welcome and taken care of every day of our week long honeymoon. It was very clean, quiet, relaxing, has a delicious breakfast every morning and a gorgeous pool and spa. I do not have any complaints and highly recommend Hotel Wailea for your stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet gem overlooking Wailea”
Reviews.Author: napanapa_3
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea defines the meaning of a true vacation retreat. This serene small luxury hotel overlooking Wailea, offers the perfect retreat and alternative to the very busy and often noisy bigger hotels set right on the beach. The service is impeccable and the rooms and bathrooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. The hotel's Italian restaurant is one of the best on the island with tables tucked into an exquisite tropical garden setting. A true find. If you are looking for an utterly relaxing Maui getaway, look no further than Hotel Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “"if you want a nice place with a good value"!”
Reviews.Author: Rybrownski
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, nice pool, big rooms, friendly staff, complimentary shuttle to wailea beach with lounge chairs, umbrellas, towels. This place is tranquil and relaxing. I have read some of the poor reviews. Those people must be on crack! I hope they go to the big hotels and spend double. They can be elbow to elbow with everyone else. If you want a nice relaxing stay away from everyone else. This is your place!!!! You won't be disappointed. We got married in wailea and honeymooned here. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and serene”
Reviews.Author: eyafevol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Wailea for 5 nights in an ocean view suite and loved it. The place is beautiful and the service was great. The hotel is up on a little hill away from the beach. Depending on what you are looking for, this could be good or bad. We loved how peaceful it was without the beach and the crowds, and enjoyed watching the sunset from our balcony in the evening. The restaurant inside Hotel Wailea is spectacular, but you must book ahead. The hotel doesn't offer room service, and Wailea area doesn't have much choice for a late night meal, so make sure you plan well.

Reviews.Title: “A totally serene experience”
Reviews.Author: ReganRestStop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent out wedding night at the Hotel Wailea and I would love to go back for more! The hotel grounds and lobby are designed with Asian garden elements and I definitely felt relaxed. The staff were very warm and helpful. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms in particular had a honeymoon suite feel with a separate shower and tub, both separate from the sink and toilet. This hotel is great for couples who are ok with not being right on the beach. We also had dinner at Capische and the service and atmosphere were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bill2will
Reviews.Content: quiet peacefull setting makes this a perfect getaway place for couples. staff is top rate. large clean suites. nice pool area and the spa is something else. hotel provides shuttle to beach and local attractions. continental breakfast is aveage, did not eat dinner at the restaurant so i cannot comment-the only reason i did not give it a 5 rating. very few children as it is geared more to couples which is what we were looking for. was more than we expected and would definitley stay again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pablo R
Reviews.Content: We have been there for six nights at the end of our honeymoon, probably the best hotel ever. Everything was perfect, room, staff,pool, spa.... and just 72 rooms. Just go there and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: CharityLakewood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for six nights from Oct 6-13. We were in town for a friendâ€™s wedding, and where everyone else was staying at crowded hotels, as found peace and quiet at Hotel Wailea. Our suite style room was huge, and very comfortable. We had a partial ocean view, which to me was much more than partial, it was wonderful. Nothing better than looking out over our lanai at the ocean. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful, especially the wonderful guys up front at the valet desk who also run the shuttle service-they take the time to remember your names and always have a smile and polite conversation. I would stay here again in a heartbeat over one of the overpriced chains on the beach. Donâ€™t get me wrong, those hotels are beautiful as well, but none of them offer the exclusive service you get at Hotel Wailea, or the serene atmosphere.........Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: igetfuzzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a quick weekend jaunt to Maui. The rooms are bungalow style, withseparate "houses" that have a few suites each. The property is very spread out so if you get a room farther away, you might be in for a walk. Our room was on a "low" property so we did not get much of a view. The suite is huge, though. The bathrooms are quite large. The rooms show their age as the furniture is a bit worn around the edges. Otherwise, I had a comfortable stay. The service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: 461traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in August and must say that we loved every minute of our stay. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The resort grounds are gorgeous and I love the Japanese influence in the architecture. The rooms are a touch outdated decor wise but clean and comfortable and provided absolutely everything we needed. This resort is perfect for couples looking for a quiet, relaxing getaway. There were mostly couples between the ages of 25 - 40 with VERY few children. For the package price we paid to stay here I wouldn't ever consider staying somewhere else in Wailea! Although this hotel isn't right on the beach we knew this when we booked it so there was nothing misleading about the location. Besides, the beach is a couple minute drive down the road with a complimentary shuttle service. I would also DEFINITELY recommend their restaurant. The food is maginificent and the view is truly unbeatable. Thank you Hotel Wailea for a magnificent vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I had expected by far”
Reviews.Author: Lia H
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the previous reviews about the property being run down, etc., so I was not expecting much but had a deal so decided to give it a try. What I didn't know was that they had done some renovations recently so when I walked into our room, I was pleasantly surprised! First of all, the room is HUGE--I know that they're all suites but I found the floorplan to be much more open and spacious than other suite-type hotels, eg embassy suites, etc. The decor was modern, the bedding was luxurious, the bathroom was also huge with a jacuzzi type tub as well as a shower which had three knobs, one that regulated flow, temperature and pressure. We did not use the kitchenette (there were no pots or pans--they probably need to get some if they expect ppl to cook). The view was stunning, as we had a relatively large balcony with a view of the ocean. The staff was super-friendly, accommodating and helpful--and they don't treat check-in like a cattle call like some other resorts do. They took the time to explain all the amenities the hotel had to offer e.g. morning yoga, free drinks on Fridays, etc, where the beaches are, etc. The lobby was breathtaking--open air with a view of the ocean, waterfalls, koi fish ponds. They have continental breakfast every morning which is basic but has little touches that make it good like their fresh baked breads and guava juice. You also see the attention to detail like orchids placed around the property and staff constantly cleaning throughout the day. The pools--clean, not a lot of people and very quiet. This is very different than the Grand Wailea where there are a ton of people and just too much stimulation. My daughter loved wading in the pools here without having to worry that another kid was going to knock her over. Probably not a place for big families as my 3 yo daughter was the only child we saw the whole time, but she is relatively quiet so it was fine and this environment definitely suited her (and us, the parents) better. I could see how we might feel self conscious if our family was louder. Saw a lot of couples. Oh, and one last thing, the beach is not right there, there is a free shuttle (Cadillac Escalade) that takes you there, which might be a hindrance to some, although to us it was not a big deal. All in all, a great stay! For the price (even without a deal), I would come back here in a heartbeat over the other Wailea hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel a little way from the beach and local amenities”
Reviews.Author: Chelmsfordtraveller
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel September 2011 for 9 nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel is beautiful, very quiet lovely apartment style rooms and set in wonderful grounds. The staff were very helpful, there is a shuttle service which will take you anywhere in the immediate local area of Wailea however it is important to know that you are quite a walk away from anywhere including the beach and so we did use the shuttle regularly to get to the beach, the bus stop (hourly service) and out for evening meals etc. We would definitely recommend hiring a car so that you can go out and about and explore the island. Restaurants in the immediate local area of Wailea are quite expensive. Hotel pool area was nice and very quiet, Breakfast was very nice but it is the same every day so bagels and fresh fruit became a little repetitive.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing beach alternative”
Reviews.Author: glc_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 night late Sept; the 3rd time in 18 mos. It was a bit run down first visit; each visit it has improved noticeably and would now be 4 stars, maybe +. Very large rooms - kitchenette, living room, bedroom and bathroom - and great price for size; stunning south Maui ocean views. Not on the beach but has a beach area on Wailea Beach with free - and very friendly - transport to/from by the bell staff in an Escalade. Quiet pool area with lots of shade available, not at all crowded. Decent free breakfast with coffee, bagels, fruit, juice. Onsite restaurant, Capische, is outstanding but near top of already high Maui prices except for a reasonable happy hour. If you do not need to be on the beach, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Charm”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing weekend at Hotel Wailea. It is a "gem" nestled on the hillside of Wailea. It was the the perfect spot to celebrate a special birthday for our friend. The service was excellent, the dining experience at Capische was incredible, and the overall feeling of the hotel was so incredibly warm and relaxing. There is an intimacy that made me feel as if I was a guest staying at a private estate. As mentioned before, the staff was very friendly and very, very helpful. They went out of their way to help us plan special events ultimately making our memorable and perfect. I also enjoyed the panoramic views of the Ocean/islands and likewise the sunsets. Would highly, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Relax unwind and enjoy the peace and beauty around.”
Reviews.Author: Snowinhawaii
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a beautiful bungalo style room. It was so relaxing and the staff were so helpful and attentive. It was exactly what I was looking for and I only wish we could have stated longer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal resort for couples”
Reviews.Author: SMorovich
Reviews.Content: Excellent, well maintained property for couples. The grounds are beautiful with many places to watch the sun set. Large condo-style rooms with kitchenette. Staff is attentive to your needs. You have access to the Grand Wailea's beach area, but I suggest steering away from it as it is crowded and not very relaxing. The pool area at Hotel Wailea is superior and is just the right size with several available cabanas and lounge chairs. *Partial Ocean View = No view of ocean* **Don't bring children here. You will be dissappointed as there is nothing for them to do, and will disturb others who are trying to get away from their kids.** ***We booked through a third party internet travel site and got a great deal, but found out there was an additional $25 resort fee per day upon arrival. Not a big deal, as the resort fee paid for many items I used, such as parking, WiFi, shuttle service, breakfast, etc. Just an FYI.***

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Oasis”
Reviews.Author: msgenie01
