Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Maui and could not wait to write this review about Hotel Wailea. The hotel, staff, location and service were absolutely fantastic! We did our research before we planned our wedding and honeymoon trip to Maui and all of the great reviews led us to Hotel Wailea. The resort is tucked away on the hillside of Wailea but we did not miss being oceanfront one minute. Though the whole hotel was booked, we felt like we were nestled away on our own private oasis as it was quiet and secluded. No screaming children, no walkerby's as with the oceanfront resorts, no chaos....just pure bliss. From our lanai we could see Molokini, Molokai and Lanai (?) a beautiful sunset ecery evening. The staff at Hotel Wailea was awesome- valets, front desk, poolside attendants & shuttle drivers were all very attentative to our needs and very friendly. This was a great treat & I recommend the hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “A Find in the Hills Above Wailea”
Reviews.Author: tmgarrett
Reviews.Content: A great combination of things you normally don't find together: a condo like suite, but in a hotel like property; a beautiful view, but with none of the noise; access to the beach, but romance and serenity back at your room; luxury in Wailea, but at a better price. The staff were great. Wall Street Journal and continental breakfast, the shuttle took us wherever we wanted to go, the front desk comped us on a bag of fish food (carp in all the pools), the hotel manager went out of his way to make us feel welcome, the masseuse fixed up my plantar fasciitis, and the manager's reception was terrific. All in all, a great place to spend some romantic time with the one you love.

Reviews.Title: “Low key top notch boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luke H
Reviews.Content: By my best guess I don't believe we could have had a better view from our room, the staff has been nothing but helpful and a pleasure. The staff that we have gotten to know a little bit have all said that it's such a pleasure to work for a group of people (owners & management) that really care and allow them to have while they work. It truly shows. From the switch on waterfall in the morning, to the pool, to the restaurant, this property is a gem. We were allowed to join in on a couple yoga classes that were going on with the yoga retreat that had been there all week. We had dinner at Capisce, the hotel restaurant. Holy moly! The mushroom risotto, the Cesar salad, beet salad, spaghetti bolognese, the gnocchi, and last but not least the caramel salted chocolate something something. It all completely blew us away. Seriously, I've never had a better dessert in my life. By the end of the meal I'd have happily paid double. Truly truly delicious. This is a wonderful place. I'll be recommending to all I know. Thank you for everything. Cheers, Luke & Camden

Reviews.Title: “More luxury bang for your buck and gorgeous, peaceful surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: Christinmarie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose Hotel Wailea for our honeymoon and could not stop commenting all week how happy we were with our decisions. The property is incredibly beautiful and peaceful and the staff is super friendly. You get a lot more for your money because it is not right on the beach but it has amazing views of the ocean and the valets will take you to the beach whenever you want. The arrangement with the Grand Wailea to us their beach facilities is nice but could have been better. No one told us they close down at 3 and if they run out of towels/chairs/umbrellas (which they do because they don't have many for Hotel Wailea guests) you are on your own- so get there earlier in the day! The continental breakfast is nice, simple, fresh. It doesn't change so prepare to get tired of it after a few days. Also it is only served between 7:30-9:30. The room was great with a simple, clean aesthetic. We loved the large tub/showers and the kitchen/living room area was quite spacious. We had a partial ocean view and were satisfied. Our lanai received some direct sun in the afternoon which was nice. Overall the place was a beautiful, peaceful retreat. We often felt we had the whole place to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the view for this price!”
Reviews.Author: megs0607
Reviews.Content: The view in the Panaromic room is beautiful. The rooms are HUGE and clean but definitely not dolled up in anyway. To get a room near this size with a decent view at one of the bigger resorts would have easily cost double. The people who work at this hotel treat you like royalty. They will drive you anywhere in town (including the beach!). If you want a quiet getaway with a great view without breaking your pocket this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “When can we go back?”
Reviews.Author: kteacher10
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in panormaic ocean view room. Extra money was worth the view, especially for seeing the sunset. Loved the spaciousness of the room and bed comfort and neat shower, which you can see the ocean from. It was quiet and private. Staff called us a few minutes after checking in to see if all was OK-a nice personal touch. Grounds were beautiful and well kept. We liked the cabanas which weren't crowded. Hot tub was nice. Gym doesn't have much equipment. It'd be nice if the pool were open till ten like the hot tub. The pool is very nice. Great conteinteal breakfast with the classic Hawaiian pog juice. The shuttle service is a great asset. WE used it daily and it was prompt and the drivers were friendly and personal. The private beach access was a huge benefit of staying here as we got chairs, towels. and water and the great view at Wailea beach without paying Grand Wailea prices. There are nice touches on the hotel grounds, even candles lining the lobby and little waterfalls. At check in they take you in a golf cart to your room and they give you water bottles and lavendar scented towels. The room kitchen is nice but needs a microwave (I''m told by other reviews that you could get one at the front desk but no one tells you this). Looking at the pictures from our trip reminds us of how beautiful this place is and we hope to someday return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 58Kara
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Had a great time and are planning to come back when we can. Great staff who cared and made it really special. Loved the resteraunt. Worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, romantic, idealic, peaceful, heavenly!!”
Reviews.Author: sarah5320
Reviews.Content: First of all, any previous reviews that are negative in any shape or form and state they should have stayed at the Grand Wailea, then there are crazy!! The hotel grounds are perfectly manicured, fresh flowers lining pathways, stairways etc. I even made my wedding bouquet from these freshly picked flowers. The hotel is quiet and peaceful, we often had the pool or spa to ourselves. The Grand on the other hand looked like a zoo filled with children running around. We were treated by the staff on a personal level, not as a number like some big chain hotels. The rooms, massive!!! Living area with a big lanai equipped with sun loungers. The living area had a sofa, tv, dining table and coffee table. The kitchen had a fridge and basic cooking facilities but with all the fine dining options in the area; who wants to cook anyway? The bathroom was fantastic, huge walk in shower, big deep tub. Previous reviews have complained about the privacy of the bathroom as it is open but you can shut it off from the main living areas so not a problem. There is a separate toilet. Also a huge sink area with mirror for getting ready. The wardrobes are massive too. We had 2 large cases and 2 small ones and could easily store them inside. The bedroom also has lots of draws for storage, a tv and the most comfortable big bed I have ever slept in. We had a seaview, well worth the extra money, the sunsets from the lanai are amazing. I was getting married whilst staying at the hotel and they were very helpful with anything I needed. Some previous reviews have also complained about the breakfast. Well let me tell you, it was fabulous. Fresh coffee, tea and juice, Banana bread, mango bread, a choice of several different types of bagels, toast, fresh fruit, jams, phillidelphia etc. We ate late most mornings and they were continuously restocking the food as it ran out. The views from the lobby area were the perfect Way to start the morning. There is a $20 a day resort fee but I think this is standard for the area. But this includes a shuttle service anywhere in the area ( which we made full use of and was very prompt every time) wifi in the rooms, breakfast and valeting. I didn't mind paying for it as wifi alone in some hotels can cost $10 a day!! Trust me I experienced this during our multi destination trip. Parking is also free which can cost in hotels. The pool area was great, with big comfortable cabanas, which were always available. The spa was refreshing at the end of the day and the gym adequate. But if you are a fitness fanatic then the grounds would make a lovely run. I would definitely stay here again, it was a perfect wedding / honeymoon destination. Don't get why others have said they would rather stay at the Grand Wailea. Oh nearly forgot there are complemantary sun loungers, towels and water on the beach down at the Grand Wailea but there are nicer quieter beaches around, hire a car and enjoy the drive around the coastline!! We did the sun rise Haleakala tour, which was out of this world, the road to Hana, which is unmissable and drove to Lahaina, which was well worth it. Didn't rate Capische but other restaurants in the area are Gallons and Joes for fine dining and even Matteos for a budget dinner! This hotel provides a quiet, romantic, beautiful location not directly on the beach, but the views make up for it. If you want the hustle and bustle of a bigger resort and the beach directly outside then stay some where else! Will be back soon hopefully!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our wonderful Honeymoon experience”
Reviews.Author: Percy1981
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon we spent 10 nights at the Hotel Wailea. The lobby, grounds and garden were all stunning, providing beautiful views as the hotel is located about a mile inland and elevated slightly. Our room was very nice, plenty of room and even with just a partial ocean view room we had a fantastic view of the gorgeous Maui sunset every night. The hotel was very quiet, relaxing and perfectly suited for couples honeymooning/on anniversary. Contrasted with the Grand Wailea which seemed like a packed theme park in comparison, i'm very glad we choose the Hotel Wailea for the type of holiday we were after. The service was superb with all the staff happy to help us get the most out of our stay, especially the ladies at the reception desk! The on site restaurant Capische is very good although slightly pricey especially when compared with our favourite in the area, Monkeypod Kitchens. The food we had there was absolutely fantastic and the atmosphere was great. We went back there for our last night and it was again superb. (especially the Mahi Mahi Ponzo)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and tranquil with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Recoveringlawyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. They are not on the beach and it is a hike down(actually back up), so take their shuttle. For the cost, a good Wailea value. Pay the extra for an ocean view because it is a real one and not just a sliver of water.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Aqua Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikediliberto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Wailea during our recent wedding anniversary trip to Maui. First, let me start off that we are both big fans of the Aqua hotels group, and have stayed with them in several different locations. So much so that a few years ago, when we were married on the beach in Oahu, we all stayed in the Aqua Aloha Surf in Waikiki. For the uninitiated, the Aqua formula is simple. They take great properties that are usually getting on a bit in age, and transform them into unique hotels and resort properties. Some of the other reviews here make comparisons to the Four Seasons or the Grand Wailea, but it is apples and oranges. If you're looking for a self contained resort, where you can arrive and stay on the property for a week without running short of things to do, then no, this hotel may not be for you. On the other hand, as a quiet home base from which to explore Maui, the Hotel Wailea was exactly what we were looking for. The Hotel Wailea is another fine example of the Aqua formula. A former club catering to Japanese tourists, the hotel is very spread out, which makes it seem that you might have the whole property to yourself. Several times my wife and I wondered aloud whether there was anyone else in the building with us. For those of you coming to Maui to escape the crowds, Hotel Wailea may be the answer. Each of rooms has a small kitchenette area, with a fridge and two burner stove. On request the hotel will bring a set of pots, pans, dishes, and a microwave. For those of you planning a long stay, the fridge is a bit on the small side; we used it to keep some eggs and juice handy for our in-room breakfasts. While we are on the subject of breakfast, there is a free continental breakfast in the lobby, fruits, bagels, toast, and the all-important coffee. As other reviewers have mentioned, it is a basic breakfast, which is why we paired it with some freshly scrambled eggs and juice back in our room. I could probably write an entire review just on the restaurant, Capiche? Now, as an Italian, I am wary of restaurants with funny Italian names. My fears, it turns out, were completely unfounded. The food was all good, however the best parts were the appetizer and desserts. Not that the entree was bad, it's just that it didn't stand out as a meal I would remember for months after eating it. The pumpkin gnocchi and creme brulee, on the other hand, are out of this world. The hotel is up the hill a bit from the much more developed beachfront, and I would venture to say it is out of reasonable walking distance, however there is a free shuttle that is on call to take guests around to the beach or pretty much anyplace in town.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travel_london_se1
Reviews.Content: There are so many great things about this hotel â€“ but, unfortunately, there are more things which are pretty bad. Letâ€™s start with the good things. Itâ€™s a beautiful hotel in a stunning location. As a middle aged couple it didnâ€™t matter to us that the hotel is not right on the beach and we loved sitting on the huge balcony, stretched out on the loungers and enjoying the fantastic view over the ocean. After we did a whale watching trip we discovered that we could easily see whales from the balcony! The room was very spacious with a little kitchenette, a dining table with four chairs, and a large sofa. The bathroom was large with a bath and walk-in shower with the toilet in a separate room. The public areas are beautiful but essentially useless. There is tons of space but nowhere that you would want to sit. Now for the problems. We had a kitchenette with a sink, a small fridge and two rings to cook on. There were plates and cutlery but no cooking utensils. Why bother to provide cooking facilities but nothing to cook with. Oddly, when we rang to ask for a few pots and pans they said they didnâ€™t know whether they could find any. How odd. We were told that a free breakfast was available. Well â€“ sort of. It amounted to a trestle table set up in the lobby with some thermos flasks of coffee plus a few bagels. It looked as if someone from town was coming in to earn a bit of extra money. When we checked out we discovered a $20 per day â€œresortâ€� charge added to the bill. What for? They said it was to cover the cost of parking, internet, breakfast, the shuttle bus, etc. etc. The receptionist said, first that there was nothing they could do about it and then that most hotels in Wailea impose this charge. I found this charge to be underhanded and very bad practice. If they had just charged me $20 a day more for the room and given me â€œfreeâ€� internet and shuttle bus (we didnâ€™t use the parking or the shuttle) I would have thought it was great. However, by trying to hide this charge I was furious when it suddenly appeared on the bill. For people on a budget who may have chosen this hotel based on price this could be a very nasty shock. Looking online it could well be true that this is common practice in Wailea. In that case, my advice is enjoy Maui (which is fantastic) but donâ€™t stay in Wailea. Theyâ€™ll quote you one price and then hit you with a lot of hidden charges.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: janice282
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was an all-suite hotel and the rooms were great but the outside reminded me of my dormitory back in college. They have open showers- no doors- just a tub and a stand up shower next to it and mirrored closet door right in front. It was kind of sexy being that we were on our honeymoon but you do want some privacy when you're washing up. The pool was very disappointing - very small nothing fancy. There was nothing wrong with the hotel - the staffs were friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and nice but there just wasn't anything special. Nothing that really makes you say WOW (except for the shower with no doors) The closest beach is right in front of Grand Wailea hotel and they drive you there in an excalibur but it still was a hassle. Kinda made us wished we were staying at Grand Wailea ( their pool is like a waterpark!) There is a restaurant called Monkey Pod on the way in to the resort and it's the best meal we had in Hawaii. Their fish sandwich (which they use different fish everyday - the freshet one) is AMAZING. We went there twice during our 6 day stay and we tried rock shrimp & calamari, their oven baked pizza, fish taco, macademia nut crusted shrimp -all AMAZING. Good margarita too

Reviews.Title: “We will come back”
Reviews.Author: BumBleB83
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay and we will come back soon.. Front desks were very helpful. Spa and the gym were very big..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and staff, so-so room”
Reviews.Author: mickmimi
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for a week in Hotel Wailea last month. The grounds of the Hotel were very nice, and the staff was excellent; everyone was very very friendly. Overall, a pretty good value for the price, but now for the cons - 1. Room is very average, and it needs a refresh. Our room included a very small kitchen, but the stove looked to be very small (2 electric burners) 15 - 20 years old. The refrigerator was tiny; enough to keep a few groceries, and some drinks, but you can't stock up on groceries for the week. The beds were small, and somewhat uncomfortable. The room includes an odd layout. There was no door between the shower and the bedroom; not a big deal, but at times, was an inconvenience. 2. The pool - very very average. Just a basic, average-sized pool; no waterfalls, slides; nothing special. We didn't use the pool during out stay. 3. The gym - included a bow-flex with missing parts, and an elliptical machine. Not a big deal, since we snorkeled and hiked for exercise, but was expecting a bit more for a resort-type hotel. 4. Location - about 1 mile from the beaches. Our balcony did have a partially blocked ocean view, which was nice, but it would have been nice to be a bit closer. Aside from the restaurant in the hotel, the closest places to eat were about 1/2 mile away. Very very quiet location. 5. Breakfast - a nice touch, but only bagels, banana bread, sliced pineapple, and juice/coffee. Got old by day 3. So a mixed review.. very nice hotel grounds, great staff, but location was a little too quiet for us, and some things needed to be updated. Overall, for the price, not a bad deal, but nothing memorable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would love to come back.”
Reviews.Author: Liz58Aust
Reviews.Content: Top hotel, great views and helpful staff. Great price. Would definitely love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Hope to be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_Muska
Reviews.Content: If you want to get away from the "resort feel" this is the perfect place.The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The views are spectacular. Very friendly staff! Special thanks to Emily Heider for going above and beyond to make our honeymoon unforgettable! The bed was extremely comfortable, we want to purchase one for our home. The I-Pod dock was nice to have; it's nice having your favorite music to listen to when on vacation. I see that some people have complained about the beach access and breakfast below and I would have to disagree. The hotel provides a shuttle or you could even go to many beaches nearby in your rental car. Breakfast was a selection of fresh fruit, breads, bagels, juice, and hot tea. The food was light and refreshing, it didn't weigh you down for the remainder of your day. In summary, us newlyweds enjoyed our stay at Hotel Wailea and will be back in the future. Thanks again for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bywalker
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we stayed at. The view was great, the staff was great and the price was fantastic. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: smarsman
Reviews.Content: This property offers spacious suites with nice views, kitchens and bathrooms. It is slightly warn but in good condition. The pool is nice but the gym is meager, without any free weights and only one Bowflex machine and some cardio equipment. Nevertheless, we took a very good yoga class that was part of the resort offering. It is about a five minute ride to the beach where they have facilities that are shared with another one of their properties, so there are towels, chairs and lounges available as well as a shuttle service back and forth. It is not as convenient as staying on the beach itself, but it's about half the price so if being on the beach is not the priority, this will cost you about half as much as the hotels on the beach in this area. They serve a continental breakfast which is okay. We were there during the height of Hayden mango season and there are many trees on the property that had hundreds falling off the trees, but none on the buffet! The service was very good. Everyone was friendly and helpful. I recommend with the aforementioned caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet place to enjoy Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Texexs82
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui many times and have usually stayed at the Kea Lani. We decided to try something different this time since it was just the two of us. We were very pleased with our stay. The room was clean, maid service was excellent, the staff was always nice and helpful. You will walk a lot to and from your room, but the grounds are beautiful. Not a lot of kids, which was great. The property was very quiet. Since this is no longer a place that caters to the Japanese market per se, there are a few things they should westernize. A real hot tub ,wet sauna would be nice and the ability to have access to food and drinks in a non Capische environment would really add to the property. We highly recommend Hotel Wailea, especially if you aren't traveling with kids. We will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accomodating staff, thank you..”
Reviews.Author: Goozie40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few days after spending a week on Kannapali Beach at the Hyatt... This property was much more quiet and quaint than our previous accomodations. We planned this to be the "relaxing" segment of our trip. Free Mai Tais by the pool. We met the owner on our first day, who just happened to be in town visiting the premises.. He was very cordial and friendly, asking the bartender to pass out another free round of Mai Tais.. ;) This used to be a private country club, so the grounds are spread out. Accomodations consist mostly of "quad style" condo units. Our bathroom was huge; the living area faced the ocean, and we had a small kitchen and patio area where we could watch the sunset. The "free" breakfast consists of bagels, fresh breads, coffee and juices.. Plenty to eat, and completely satisfactory. We ate at their restaurant, Capische, one night (DELICIOUS truffle risotto!!).. A romantic view from the outside area is prime.. Get reservations! Good service. We enjoyed a day at the nude beach several miles down the street (great people watching, btw).. Had some issues with neighboring guests who were staying in a room below us. I called the front desk to complain at least 3 times btw 2-4am because the guests were loud, playing music and yelling during of the early morning hours. I assume the front desk eventually took care of the problem because we never heard anything more about it. THE MOST WONDERFUL thing about this hotel that I can report is: I accidentally left a beautiful, new bathing suit in thier spa area after taking a shower the day we flew back to the mainland.. I didn't realize it until the next day when I was unpacking. I called the hotel, and thankfully, they had found it! More than that, they immediately put it in the mail and returned it to me in North Carolina.. For this reason alone, I will revisit this Hotel when I return to Hawaii in the future. I was really impressed with the customer service.. We thought the price was very reasonable for Hawaii.. The units are a tad dated, but completely clean and satisfactory. If you want to pay $800/nt for complete luxury, stay at the Four Seasons down the street.. Otherwise, Hotel Wailea was fine. Thank you..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; a couple things to know”
Reviews.Author: steve-h132
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located away from the beach and shopping malls so it is quiet. The landscaping is lush and beautiful. The staff was helpful and the rooms were very clean. The property is on a hill, so it would be difficult for guests with low mobility, but the staff would gladly give a ride in the electric carts. The property was originally a private club for Japanese tourists. This explains the onsite onsen bath and the toilet seats as well as the open shower for washing before using the tub. But since it is no longer focused on the Japanese market some things are missing. The washing stations at the onsen mostly didn't work, and there was no stool or bucket to sit on; plus most westerners don't know to wash before entering the bath. Also, the water temperature was only lukewarm, probably another concession to western tastes. The pool was a favorite hang out with comfortable cabana's. It was popular with kids as well, but it was not a as big as some more family oriented places. There was a small two burner kitchen in the room, but no microwave or pots and pans. You could ask for pans but we never bothered.

Reviews.Title: “DeLuxe with few kids - "Perfection."”
Reviews.Author: Shuguh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 29th of June through the 6th of July and love love loved it. This hotel is perfect if you are going to have an active vacation on Maui but still want a sumptuously comfortable bed at the end of the day with a minimum of keiki ("children"). We saw the sunrise on Haleakala, we drove the road to Hana, we scuba dived two days and it was such a pleasure to come back to the hotel, head directly to the spa and watch the sunset while soaking in warm water. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful and warm, and when there was a slight mix-up with the valet, they left us a little something in our room that evening which was very sweet. The hotel offered complimentary yoga classes on Wednesday and Thursday which we found to be of a high quality, especially in light of varying levels, languages spoken, etc. In fact, we met the rather fetching GM of the property in a yoga class. On the downside, there is very little food and beverage on-site. The breakfast is rather "continental" [read: sparse] but it didn't matter to us as we were usually long gone by the time it was served. We dined most nights in Kihei and with some cross-referencing between Trip Advisor and Yelp we had a 100% success rate with meals of varying styles and service levels. We "splurged" and went to The Four Seasons for breakfast on the last day before our flight and we were shocked [SHOCKED!] by how many kids, sorry, rich kids, there were at the hotel and how much the hotel catered to that market. It made us appreciate the fact that we had not spent oodles of money to stay there on "Sesame Street: Five Star Edition." Hotel Wailea was the perfect choice for us, and, by far, the best hotel we stayed at in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find and a great alternative to over priced over crowded Wailea mega resorts.”
Reviews.Author: Tlucas7
Reviews.Content: This is a bit of heaven on heavenly Maui. The whole experience is lush, lovely,relaxing, and amazing. The only downside is that some of the furniture needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in Need of Updates”
Reviews.Author: Jacob154943
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was lovely. If you want the BIG Chain hotel experience then this place may not be for you. This is a boutique style hotel, so expect everything to be down scaled but personalized. The location of the hotel is a little far from the main Wailea area where all the other big hotel chains are, but not too far â€“ either 5 minute car ride or 30 minute walk! We liked that it was removed from the big hustle and bustle of the Wailea Beach area. The hotel room was a little out dated particularly the bathrooms. The floors and mouldings need to be cleaned better. I wore socks the entire time I was in the room as I wasnâ€™t comfortable walking barefooted. There was a collection of dust and debris along the wall mouldings and behind where the end tables were. Our bed sheets had some stains on it, but I am assuming they were clean sheets but the stains didnâ€™t come out from cleaning?! The amenities in the room such as free internet, Aveda bath products, and free bottle water upon arrival in the room, and bathrobes were nice touches. The fans and air conditioning were well appointed and the bed was extremely comfortable. The kitchen area was a waste of space in our opinion. The overall room was very spacious and quiet (top floor room). The fitness center equipment is in need of updating. Two of the machines (elliptical and treadmill) werenâ€™t fully functional. I brought it up to an attendant that happened to be there and he said that both of the machines are working now and then left. The elliptical machine by the window was still out of order and the treadmill defaulted to a set program that you needed to override every few minutes. Regardless I still appreciated having some fitness equipment then not. It was also nice that they had a fruit infused ice cold water cooler available for your workout. The pool area a good size, and the pool chairs and cabana beds were comfortable and well maintained. The complimentary shuttle services and daily activities they offered were great. It was nice not to have to drive after dinner especially if you want to have a few glasses of wine and cocktails. You may have to wait 10-15 minutes for your shuttle to pick you up, but it is better than waiting an hour or two until you sober up to drive. We enjoyed the Honolulu coffee and continental breakfast items (bagels, oat cakes, juice, and fresh fruit). If you have too many choices and overabundance of items to choose from, people will generally eat too much and waste food. This will keep you waste line trim for the beach! Plus it is free so what do you expect!! The staff was friendly and pleasure to deal with. I am big on client services and won't tolerate rude, pretentious, and apathetic hotel staff. Bad service can ruin your entire stay and taint your experience in my opinion. We didnâ€™t experience any hotel staff like this at the hotel. The friendly and personal hotel staff, complimentary services and amenities (shuttle service, bathrobes, bath products, etc.), well maintained, quiet, and beautiful hotel grounds, and size of the hotel made up for the not so updated rooms. We will most likely consider this hotel for the future.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular quaint upscale property”
Reviews.Author: jab236
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the lobby with this magnificaent view, until we left we were very pleased with the room staff grounds and amenities. secluded gem close to everything but far from the bustling crowd

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Rayodeso
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a nicer place in all my trips to Maui. We had a great stay in a room that was perfectly set up for even longer stays which included a kitchen. We had the most excellent maid service. The poo,l and especially the child's pool, were just excellent as well. My Granddaughter had so much fun we had trouble getting her out when it was time to go back to the room. She didn't want to leave. From the very first day at checking in to our last, I cannot say what a great place the Hotel Wailea was. Their staff was very professional and I would recommend this Hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: tarrahhartley
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon week in Maui and I can't even express how happy I am that we stayed at the Hotel Wailea. The atmosphere is completely romantic and gorgeous! We had found a great flight/room honeymoon package online and had booked an "ocean view" suite. As we were checking in the receptionist congratulated us and even commented at how pretty my ring was (even if they do this for everyone, it was still very nice of her!) I'm pretty sure they upgraded us to "panoramic ocean view" also (which was AMAZING!) It is away from all of the crazy, crowded, children-filled resorts that are down by the beach (we were SO GLAD that we hadn't gone with these once we saw them in person!) The staff are so friendly that by the end of the week many even knew us by name. The facilities are unbelievable as well with amazing ocean views from not only the lobby, but the restaurant and even the workout-spa areas. Perks: We only saw two kids the entire week!!!!! Laundry room on site that takes quarters In suite mini kitchen-even a small stove top! (So stock up at costco on your way from the airport!) Amazing views & relaxing atmosphere Free poolside cabanas Spa treatments (with discounts for hotel guests) Free continental breakfast daily Free valet (but you should still tip!) Free shuttle to the Grand Wailea's private beach (which also has free umbrellas and chairs that they will set up for you as a Hotel Wailea guest!) The restraunt is a bit pricey, but worth it for the views and amazing food! We went once for a special night out. The only drawback for some people may be that it is about a 5 minute drive from the beach, but like I said before, there is a free shuttle that will take you there and you have full use of the Grand Wailea's private beach area including free setup of umbrella and chairs. We found this to be a benefit though after seeing how insanely crowded the beach resorts are! Perfect for a honeymoon or relaxing getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain, Great Location, A Little Shabby Here/There”
Reviews.Author: WashDCMan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea will appeal to travelers who value things like the ability to self-park your car and wash your own laundry--and who can overlook little pockets of occasional shabbiness among what is overall a very comfortable hotel in a great location, with beautiful scenery. The landscape, lobby, and views are gorgeous. The property has lots of flowers and waterfalls everywhere. The bellhops are genuinely nice and will engage you in real conversation about Maui if you show an interest. The front desk folks also had a great attitude and good sense of humor. The rooms? It depends on what your expectations are. We had a "renovated" room with a kitchenette. It reminded me a little of a budget ski chalet rental. The carpet was clean and free of tears, though it was a kind of low-knap industrial weave. The view out the window (especially the sunset) was amazing, and you have your own terrace. We had a large, open shower and separate bathtub and, in a separate tiny room (Japanese style) the toilet. Everything worked great. That said: A close look at the sink showed its finish was peeling on the inside. The landline phone didn't seem to work (though who uses a landline anymore?). The cable TV had "blank" channels on it (so I re-autoprogrammed it). There was a kitchen, but the fridge was so small that we couldn't fit a half-gallon tub of ice cream in the tiny freezer. The floor-length accordion shutters over the sliding glass door didn't shut all the way because of a protruding screw. The room was also a bit removed from the main area with the lobby and the parking lot. Not horribly so, but just enough to be slightly annoying. But it has to be that way when the hotel consists of quad-plex townhouse-style clusters, instead of a giant tower served by an elevator. And the bellhops do have golf carts. But the bed was great. The shower was great. It was quiet (other than the noise one morning from a street-sweeper truck driving on the small street along the back of the resort). We had the kitchenette there, should we have chosen to use it. (Fair warning: It's not much more than a tiny sink, a hot plate, and a dorm fridge. You can get them to deliver a microwave. No idea why they don't just leave the microwaves in the rooms. Maybe they're low on microwaves.) Don't know about wi-fi, but they have a free business center where you can print your boarding pass. And best of all, the price of $140/night via Jetsetter was fantastic. It's the only reasonably affordable option in Waliea. We were a quick drive from several beaches. The pool had plenty of shade and nice pool furniture, and they even showed a movie there on Saturday night. (Alas, it was "Rush Hour.") Is there a lifeguard? No. You should know how to swim or stay out of the water. It's a pool, not the ocean. I will say that management should give strong consideration to turning that unused kiddie pool into a hot tub. There's a small on-site laundromat right by the pool; I loved being able to wash clothes on vacation. Really lets you pack lighter. I loved being able to park our rental car--and on Maui, you NEED a rental car unless you want to spend your entire time at the hotel. Hotel Wailea does have a few reserved umbrellas at the multi-hotel Wailea Beach. It's a quick ride on the hotel shuttle. Once you get there, you have to go to the correct beach stand to ask for towels and then go to the right area. But Big Beach, a short drive from the hotel, is much less crowded and low-key. By the way, If you stop at the fruit stand near Big Beach, ask for prices first! I paid $10 for a coconut. Speaking of overpriced food: We skipped eating at Capische, because I'm not paying $40 a plate for Italian food. And I'm not eating at a restaurant whose name is an expression used on Jersey Shore. It's true that Hotel Wailea's free breakfast is nearly the same every day--but hey, it's a free breakfast! And it was pretty good: bananas, pineapple, papaya, coffee, a couple of kinds of juice, banana bread, several types of bagels--all included. What are people expecting for free? An omelette station? Steak and eggs? Come on! Keep in mind that at the $400/night Grand Wailea nearby, breakfast is on your dime. If you go in expecting the sheen of the Four Seasons, Kimpton, or W, you're going to be disappointed and angry. If you have read my entire review and can handle the quirks--if you value the money-saving amenties over a sense of luxe poshness--then Hotel Wailea is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise NOT found! Poor maintenance hastening its way downhill!”
Reviews.Author: Zardoz02
Reviews.Content: As an owner of a timeshare condo in Maui, I wanted to extend our week by a day and try a hotel in the upscale Wailea area. Previously, I had stayed for two weeks at the once amazing Renaissance Wailea, which no longer exists. If you aren't aleady aware, Wailea is a very exclusive resort area, and in my mind the beaches are second to none in Maui because they are protected coves with great privacy, excellent snorkeling, and less intense wave action than some of the other beaches. Other hotels in the area include the elite Four Seasons, the grandiose Grand Wailea, and the beautiful Fairmont. In all fairness, I had no expectations of the Hotel Wailea being close to the above three, since its nightly rate was about half of the others, but was hoping to be pleasantly surprised. My wife has been to Hawaii nearly twenty times, and stayed at many of the notable hotel/resorts, so I really hoped the Hotel Wailea would be a nice surprise. Initial Impressions: Easy to find, beautiful upscale Wailea area, nice private drive and easy parking. Nice breezy and island modern architecture of the main building with its open floorplan and scenic rotundas. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Bellhops were friendly and available, and drove golf carts to ferry guests and luggage to their rooms. Very good initial impression. The grounds: On the way to the room, one had to admire the beautiful grounds. Not so well maintained as the other big hotels, but very nice with waterfalls, wooden bridges, streams, hedgerows, colorful crotons, hibiscus, and other tropical foliage giving a very naturalistic island feel. Cut flowers were strewn everywhere, literally on every step on the staircases. The room, initial impression: At first, the room appeared very nice. It was on the second floor of what were essentially four-unit bungalows facing the ocean, on the manicured grounds. Nice direct ocean view from the lanai, but since the hotel is not on the beach, but a few blocks away and up on a hill, it was a bit distant and obscured by trees. The room appeared clean, but the furniture and fixtures were pretty old and a bit shabby, clearly close to the end of their usable life. Aveda bath products. Overall, passable at first impression, but buoyed a bit by friendly staff and the pretty landscaping. Restaurant, Capische: The Restaurant was interesting: only open for dinner so no lunch available (except room service), small (basically just a long balcony), five star prices ($40+ for any entree, a la carte), they are not kidding about the romantic view at sunset (amazing!), poor service with somewhat disorganized college kids?, bartender was very friendly and efficient, food was somewhere between a strong good and very good, but not excellent. On our walk from our room to the restaurant, there were no signs on how to get there, so just followed the pathway up toward where the restaurant was. In doing so, we accidentally entered the first floor, looking for a stairway or elevator, but instead found an empty second restaurant (Japanese) that was no longer in business. Beautiful empty room, but adjacent to this was a private dining for Capische, with tableside hibachi grills (their advertised private event space, apparently). What was pretty off-putting was that the private room was full of dirty dishes and a mess from some previous party, and no one to clean it up. Major thumbs down for cleanliness there, but this was not intended for our viewing - though no signs directed us to the correct pathway up to the restaurant. Prior to the setting sun, we noticed that bar area was slightly run down with peeling paint. Our waiter was in a hurry, unhelpful, and had no interest in making our experience special. I must say, however, the table next to us had a great waiter, and we listened to his descriptions of the entrees to order. I had the pork chop, wife had the chicken with ratatouille. I must say that I would give the restaurant a 3/5 only due to its good food, and view; however, with the strict note that cleanliness is very suspect, but mainly due to its association with the hotel. The Chef, if a rising star as claimed, should find a new location independent of the hotel. Later impression of the room, the next day: After more time in the room, the initial impression wore off and we started noticing the hallmark feature of the Hotel Wailea, poor maintenance in every way. The restaurant hinted of that, but now we were sure. The linens were old and stained, my wife would not sit on the couch because it looked really worn and old (think college dorm), the TV while new hung crooked on its bracket (and could not be straightened), and the large room was only cleaned enough for a first impression - it was actually pretty dirty, and not acceptable for longer than a one night stay. The shower was totally inoperable, and a large patch of black dirt was on the shower floor, uncleaned. Upon close inspection, the room was outdated, furnishings and fixtures were old with worn finishes, and overall the room had a grungy feeling that creeped my wife out. My wife, an early riser, received an angry call from the neighbors after making a cell phone call from inside our room, to be quiet - obviously the walls were paper thin. Some of the other guests looked like they were attending the local Harley Fest, with head to toe tattoes, not exactly the typical Wailea resort clientelle. Post-initial impression was of poor maintenance. Breakfast: Cream cheese, bagels, and banana bread kind of like the continental breakfast at a Motel 6. Coffee was not even warm, but cold. Bad coffee, in Hawaii? (This explains a lot about the place). My wife got food poisoning shortly after eating the banana bread, and was really, really ill for most of our second day in Hawaii. The only places we had eaten were Capische the night before, and she ate the "breakfast." Avoid the breakfast like the plague. Park at the Shops at Wailea and grab a bite there or walk to the Grand Wailea for a five star breakfast. Work-out room: My wife, who works out a lot at Lifetime Fitness, tried to use the beautiful workout room, advertised as "new" on the Hotel's web site. The machines were almost all non-functional, including a treadmill that mysteriously would increase speed from 1mph to 7mph in order to try to introduce your to the wall. Another guest from NY was there, and could not use the machines either. False advertising here, broken machines. Staff: Like a ghost town, there is almost no staff to speak of at all at this hotel. Either they don't exist, or they were hiding. Front desk good, bellhops great (friendly, fast, and helpful), restaurant waiters average, and no other employees seen anywhere during our stay. Spa: Spa looked huge and nice, but again looked a bit run down with some tiles coming off the wall. It was totally empty the three times we entered to check it out. Pool: Looked beautiful like the pics on the web, but was not maintained. No pool staff at all, no lifeguard. Pool furniture was nice, but starting to look a bit soiled. Many, many tiles were missing from the pool (a shame since initially it had those beautiful Italian glass mosaic tiles), and a huge black bug hung under the lip of the pool near the drain, making my wife cringe. We were at the pool for maybe three hours. The pool bar had no food menu, nor was any employee staffing it, except a girl who we some enter the bar toward the end of our time there, but never saw here again. Looking behind the bar revealed no beer or wine, taps, or anything else besides some towels and a single Igloo cooler. Bar: Restaurant Capische has the only "real" bar in the hotel, besides room service, and its only open for dinner. The pool bar was no bar at all. Public restrooms (pool, lobby, restaurant): horrible, as dirty and run down as high school or roadhouse restrooms, shameful of a hotel in this area. Inexcusable and disgusting. Maintenance: despite what was already mentioned, from which you should get a good idea on why to avoid this place, it must be said that during the time we stayed at the Hotel Wailea, one day and part of another (mostly staying on hotel grounds), we never saw any maintenance personnel or management at all. No maids, no groundskeepers, no serving staff cleaning up the private dining room, no janitors, no security, no pool cleaning, no tower person, no nothing. Either the hotel has laid everyone off, or Management has decided that the slow decline into a skeleton staff and increasingly obvious poor maintenance and facility damage were a good selling point for repeat guests. Conclusion: The biggest tragedy about the Hotel Wailea is that the property is a million dollar gold mine of beautiful vistas, already-there landscaping, and nice architecture - why Management is throwing that all away and wasting its amazing potential is beyond me. I did see two new Cadillac Escalades in the parking lot to be used as guest shuttles. Whoever decided that Aveda products, Escalades, flowers everywhere were enough window dressing to merit guests repeating their stay ... that person cannot see the forest for the trees! Advice: Avoid for a better hotel, and certainly don't stay long - one day was too much for us! If you can grab a discount rate at the Fairmont or Hyatt (wife later found out rooms were similarly priced here, and hotel was beautiful, restaurants very good too).

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl30
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when my husband planned a surprise trip to Maui. When we pulled up to the hotel it was very cute. The women at the front desk was friendly and I really was looking forward to the experience. Then we got to our room. It was just okay. The shower was a little dirty but I figured it was just an oversight. Little did I know it didn't work and a shower was not in my future. We also experienced rude neighbors, which is not the hotels fault but made the stay less enjoyable. We went to the hotel restaurant...don't bother I suggest spending the money you would use at this so so restaurant at one of the other fabulous hotels in the area. This place is so not worth it. Which leads to my next suggestion, update your gym with machines that work. I am a marathon runner and work out everyday so I was excited to use the hotels facilities. Only problem was that only 1 machine worked. Also the pool was nice but needed some fixing. It was missing many tiles. The breakfast there although a nice idea it was not the greatest and I also would suggest going somewhere else do to lack of choice. This was an experience I do not plan on repeating and will definitely be staying at 1 of the finer hotels from now on. If you don't mind the old not updated hotel you may have a better experience. In my opinion however I would choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne_Schiff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel many times in the past and we love it here because it is very quiet and peaceful. The grounds are very well kept, and the staff is extremely friendly. This hotel is not located right on the beach, but the staff has a golf cart that can drop you off and pick you up from the beach if needed. They changed the Japanese spa a few years ago. It is now co-ed, and it is nice because you can enjoy the spa with your spouse. The beds are extremely comfortable. They have remodeled the rooms, but the only recommendation I would suggest is that they add a glass door back on to the shower to keep the steam and water confined. Our flight did not leave until 9:30PM and the staff held our luggage while we were at the beach all day. Please keep in mind that there is a resort fee, which includes parking and use of the pool and spa. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel given the high costs”
Reviews.Author: BruschettaLover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Wailea for 6 nights during our honeymoon in Hawaii. We were really excited given the excellent reviews here on Tripadvisor, but were disappointed about the value we received for our money - which was next to none. We had paid for a partial oceanview room, and the first room we were given had a view of the back of a row of hotel units and no ocean was visible. We requested a change and were moved to the only other room they had available - it was a lovely gardenview room, and had the tiniest glimpse of the ocean between a couple of palm trees. At least the well-manicured grounds were lovely to enjoy. The room was very clean and huge. As we were out sightseeing most of the time, we barely used all of the space. We had very little and then only intermittent hot water in the shower. The pool area was also very nice and we enjoyed it often. We had a rental car and so did not use the hotel shuttle to go to the beach, but found that while the hotel setting was beautiful, the beach felt far away. That being said, driving to the beach was easy, there was lots of parking available, and we really appreciated having the beach chairs and umbrellas available to us. The beach was gorgeous and was a highlight of our trip. It would be walking distance, if you had time and could stay out in the sun for long periods of time. Another disappointment of staying at the Hotel Wailea was the breakfast. It consisted of the same two kinds of fruit, banana bread, and bagels every morning, with juice & coffee to drink. There was no variety at all. Given that the main staple was the bagels, we had to take to eating elsewhere as the bagels were just too heavy for us to eat every day, and the fruit was not enough. I suppose it depends what you are used to eating every morning, but we were surprised not to see a tiny bit of variety introduced (no muffins, cereals, breads, other kinds of fruit, nothing at all!). We highly recommend splurging on the breakfast at the Grand Wailea, which is delicious and set in a beautiful open-air terrace - well worth the extra money! Also we found the service to be excellent at that resort. That brings us to another surprise - we did not find the staff to be very warm. No one acknowledged our honeymoon, in spite of us mentioning it at the time of booking, and upon our arrival. We realize that most clients staying in Maui are probably on a similar vacation, but while it may not be special to anyone else, it was important to us as we only get to do it once! Nothing about our stay was made to feel "special". While we were treated with courtesy, there was only one staff member, who was previously mentioned in the reviews below, who did behave very proactively to try and make sure we had a great stay in Maui. The other staff at the front desk were less than helpful when approached, and we seemed to always get someone different. We do have some general advice for those of you considering this hotel: - If you want a room with a view, pay more for it and request to be on the upper floor of the vacation units. - If you are staying on the upper level, please be considerate that there are people below you who also want to have a great trip. The buildings are absolutely not soundproof and we were kept awake by some very loud television and party sounds coming from those above us on a couple of nights. The area is very quiet at night, so you will sleep really well if not for loud neighbours. - There is only one bar, on the pool deck, and though it had hours posted, they only opened when there were lots of people enjoying the pool area. Often it would not open until mid-afternoon (sometimes hours later than posted). Be aware that there is room service during the day, but it is really expensive. The restaurant is only open in the evening. - Wailea is an extremely expensive area. Be prepared to pay a lot for your food as well as accomodations. We found that some restaurants were tasty (we loved Pita Paradise) but they were overpriced for the amount of food you received. Capishe, which is located in the hotel, was a lovely evening's experience, but we were disappointed with a very bland main course after enjoying a delicious appetizer. (Being of Italian background, we may be spoiled with better home cooking than most, however). Our advice would be to stay in another area of Maui to try and get better value. We felt that we overpaid for a very mediocre experience. Given the nature of the other hotels in Wailea, we felt as though we were staying at a budget hotel in a 5-star area - not a nice feeling to have on your honeymoon! We felt misled by the Tripadvisor comments: this hotel is NOT a luxury hotel, though the area is a luxury area.

Reviews.Title: “Holy SPA!”
Reviews.Author: travelingprincess3
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hilltop resort and immediately fell in love walking to the open air lobby. I think we could safely judge this book by its cover. We only booked this resort for 2 nights, spending the majority of our time on a different area of the island. I think we all said collectively â€œwhy didnâ€™t we just stay hereâ€� before we even saw our room. The grounds were immaculateâ€¦waterfalls, bridges, lush foliage, and pretty flowers were along the path the golf cart took us to our room. Our building had 4 units, ours on top with a very nice spacious balcony overlooking a pond. We had a one bedroom (with pull out couch in living room), small kitchenette, dining table, and spacious bathroom with a large soaking tub and huge shower. Our room had vaulted ceilings with ceiling fans in both the living room and bedroom. This bed was so comfortable; it was hard to get out of it when the alarm clock went off. The dÃ©cor was updated and the unit was very clean. The pool area was a bit more upscale with the white wicker loungers and 4 poster wicker beds with canopies around the pool with Tiki torches. The best was yet to comeâ€¦the spa! We all wanted to quickly take a peek at the spa before cooling off at the pool. We ended up spending the rest of the evening at the spa. I even heard a â€œwowâ€� out of my 5 year old niece. We initially had the entire facility to ourselves before others found this little piece of heaven. After walking through the modern vanity and massage rooms, we made our way back to the open air cylinder shaped room containing the huge 3-part spa with waterfall, about 15 open shower stalls along the cylinder walls, and rain showerâ€¦.Holy Heaven, I could live here! Starting off in the mosaic spa with mosaic beds, we relaxed our muscles before hitting the rain shower. The rain shower had two mosaic benches to sit while the strong pressured stream massaged your back. This entire are first reminded us of the Turkish bath weâ€™ve experienced in Istanbul. The absolute only thing missing out of this area (besides the masseur in their underwear) would have been the heated marble slab to have made this a Turkish bath. We all ran around trying everything as if we were children who just arrived in the North Pole. The next room over contained some very intriguing showers that Iâ€™ve yet to see similar to a car wash. The water pressure and 100â€™s of jets looked incredibly relaxing, but we couldnâ€™t figure out how to heat the ice cold. We all washed our hair in both the rain shower and in one of the hand held shower heads located in the spa area just to hold on to the smelly good mint shampoo that they had out for the guests to enjoy. We did not eat at the restaurant for lunch or dinner, but did have the complimentary pastries in the morning on the one day we didnâ€™t leave before it began. They had a very nice spread of pastryâ€™s, bagels, fresh fruit, banana bread, juice, and coffee and it was delicious. The only downfall, if you could call it that, is that this is not a beach front property if one is looking for that. However, you can catch the complimentary transportation to the beach at the Grand Wailea. I would highly recommend this resort. You would definitely need a rental staying here as there wasnâ€™t anything in walking distance. If visiting Maui in the future, I would definitely spend time at this resort again....especially the spa!

Reviews.Title: “A Refreshing Paradise and Lush Escape from the Normal Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Morgan1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Wailea for ten days. From the moment you turn in the drive, you know you are about to enter some place amazingly different from the routine hotels you might expect on vacation. The staff is welcoming, helpful, and genuinely friendly in all regards. The ambiance of the resort was a retreat in itself, and the grounds breath-taking. Hotel Wailea has its own orchard...make sure to pick and eat a mango. You will have never tasted anything so divine. The rooms were situated in buildings of four units. They were quiet, clean, and a place we looked forward to coming home-away-from-home to each day. The hotel even provides pots, pans, and dishes if you would like to cook in (the grocery store is just down the road). The view was spectacular, as well as the food. You must try their restaurant Capishe? overlooking the ocean. Morning yoga is offered in an outdoor studio, along with cocktails and entertainment in the evenings. The pool was superb with water and cabanas complimentary to patrons. There are great eateries and shopping nearby too. We absolutley loved our stay here because it was quaint, personal, accomodating, affordable, and beautiful. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: beason26
Reviews.Content: We researched many hotels in Maui and decided on Hotel Wailea. Took the trip for a small private beach wedding and honeymoon. Hotel Wailea met and exceeded our expectations. Great service and the staff was helpful when we needed to find a place to eat or shop. Quiet and friendly. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views, super comfy beds, great service!”
Reviews.Author: motosgurl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with spectacular views. It was perfect and we plan to come back again and again. Quiet escape for pre-wedding and honeymoon. PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “My Choice Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: fatboy1118
Reviews.Content: My Son was married at Hotel Wailea, they made our stay and experience memorable. Hotel staff was more then helpful in all our needs. I personally dealt with Emily and she went overboard to satisfy our needs. If I travel again to Maui, no doubt I will stay at the Hotel Wailea and I will be asking for Emily.

Reviews.Title: “Enoyable experience, relaxing and a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: d_kirk_11
Reviews.Content: We visited at the end of April and booked our trip through Jetsetter. We got a great deal on a panoramic ocean view suite. At check-in, we were told that we had been upgraded, which was odd since I booked the panoramic view suite originally. It seems they may say this to a lot of the guest based on past reviews. The nice receptionist stated we were getting one of the recently renovated suites. It definitely was nice, but based on the hotel's description of the room we were supposed to have 180 degree view of the ocean. We definitely had a great view, but some our view was over their gardens. In addition, I would have preferred to be on the second floor because the sunset view from our lanai was obstructed by a street light. That was kind of a bummer! The bathroom setup was a little odd like other reviewers stated, but we enjoyed the open shower because it made it easy to spray off our feet after the beach. Bed was very comfortable and we slept great. Kitchenette was a microwave and a small refridgerator. One thing that really bothered me though was one of the main recess lighting in our living room buzzed like a insect zapper. We reported this the first day and they said they'll fix it, but it never was fixed. So we just didn't use the light! It had to be a known problem, but would've involved replacing the recess lighting. As for the the hotel staff, they were all very friendly and accommodating (except for the light issue). The pool area was great place to relax with music, drinks, towels and nice cabanas to nap in. A perfect place for couples! The beach accommodations at Wailea Beach were very accessible; they always had an umbrella and lounge chairs available. The hotel itself is not on the beach, but very close to everything in Wailea, plus there is the nice shuttle service with the hotel's Escalade. We went to the Irish restaurant Mulligan's on the Blue and saw their dinner show featuring Willie K. It is a must do in my opinion! The hotel's restaurant Capische was outstanding, but be prepared to pay for it. Make a reservation close to sunset and you won't be disappointed. As for in the future I would definitely stay here again because the price was much more reasonable than other resorts. If you are travelling with kids this wouldn't be the ideal place because there isn't much for them to do. We enjoyed our stay because we saw how chaotic it was at other hotels that catered more to families.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Quiet Family Get Vacation”
Reviews.Author: spaday
Reviews.Content: My family is picky about where we stay. So am I. We researched and chose this hotel within an Orbitz package. We loved this Quiet beautiful hotel; it's waterfalls, lush gardens, and zen lobby/ outdoor spaces. As soon as we arrived from a delayed flight, we were greated with fresh towels, water, and treats. We were taken to our rooms and pleased with how large the floor plan was- Our Ocean View room had a lovely lanai that gave us a picturesque view of the bay, Molokini, and Lanai. Any questions we had were answered quickly by the front desk. We played golf almost every morning; the front desk was able to book our tee times and have the bellboys at our room to take us & our clubs up to the shuttle. Everyone enjoyed the Japanese syle spa- with great sunset views after a hard day. If you have ever been to the Grand Wailea Spa, it is simular in facilities, just smaller and co-ed. Very enjoyable, quiet, relaxing, and not snobby. We used the shuttle and signing privelges at the Grand Wailea- very convienent. Some past reviewers stated they had trouble with the beach and chair, etc. there: Remember you are on vacation, smile and ask for help. Then ask again. Once, I wasn't sure who to ask at the beach, and asked the security guard walking by-... he was so thoughtful he directed us to a Grand Wailea chaise w/ umbrella and called to the waitress for drinks! A stand up man! We ate at the Grand Wailea and the Hotel Wailea- outstanding menu! Everything was delicious! Every morning we enjoyed the continental breakfast in the room or lobby with views of breeching whales at we sipped our coffee, juice, nibbled on bagels, yummy pumpkin bread, and fresh fruit. If you want a hearty breakfast, stroll down to the Wailea Blue Course's Mulligans- very affordable. Makena Resort and Golf Club has a great sunset view and tasty burgers. We did enjoy the manager's social hour by the pool and lobby; also free group yoga by the pool on Tuesdays( Kind & Great Yoga instructors!) This property is being renovated, but our room was clean and new! I think it is a great value for Wailea. We are looking forward to booking our next trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: CubsFanTraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought this was a nice hotel, with friendly staff, great views and a good value for the price, especially for the Wailea area. The hotel is located uphill from the beach, which may be a deterrent if you want to be beach-side, but which we preferred for the great views, amazing sunsets and privacy. The room was spacious and comfortable. Our room (partial ocean view) had a nice view of the water, and a large patio and reclining patio chairs to watch the sunset. The grounds are beautiful, and it is obvious that the grounds keepers work very hard to keep it that way. Breakfast is served in an open air great room with terrific views of the water -- this was a very peaceful way to start our days! I gave Hotel Wailea 4 stars instead of 5 because there are some areas that I thought could use improvement -- (1) There is a small kitchen, but it is not very functional (adding a small microwave and some basic cooking utensils/pots and pans would help); and (2) some areas clearly have not been updated and could use attention (stained carpet in closet, parquet floors in bathroom, peeling shower paint). That said, I still had an enjoyable time at Hotel Wailea and would return on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: BrianG13
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at the hotel. I really wanted to give the hotel a 4.5 b/c it wasn't quite perfect, but it was closer to a 5 than a 4. Overall I had an amazing time. Let's start with the "bad" things, none of which were really bad, but I thought could be improved and were a bit inconvenient. 1) As it's been mentioned several times, the hotel is up a hill from the beach.. the walk down the hill is easy, the walk up is a killer 2) There is only one restaurant on site which is only open for dinner, so if you are hungry anytime after breakfast, there's not a restaurant to eat at. 3) The kitchen's in the units don't have a microwave 4) The TV's don't have DVD players - All this being said, I WOULD COME BACK IN A HEARTBEAT - the minor inconveniences are tremendously outweighed by the positive - 1) Most important - the staff is incredible, so friendly and enjoyable to talk with. By my second day there they were calling me by my last night when they saw me and by day three we were on a first name basis. 2) The bellman/car service - I didn't rent a car while I was there but the shuttle (a cadillac suv) was always available with no more than a 10 minute wait to take me wherever I wanted in Wailea 3) The rooms were huge and the beds comfortable, the fans and AC worked great 4) The balcony was big w/ amazing views 5) The landscaping was beautiful w/ all the flowers and waterfalls 6) The pool, spa and gym area were all more than adequate for a resort 7) It was walking distance to Mulligan's (a great Irish pub w/ live music) and about a mile walk to MonkeyPod (my favorite restaurant I ate at in Wailea). I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Luxury on a Budget.”
Reviews.Author: kenwSanAntonio_Texas
Reviews.Content: This was a great value with a great location. Resort fee well worth the money. Included breakfast, shuttle service, beach chair, umbrella, towels and bottled water.The Staff was very responsive and friendly.Pool and spa were great ( the spa was designed originally as a Japanese bath house so it has a lot of odd showering stations). The refrigerator held a 12 pack of diet coke or beer, container of strawberries, container of sliced pineapple(from Costco) and 6 bottles of water. Exercise room was a disappointment. However I go a 7 day pass to the fitness center at the Grand Wailea resort ($100) which was wonderful and only a short shuttle ride away. The resort is built on a hillside so you are always walking up or down. It is a long walk from the parking lot to your room but that is true at all of the resort at Wailea. Because of my gym clothes I was concerned about a washing machine and dryer. There are 3 washing machines and 3 dryers next to the pool. $2 a load. We took the shuttle to a different Hotel each night for dinner. The prefixed menu at Spago's was a great value. Had to eat between 5:00pm and 6:00pm. We were concerned about the room not being updated (worn carpet) after reading some of the older reviews. Our room had new carpet and I understand all of the rooms have now been updated. Besides the shuttle service, my other favorite perk was the chair on the beach. With signing privileges at The Grand Wailea, you can go to the beach and then eat lunch or go shopping without taking cash or credit cards. The grounds and the views are incredible. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible. Memorable. Unique. Magic. And a value.”
Reviews.Author: patsbass
Reviews.Content: I'm here right now at this magnificent garden/sunset setting at Hotel Wailea listening to some awesome folk music by a ragingly talented guitarist, enjoying a complimentary cocktail watching a magnificent sunset. This boutique hotel is so fantastic and unique and sexy cool. Our room is private, secluded and makes for a most romantic escape away from the resort busy feel. And this is what you want, believe me. You don't need to be on the beach to have the time of your lives. You can stay here on the hill overlooking the ocean, the mountains... WOW, okay?! And then go hang on a local beach we some really great people. We got married on the beach at Po'lenalena Beach by officiant Eve Hogan of Sacred Gardens of Maui and Bill Stockwell photographed us with Irene Ryding on harp. Breathtaking, spiritual, fun, memorable and basically, beyond our wildest dreams and Hotel Wailea is the foundation and icing for all of it The staff is friendly, accommodating. Marcus, the GM, is a sweet, caring person very keen on creating an atmosphere of relaxation, joy, and comfort and it a boutique resort that is a great value. Hotel Wailea staff shuttles us in a Cadillac Escalade where we needed to go. Come on now. How fantastic is that? Every morning a thoughtful complimentary continental breakfast with lovely fruit, fresh sweet breads and bagels, juices and kona coffee. The pool area is clean and quiet and refreshing. The gardens are stunning and well kept and pristine. The rooms are large and comfortable and it's like you're the only ones on the whole property!!!! Ah.....relaxing and charming. The bed is ridiculous! You sink deep into this mattress and billow of pillows and feel every bit of tension drain out of you. I researched for several weeks to choose the right place for our lovely wedding moon and folks....this is magnificent. I'll be leaving more info as the week continues.... We are blown away by this experience and we're travelers so we know what we're talking about... : )

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful but...”
Reviews.Author: PURpleYAMS
Reviews.Content: Sprawling grounds and manicured lawn awaits to greet you as you check into this resort. The huge lobby with the sound of the man made falls and beautiful local art greets you welcome to MAUI!! the staffs are super friendly and helpful. checking in was not too complicated. Getting into the detached condo like unit would require a ride in their golf cart. Tipping is highly required from housekeeping to valet etc.. It would have been perfect if it weren't for the roach in the bathroom and the stench of urine permeating the toilet. I reported this but alas the dead roach ( which I killed) layed there for 2 more days before someone from housekeeping actually saw it and discard the carcass.The stench is another story. open shower with no doors or partition. kinda awkward for me. Would not stay here again when in MAUI.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, large rooms, very friendly staff, will come back”
Reviews.Author: Porquetevas
Reviews.Content: For the cost of a garden view room in one of the resorts down the hill you get a bedroom, living area, spacious bathroom, small kitchenette, and a lanai. The views from our room out to Molokini were fantastic and we enjoyed many beautiful sunsets from our lanai. The living room can be closed off with sliding shutters so our teenager had some privacy during the night on the pretty comfortable pull-out couch. Our king-size bed was very comfortable. True, the carpet and appliances could be updated in our unit (we had three units and two other two had been recently redone), but everything worked well. The overall value of the hotel is excellent, and for us the very friendly and helpful staff, the morning yoga sessions by the pool, the spa, and many other small amenities more than made up for a few somewhat dated room features.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Secluded Resort”
Reviews.Author: AmyJohn06
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor a great deal in planning my trip to Maui. After doing a lot of research, Hotel Wailea seemed like the ideal spot for our needs, and it did not disappoint. After a 14 hour travel to Maui, they made things very easy upon check in. A cool towel and bottle of cold water was available. We got to our room and unpacked right away. The room was in great condition. The only downside was there were very small ants in the bathroom sink. I am not an outdoors person at all, but this didn't even bother me. They weren't all over, just in this one area. The maid service was great. I think they only didn't come one out of the six days we were there. We didn't need anything that day, but the front desk was always helpful, and I'm sure if there was any needs (towels, etc), they could have helped us for that day. There's a mini fridge which was okay for our needs. Mostly used the fridge for water and left overs. We didn't really cook anything in the microwave in our room, other than a cup of mac and cheese. We ate out the rest of the time, I'm on vacation, I'm not into cooking which I do the rest of the year at home. There is room service which was way too expensive for my tastes for what is on the menu. The hotel restaurant, Capishe, is close but expensive. This is a true high class restaurant, which means small portions, big price. I'm not that high class myself to appreciate it, I'm more comfortable at Red Lobster. If high class is your thing, Capiche is for you. We split a meal and I had a couple drinks all for $100. Glad we decided to split the meal! The grounds are beautiful, the koi pond is relaxing, and the pool is never crowded. The lobby has a simple breakfast every morning. It was perfect for us, as I'm not into stuffing myself the moment I crawl out of bed. It filled us up enough to start the day. As I mentioned before, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The last day our plane didn't leave until 10PM. We could have had a late check out, but our room was already reserved by another couple so they offered to store our luggage in their office. We left for Lahaina and came back around 6PM and picked up our luggage with no problems. The only thing I would do differently is get a less expensive room. We had a full ocean view, but were rarely in our rooms. We were always on the go. Our room was great and so was the view of Molokini. I feel I wasted the view since we were only there in the morning and late at night. I would go back in a heartbeat. Perfect for couples who want peace and quiet. You're far enough away from the crowds and the beach is still close by for a shuttle or drive. We were there during the Tsunami scare, and I slept through the sirens. We were far enough inland and high enough were we were not evacuated. They did take some other people at other resorts into their lobby that had to evacuate, so we had a few other guests for breakfast. This shows how inviting and friendly they are at this hotel. This ends my review of Hotel Wailea....below is some info for those looking for what to do while there: Everything is close by. My GPS (TomTom) did not give very good directions when typing in an address. The address system is off in Maui or something, I was always directed 2 blocks north on Kihei Rd when typing in an address. Once I got use to this, it wasn't that bad.
