The restaurants were okay, some better than others. In Kihei area, I'd recommend Da Kitchen, PuPu Lounge, and Fred's Mexican Cafe. The only beach in the area we went to was Wailea Beach, so I can't comment on the beaches. Lahaina was nice. I wouldn't mind staying in that area with kids, it is more crowded than the Wailea area. Lot of shopping, not cheap. Cool Cat Cafe was great, and so was the Old Lahaina Luau. The one place I would say stay away from is "Bubba Gump Shrimp". I felt this was a safe pick for our last day on the Island. The food was pretty average at best, but the service was aweful. Some of the worst service I have every had in my life. I think it was just us. Everyone else seemed to get good service around us. We were seated and I asked that we not be by the "window" because we were suffering from a bit of heat stroke and wanted to be in the shade. They seated us and after awhile of waiting, others got seated after us and drinks served before anyone came around to take a drink order from us. I eventually stopped a waitress who said she wasn't our waitress, but I got her to take a drink order from us and food order while we had someone's attention. A second person served us the food which was pretty bland. No one came by to fill up drinks or see how we were doing. The other tables were treated better than us. After eating, I eventually flagged down a third person to see about getting a bill. A fourth person brought us a bill and said to pay it at the bar. I brought it to a fifth person at the bar who was surprised I was bringing a bill to them. They asked why I didn't pay my waitress and I explained I don't even know who that is, and I was told to bring it here. I paid the fifty dollar bill and left very unhappy. I am glad to say that this was not a common experience on Maui, but I personally will never go to this Bubba Gump again, and probably never another one. For the Road to Hana, I suggest doing it backwards. We approached Hana from the south. There was barely any traffic, and the views were 10 times better than the northern half. We got the the Sacred Pools and took the 2 mile hike there towards the waterfall. One of my favorite things, but make sure you have some comfortable sandles or watershoes. The path is filled with roots and rocks and there's a couple streams to cross that regular shoes are not an option. Hana of course is not as impressive as the drive. We spent too long at the Pools and by the time we made it to Hana, all the tour buses were already coming the other way. The tour bus drivers are A Holes, especially on the narrow roadways where they rather run you off the road than share it with you. As for shopping, I suggest going to the Swap Meet in Kahului at the Community College. Great prices for shirts and everything else you might want to buy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, paradise on earth.”
Reviews.Author: goozgog77
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, apartments fantastic with unbelievable views, manicured lawns and gardens, flowers everywhere and breakfasts great too. Maid service each day or when you actually wanted it - no-one knocking on the door! Could have stayed forever.

Reviews.Title: “This is Maui's Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: bogman32
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I just stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon! It was nothing less than awesome! The staff was outstanding and very friendly! The rooms were large and spacious and very clean! Our every need was anticipated and fufilled! This is a first class establishment and we are looking forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ccmercer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Hotel Wailea and loved it. We checked in 5 hrs. early and our room wasn't ready so we were upgraded 2 room levels. Room was absolutely beautiful with a great view. We were able to see whales from our lanai. Grounds and pool area were impecable. The staff we very attentive and seemed genuinely concerned with making our stay a pleasant one. Couldn't say enough good about the staff. We travel 2-3 times per year and I would descibe myself as picky but would definately stay at Hotel Wailea again and would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the money and stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: BrianK32655
Reviews.Content: The price may seem right, but don't be fooled, this hotel is in dire need of a renovation. I don't consider myself a particularly fussy traveler, but the room was furnished like a well-worn Holiday Inn. I just expected more from a hotel that classifies itself as a boutique. The pictures on the website were deceiving. The view that was touted was completely obstructed by the adjacent unit. The fitness center is little more than a Bowflex machine and one or two treadmills. The "breakfast" is limited to an assortment of breads and bagels and coffee, and get there early because if the hotel's full, a line forms quickly. The staff was courteous and didn't penalize us for leaving early and only staying one night. I highly recommend paying a few extra dollars and staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A truly excuisite experience, a serene paradise with beautiful Japanese gardens, and phenomenal staff!”
Reviews.Author: Paulita0612
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I came to Maui for a conference. We had heard rave reviews about Hotel Wailea, but nothing compared to the actual experience. We were so lucky to have found this gem of a resort. Tucked away on a hill side, just a minute from the beach, this Japanese inspired resort has quite the knack for details! While walking around the resort, your senses are flooded with the delightful essence of plumeria and other flowers, and you instantly feel a calming sensation as you hear the trickle and gurgle from the koi ponds and waterfalls. As for the rooms, we had a full kitchen, living room with an open lanai, bath with shower, and the most comfortable bed that I have ever slept on!!! To top it all off, our view was unbelievable...we could sit on our lanai, take in the view of the West Maui mountains, while watching the sunset onto the Pacific Ocean. Despite all these wonderful anemities, the best part of the experience was having such accommodating staff. We were able to find great local places, and receive very useful advice by getting to know our housekeepers. We definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Maui, and plan on coming back to the Hotel Wailea in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms on nice grounds a little ways up the hill from the beach.”
Reviews.Author: smavros
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a good property. These were condo style suites that were extremely spacious (700 sq ft?) and had a pseudo kitchen (no oven). The units were strewn throughout a hilly but well manicured grounds with a big koi filled pond (unfortunately not that attractive and mosquito lure). Slightly annoying to deal with the big hill up to the lobby but the pool and lobby were great. Breakfast was good continental and really good juice and coffee. Got a nice deal from otel.com which I'd never heard of but worked out great. This hotel is not on the beach. It's only a 3 minute drive down the steep hill to Wailea Beach and the hotel has a deal so you get beach chairs and umbrellas. Not bad for a place not on the beach. Unfortunately, it ends at 3pm which isn't great if you want to relax and watch the sunset after a morning journey. If you're looking for hawaii beach time, i think any hotel in hawaii not directly on the beach may not be the way to go. It was a bit cheaper, yes, but I was jealous of everyone who had walk to the beach access and chairs and towels past 3pm. Wailea is great. The paved path around is great for running and all the beach areas provide great swimming. I think in the end I wouldn't stay here again only because it's hawaii, and I came to be near the ocean. Since you can't walk there, parking and dealing with being wet and getting back in the car weren't ideal. If that doesn't bother you this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: iliketotravel123
Reviews.Content: Loved the grounds and spaciousness of the room. We stayed in room 101, a partial ocean view. The entrance to the room was unimpressive, but I was happy once we entered the room. It was spacious and lovely. We could have used a microwave to heat some leftovers but the room was nice. We did have an issue with the room above us throwing a party while we were trying to sleep - it was handled promptly by the front desk and resolved. The fitness room was disappointing. It had only one treadmill and two ellipticals. both the ellipticals were broken and one of the two 10 pound free weight was missing. I reported all of these to the front desk but only one of the ellipticals wad repaired. The other was usable but nothing worked on the display panel. The shuttle provided by the hotel was super convenient. Max and Manny (valet/shuttle for the hotel) are awesome! Can't say enough about them. They are way more knowledgeable and helpful than front desk, not that I am complaining at all about the front desk. The only restaurant at the hotel is Capische?, a very expensive restaurant. The room service is minimal so we had to go off premises for lunch or light dinners. This was truly inconvenient. Capische? was delicious and romantic. Try to get there before the sun goes down so you can enjoy the view. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning but as someone else mentioned, it would have been nice to at least offer bananas. No change in the daily offerings at all made it boring but it was all very, very good. We were happy with all of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for adventurers in Maui”
Reviews.Author: cheers_from_Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Wailea for 10 days (just left yesterday!) based on recommendations on TripAdvisor, and you guys didn't let us down! This hotel is really best suited for travelers that are more independent and interested in exploring all Maui has to offer versus those who want a full resort experience... if you want to just walk out of the hotel and onto the beach, this hotel is obviously not for you. There really is not way to walk to the beach from Hotel Wailea -- well, there is, but the route is indirect and the walk is long. The hotel is set up like a condo -- four suites within one "house" structure. I actually loved that because it meant we could come and go without having to pass a ton of people, the front desk, etc. It's just perfect for people who really appreciate privacy. I thought the housekeeping was not too thorough and the times they arrived seemed inconsistent, but that's not a huge deal for us. The ability to park our own car versus use valet (we hate waiting for someone to fetch our car) was a HUGE PLUS! I won't complain about breakfast as a lot of other people have. I considered it a "plus" versus an entitlement. We only went a couple times and it wasn't great but that's no big deal. If you want a real breakfast, just head to any number of fabulous Maui restaurants. One disappointment was the beach, which I kind of anticipated from some of the reviews here. The Hotel Wailea shares the beach (all beaches are public anyway) with The Four Seasons and Grand Wailea. It was hard to find the Hotel Wailea beach service -- it's actually outsourced to another company so that was a little confusing. I think it was called "Ocean Adventures" or something? They just hand you ONE white bath towel (no beach towels?!) and tell you to find your own lounger under an orange umbrella. Here's the problem: there were only 5 orange umbrellas on a beach (when we went) packed with blue umbrellas from the other hotels. I have no idea why they don't set up more loungers. If we planned to spend more time on this particular beach, I'd be more disappointed but it's not a big deal since we prefer to be at a new beach everyday. I will stipulate we only went to the Hotel Wailea beach a couple times, so maybe on other days they actually did set up more loungers. I think the hotel has some kinks to work out in terms of process -- for some bizarre reason, our check-in took 15 minutes because the guy at the front desk had to explain to us every little detail of the hotel, its spa offerings, its activities during the week, etc. I really am not interested in any of that after a very long flight from Chicago -- I can figure it out for myself later and would prefer if someone just checked me in quickly and got me into a room ASAP. That say, we LOVED Ayumi at the front desk who is just excellent. I think some of the negative reviewers here must've gone to Hotel Wailea expecting a five star hotel experience akin to a Four Seasons or Ritz, or a resort. There is a reason the Hotel Wailea is priced MUCH more reasonably than the Four Seasons or other nearby resorts -- but I think overall the value for the price is great. This is just not a resort hotel, which was actually a huge plus for us since we don't spend much time hanging around a hotel anyway. There's not a lot to do on the grounds besides sit around the pool (which is pretty much a slightly larger version of a swimming pool in a California suburban home). The restaurant, Capische, is very small and definitely not priced to eat at daily. The room service is extremely limited to a handful of pastas and maybe pizza? Unimpressive but again, no big deal since Maui has tons of great restaurants. I would recommend getting a panoramic ocean-view room (if you care about the view) because the ones that are just ocean-view seem to have obstructions. Luckily we were upgraded but our original ocean-view room had its ocean-view blocked by someone's house! The suite was large, very comfortably furnished, attractive, etc. The bathroom situation was a little unusual, as others have noted, but perfectly comfortable and serviceable. We really appreciated the free internet access from our room. The view was great. We could see Molokini! While this would be a great place to stay for small families (I think all suites are just one bedroom?), I just want to note that I appreciate how ADULT the atmosphere is. There weren't tons of kids running around, which as a couple on vacation without children, we really appreciated. Now that we've seen what an utter playground the nearby resorts are, we would not consider staying there until we have kids of our own. The Hotel Wailea is probably the best hotel for couples in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Above the fray”
Reviews.Author: Hazley15
Reviews.Content: Hotel wailea is set up the hillside from the beach in south Maui. It offers a lot for money, considering the alternatives in the area. We had a partial oceanview, which meant we could see molokini through the buildings in front. If we did it again we would get a full ocean view because the panorama from the front buildings is that beautiful. The suite was large and very clean. There is a bedroom separated by wooden screens which can be pulled shut, which allows one to get up without disturbing the other. The bathroom is a little different too. The toilet is separate and enclosed. The tub is sort of open to bedroom, though, as is the separate but adjacent shower. It works fine for couples, but perhaps not for others. There is a kitchenette consisting of a mini fridge and 2 burner stove top. On check in, we were told that we could get cooking utensils but without much enthusiasm. In the end, we ate cold food there, but it worked well enough for our needs. There is a dreaded resort fee, which has been reduced from $25 to $20 they said. This included parking, and the breakfast, so it wasn't as bad as it might seem. The pool area is nice, and rarely crowded. We went at in the evenings at had it to ourselves. If you hate getting into a cold swimming pool, this is the place for you, the water was near bathtub temperature. I've seen criticism of the continental breakfast in reviews. We found it to be very adequate for what it is. There are apples, grapes and pineapple; bagels for toasting, and a variety of banana bread type loaves. We were at the coffee place at the tony shopping centre down the hill, and saw the exact same items for sale, and weren't cheap. Finally, there is the landscaping. Acres of flowers, ponds, an orchard and expansive lawns. A great place just to wander around. Of course, nothing is perfect. At least with an iPhone, wifi was weak and unreliable. There is a free business center computer to use as well. We also had some shower water pressure problems.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, quiet hotel that is simply fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mship91
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Wailea. It was full to capacity, according to one employee, but it was so very quiet and never felt crowded at all. The grounds are perfectly manicured and always look perfect. Nice continental breakfast to start our day and perfect view to boot! We highly recommend this hotel for anyone. It's not right on the beach, but they have a convenient shuttle that will take you down there.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: dean0042
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week in Wailea. Our first four nights were spent at the much more expensive Fairmont and our final 3 were at the Hotel Wailea. Our total room cost was almost half of what we paid for the Fairmont, and our overall experience was far more enjoyable. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, and the grounds were immaculate. The overall relaxed vibe at the hotel is exactly what we were looking for. Although the hotel was sold out, we didn't notice. As opposed the the hustle and bustle at the Fairmont, the Hotel Wailea was quite and charming. The room suite was comparable as well, spacious with a great view of the ocean. That said, the bathroom and kitchenette could do with an update (although the shower was great). We had the best meal of our trip on the deck of Capiche, the onsite restaurant. I would definitely recommend a reservation at sunset. When making this reservation we were hesitant about the fact that the hotel does not have direct access. What we found was that the hotel beaches were overcrowded and not nearly as impressive as the other beaches in the area. Like most visitors to Maui we had rented a car and the hotel is a 5 minute drive from Big Beach, a far more enjoyable setting than the hotel beaches. For those looking for more amenities, the hotels escalades run regular shuttles to and from their own private area on the Grand Wailea Beach. Overall I can't say enough about this place and highly recommend it. Next time we're on the island we're going to skip splurging on the more "upscale" options and get the most for our money at the Hotel Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ocean Views & Value in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Harvard75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Wailea for five days before taking the ferry to Lanai for a second week stay. This was our second trip to HW and they have stepped up the rooms and service, we loved it yet again. Our second floor rom had incredible ocean views and we could see whales in the near distance-amazing. Although not on the beach, we discovered again the views were much better than a tower type structure. The reasonable resort fee covered parking, unlimited internet, access to fitness center, free yoga class, free shuttle to the beach, and a very nice Kona Coffee bar with bagels and light items. Afterall, who wants to pay $30 (mega-resorts) for a few egg omlett at the start of the day, we keep it light. The overall costs and quality are exceptional and we hope this gem stays this way, there are less than a hundred rooms. the grounds are perfect, meandering paths to your rooms, no elevators which we loved. The waiter at the hotel's restaurant told us they just won a national award for the best Italian in Hawaii. Following ourbstay at HW, we rode the ferry to Lanai and stayed at Four Seasons Lodge a Koele, an incredible stay! Enjoy Maui and Lanai......

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: fromAlabama
Reviews.Content: We were met by two happy guys who loaded our bags on the golf cart and valet parked our car while we checked in. Check in was smooth and informative. We were then driven to our room. The grounds were breathtaking. Trees, flowers, green grass, nice stream, it was gorgeous. Got to our room and it was better than I was expecting. We had a nice ocean view of Molokai Crater and the ocean. I actually could see a humpback or two from our deck. The bed was nice and comfortable. The rooms had a stove, but no pots and pans to cook with. Every day the maid had the bed made, trash out, free coffee beans refilled, and clean towels in our room while we were out. The rooms had central air and a small fridge. The bathroom was huge. The complimentary breakfast is good if you are not on a diet. It's all sugar and carbs. The pool area is very nice. Lounge beds on the lawn by the pool were wonderful. After looking at the other hotels in Kihei, you can't beat this one for the money. My wife and I both loved it and would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: HonestAbeChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui to get married on the beach and spend our honeymoon here. This place was amazingly well kept and staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were large and spacious. The grounds were beautiful, and the scenery breathtaking. The hotel is very peaceful and perfect if you are looking for some quiet relaxation. It is not on the beach, but that was not a big deal for us as the beach was only a 2 minute drive. The hotel also offers a shuttle to the beach where chairs were available to us as well. There is a restaurant on the grounds and other restaurants and shopping are just minutes away by car. Great value for the money! Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Blues34
Reviews.Content: Our room was wonderful, views were stunning, staff were excellent, grounds were superb - BUT the breakfasts were an absolute disgrace. Every day was the same - few muffins, bit of fruit (if you were early enough) and urn of water for tea or coffee. Guava Jam was provided but served in the jam pot with a dessert spoon. You had to eat breakfast in the lounge - so sitting in lounge chairs with coffee tables - and worst of all you only had paper plates and paper cups!!! It truly was the worst breakfast we have ever ever had - and we have travelled a great deal. The pool was very nice - nice loungers - but we could not even get a drink of water and on the first day I ordered a salad and it took 1 hr. Apparently there are no kitchen facilities on site - which would account for why the breakfasts were as they were.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: JenA61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Wailea for 3 nights based on the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. While the hotel was a good value for the money, it certainly did not live up to the rave reviews I had read. The rooms were large, but outdated. The countertops and mirror in the bathroom were very low. The kitchen area had a small fridge, which was nice, but no microwave. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived. We didn't mind waiting, but when we were informed it was ready, we arrived at the room and were told it would be another 15 minutes. Again we were happy to wait, but when we did get to our room, our luggage had been sent to another room. We had to change rooms the next day as we needed a room with 2 beds and they weren't able to accomadate us in the same room for all 3 nights. We didn't mind, but it would have been nice to have received a discount for our troubles, or even a complimentary drink at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: mcm4055
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in January but TP doesn't offer date that far back as an option. My husband has reminded me several times to leave this review as we had such a good experience. The grounds and pool area are gorgeous; the stream running through the property and the cabanas poolside are a dream. The views from the grounds and our balcony were also exquisite. We were upgraded upon arrival to a suite and our rooms were a bit dated but very comfortable with kitchen and huge bathroom area; each function of a bathroom having its own room. We slept incredibly well, almost too well bc we missed some of our planned activitoes, in the king sized bed and blackout curtains. Breakfast was disappointing as it was mostly every possible kind of bread item one could think of and not much else. The juices were great, though. At the time we went, there was no pool side service and the restaurant was only open for dinner but that wasn't a problem for us as we were always at the beach, traversing the perimeter of the island by car or on a whale-watching excursion. Oh, yes, we would watch for whale tails from our balcony, and being the mating season it was like a game of connect-the-tails and make up a new constellation. It is up on the hill, on the non-beach side of the main road (main road in Wailea is rather pleasant and doesn't really seem a road to city dwellers like us) but the hotel provides free shuttles service to & fro ( fyi...the fro part is not like clockwork) the nearby beaches which belong to the big resorts but we often walked and considered it our vacation exercise. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel. It is am amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views and large room”
Reviews.Author: TimothyLondon
Reviews.Content: Our room was very large and the view from the balcony was terrific. The bed was large and comfortable and overall we had a very relaxing time. However, we had issues with the hotel and the room. The issues with the room were niggles rather than major, but could easily be sorted out. Examples were that there was a small kitchen in the room. Only one of the two rings worked and the warmer did not work. The TV in the lounge is too high and to the side on the wall when viewing from the sofa. The room was great during the day with the views, but once the sun went down the room was rather bland and lighting was poor. The issue with the hotel is that it charges a 'resort fee' which is on top of the room tariff - we were told that the fee was to cover the continental breakfast, the shuttle service, valet parking, the beach area and free local phone calls. There was no option not to pay so if you did not use these services we resented having to pay a fee for items we did not use when there was no possibility of opting out. We assume that the hotel does this so it can advertise a lower tariff - which is a bit cynical. The hotel has a restaurant which is a high class Italian style. This is great for a special event, but not where I would want to eat every night. As the hotel is about a mile away from the centre of Wailea it was quite a trek out to eat each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Suits a particular visitor”
Reviews.Author: trav2well
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if what you are looking for is a manicured environment and don't mind being a driving distance from the beach. Upsides for us was the lovely large apartment - clean and clearly recently renovated. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Downsides were the extremely soft bed. So soft that one of us had backache as a result - so if you are like us and used to a firm bed - then be warned. Also the 'partial ocean view' description ought to be read with caution. Our was described as above but really - it looked out onto the garden and we could only see the ocean if we went outside and peered between the trees. Because there was a lot of haze - it was impossible to see the sea from that low position anyway. The mini breakfast celebrates sugar - although the oat biscuits and fruit were great as was the coffee. If you are a golfer this place would be great. If you are ocean people and going during whale season - find a hotel with rooms that really do overlook the ocean. We met a few people who had this and were delighted to watch the whales from their balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: DianeBill
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for location and price but what we got was so much better! The room was huge with a great deck and a tremendous view. The grounds were all Hawiaan with water falls, green grass and a quiet feel.The Japanese style spa,no extra charge, was wonderful.We had friends over and spent the morning in the different spa areas and pool never made it to the nearby beach. Their resturant was busy.Small kitchen with minimal accessaries.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: adrandlkj
Reviews.Content: PROS: We got the restful quietness we looked for in a resort.... no crowds, almost zen-like. The view from our panoramic ocean view room was unbelievable. We liked the size of the suite. Most of the staff were helpful and friendly. The shuttle service ( a cadillac escalade) from the hotel to any part of Wailea was convenient. CONS : The walk to the beach was longer than we expected. The breakfast fare (fruits, bagels, pastries) remained the same every day! Can't the management think of any other varieties of fruits and breads/pastries?

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: vangruna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first part of our Honeymoon at Hotel Wailea and can't wait to come back someday. We were greeted upon arriving with water and told that we had a upgrade to our room (we stayed in #112). The view was beautiful and I think even better than the hotels on the beach. We loved lounging on our balcony, there was never any noise unless you went closer to the lobby. We enjoyed the continental breakfast every morning and loved the locally made banana and lilokoi bread. After staying at Hotel Wailea we went to stay at the Grand Wailea because friends of ours had recommended staying there but I would chose the Hotel Wailea any day over the Grand Wailea ( I have reviewed them as well). All the staff was very friendly, the rooms were always clean and we couldn't have asked for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jackforrest13
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at The Four Seasons in Maui but the only room available for our time slot was $900 with no view. This seemed crazy so looked at others nearby. The Hotel Wailea is a half mile up the hill from the water. The view from the suite we had was better than any room at the nearby oceanfront hotels including The Four Seasons; the suite was good sized and well furnished. The bathroom was large and very functional but not elegant. The grounds were lovely and the staff top rate. They provide a free shuttle to the same beach the Four Seasons uses with staff at the beach for equipment, chairs, towels. The hotel is small and peaceful. Free continental breakfast was ok but the $30 buffet at the nearby Fairmont is terrific, a bargain by Hawaii standards. After our experience at the Hotel Wailea I would choose it over the Four Seasons or the other beachfront hotels in Wailea if it were the same price, but it's not. We paid less than one third what the Four Seasons wanted for their non view room. The restaurant Capische is in the hotel. It's expensive but one of the great dining experiences of my life. (see a separate review.)

Reviews.Title: “Tropical oasis”
Reviews.Author: loewen71
Reviews.Content: We were blown away with the curteous service and smiling faces any time I saw a staff member. They were glad to help out, give us ideas for activities, tell us where the best place was to go, shuttling us around Wailea and returning our snorkel gear and boogie boards at the beach club. The very large suite had all the amenities and, better than home, comfortable king size bed and we are very picky when it comes to beds. We loved enjoying the open ocean view every morining while filling up on the complimentary continental breakfast while getting to know other guests.Nice social atmosphere., which included free drinks with the general manager and front desk manager. The best features that will keep us returning are the landscape, poolside, sauna, hot tub, gym, free activites and feeding the koi. The bathrooms need updating as well as the spa sitting area. There is an odor that has to do with the mats and carpet in the spa that is very off putting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, rooms and service. Would go back”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Matt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week at this hotel. We had a partial ocean view suite, which could have been labeled as just ocean view. From the balconey, we had an almost uninterupted 180 degree view of the ocean. Beautiful. The suite was huge, clean and well furnished. Excellent bed, huge shower, separate toilet room with bidet, small kitchen, large living room, in room safe, 2 big flatscreen tvs, etc. Hotel obviously caters to the Japanese, we're american, as the signs are in both english and Japanese. The common areas are beautiful and they serve an excellent continental breakfast each morning. Unique and delicious pastries, good coffee, juice, fruit, all excellent quality. The view of the ocean and surrounding islands during breakfast is impressive. The hotel provides both valet service and self park. We used both on different occassions and liked having the choice. The free shuttle was a Cadillac Escalade, nice. The pool area is great with comfortable chairs, good bar and pillow topped cabana style areas. Each day they have some type of activity planned and my fiancee was able to take advantage of yoga they ran one morning. The staff, at all levels, was courteous, helpful and efficient. To nitpick, because that's all they are, is that the fitness center only has a few machines and 2 of them were broken. I used it 3 days and despite seeing a guest fall off the Bowflex machine because it was broken, the equipment was still on the floor for use, broken, for the next 2 days. Also, the parking spots in the self park area are ridiculously thin. We had Ford Fusion and it barely fit. You are almost guaranteed to get door dings in the self park and an uncomfortable time getting out once you get it parked. The grounds are beautiful and the landscaping is impressive, but the layout of the walkways is a bit wizard of oz and it's tough to find your suite in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, quiet, romantic grounds...”
Reviews.Author: FunSun16
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and would go back. The hotel was 3 min from the beach and from great snorkeling places, the hotel shuttle would take you to the beach any time you want. The suite was very spacious, although without any "Modern Cool" decor, but quite upscale bath/shower ensuite, large bedroom and living/dining. We liked that the hotel had beakfast included as well as fun activities like pick your own fruit day when they take you around the grounds and you get to "pick your own fruits" free yoga classes, etc. The hotel is far from extravagance but is affiliated with Grand Wailea and you have access to all of the extravagance and the shops that it has to offer (as well as the Grand Wailea beach, the hotels share that beach). I liked that you can get those advantages of Grand Wailea without paying the price:) So what that you your suite is not right on the beach, it's still so close. We also enjoyed the free Spa at the hotel, esp. water massage cabinets and bubble tub. It's open to the outside and stays open long hours... There was some good shopping near by as well ( all price points), even though my husban hates going shopping, but we still fited it in our busy schedule since it was so close. Suites had kitchen, so we made our dinner ourselevs one night. Staff was very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii's Boutique Gem”
Reviews.Author: Lexi7404
Reviews.Content: Finding a great deal on this gorgeous and well-rated hotel was actually what sealed the deal on a Hawaiian vacation for us, and Hotel Wailea exceeded all of our expectations. Arriving late evening after nearly 24 hours in airports, we were greeted enthusiastically by friendly, professional bellhops. Throughout the entire rest of our stay, they made a point to greet us by name and go out of their way to offer assistance. When we checked in, we were given cold bottled water and some wet towels for refreshment. Our vacation got off to an incredible start when the front desk worker noted that not only was our request for a renovated room honored, but we were being upgraded from a partial oceanview to a panoramic oceanview at no charge! Room: -Incredibly spacious!!!! -Fresh flowers were left throughout the room. -Beds were very comfortable. -Showers were slightly different as others have mentioned, but it didn't bother us at all. -Kitchen didn't have many utensils, but when we requested a knife from the housekeeper via a note, it was left for us. She was also kind enough to leave us little pumpkin baskets full of candy on Halloween! -The room wasn't the fanciest I have ever stayed in, but it was clean, comfortable, and very spacious...and THE VIEWS!!! -The views from Hotel Wailea have to be the very best of the island. We spent nearly every early morning on the lanai watching the sunrise and hurried home at the end of the day to catch the sunset with some wine before getting ready to go out for dinner. It was breathtaking and definitely one of my favorite parts of our trip. Breakfast - We couldn't understand why any previous reviewers would have complained about the breakfast. We loved it and missed it on the days we had to head out early! -Fresh breads, muffins, fruits, juices, and coffee. The bread comes from a local bakery, and the banana bread is the heavenly kind you imagine when you think of Hawaii. Oh what I'd give for a slice right now:) We always left full and ready to take on the day....without the feeling of heavy bacon, eggs, and potatoes! -Breakfast is served in a second floor, open air lobby that plays host to an incredible panoramic view of the ocean. Waking up doesn't get any better. Grounds -Absolutely gorgeous. Extremely well-kept. -Each day new flowers were put out throughout the hotel...on walkways, staircases, towels, chairs, etc. -In the evening, candles and torches were lit throughout the grounds and walkways, creating a romantic atmosphere -My favorite spot after dinner each night was definitely the poolside canopied sun bed. Surrounded by island foliage and tiki torches beneath an incredible starry skyscape, this was our nightly stop between dinner and bed. -Tried both the gym and spa facilities. Both have amazing views!!! Gym could use better equipment but it was well-kept. Enjoyed the spa, but it's difficult to understand unless you read the material in the hotel room book. Overall Hotel - Capische? Restaurant is unbelievable in views, food, and service. See my review for details. -Every staff member went out of their way to create a memorable guest experience -A select activity was offered each day (yoga, manager's reception with drinks and live music). We really enjoyed the fruit picking mission with the groundskeeper. Had an awesome time picking our own fruits on the grounds, and they were kind enough to bring some more fruit to our room later that day. That's just the kind of place Hotel Wailea is! -You use the same beach as the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea! It's just a few blocks down the road. As for those who made previous comments about the beach chairs, we used them and thought they were fine. Apparently, we didn't look too out of place because several guests of the other two hotels tried using HW chairs! -Catered primarily to couples or adults. Didn't seem to offer kids activities and general structure of suites are not conducive to families A few suggestions for HW: -Rooms could use better towels -Renovate the lobby restroom. It's out of place with the beauty throughout the rest of the hotel. -Keep it a small boutique hotel. That's it's charm:) Bottom Line: Hotel Wailea is a gorgeous boutique hotel with less than 100 rooms. It may not have all the amenities of the larger hotels, but it more than makes up for in charm. A true Hawaiian gem. Friends could not believe our pictures (some of the shots taken from our lanai looked fake!), but what really shocked them was the price - approx. $150 per night (via direct booking/special offer)!!! Don't change, HW. We loved you, and weren't even sure we wanted to write a Tripadvisor review....we'd like to keep you our secret!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: spanayotov
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 nights in this hotel with my wife, and I am absolutely delighted. The location is great. The design of the villas and the surrounding gardens is really nice. The rooms have kitchen box with two burners and a small refidgerator. It is very quiet. At the same time the fact that it is not exactly on the beach is offset by the shuttle service to any beach in Wailea/Makena area. At Wailea beach umbrelas, towels, and chairs are complimentary, as well as water. The staff, led by General Manager Markus Schale and Managing Director Kyoko Kimura, is doing great job and is very friendly and helpfull. All this is even more valuable taking into account the fact that the cost is about half of what you'll pay at Four Seasons or Grand Wailea. I'll strongly recommend this hotel to anybody considering stay in South Maui. I hope someday I'll be able to visit this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Return Trip!”
Reviews.Author: GoldStandard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Wailea last year and were really pleased with our January return trip. The rooms have been freshened up (new carpet) and the addition of the fitness center is top notch (ocean views from the fitness center). I loved the free yoga class too. The staff were also amazing, so friendly to help with our daily adventures. The views are incredible-we even watched whales breeching from our lanai! It's definitely the best value in upscale Wailea. Hope to come back next Summer--Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: luna30_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Wailea was absolutely perfect. My husband and I decided to stay here for the last few nights of our honeymoon after staying at other condos around Hawaii, and it was the ideal ending. Between the gorgeous and spacious room, morning yoga class, clear ocean views, and delicious breakfasts, everything felt both luxurious and comfortable. We loved using the hot tub and sauna at the spa, and lounging on the beds by the pool. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The grounds are beautiful and make the whole place feel private and romantic. The perks of having an umbrella and chairs at Wailea beach by the Grand Wailea were great, and all the other beautiful south Maui beaches were incredibly accessible. The shuttle service was reliable as well. I think this is the absolute perfect spot for people who want a place that feels special but not over the top in this area of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Peaceful, Upscale, Amazing, Romantic, Affordable, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SandySeifert
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many places, but this one tops the list! Great for couples who want romance! The service is unbelievable! The pool, the spa, the workout area, the rooms, decor, everything! Nothing wrong at this stylish boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: BeaverFever79
Reviews.Content: After much debate we finally chose Hotel Wailea for our honeymoon in Maui. We reserved a partial ocean view room. This ended up being a first floor room with NO view of the ocean. The carpet in our room was so soiled and stained and disgusting that we couldn't walk on it with bare feet. The shower was an open, old, tiled shower with no door, reminiscent of a high school locker room. To be honest, I was in tears that day we checked into that room. Many aspects of this hotel are great, but because of the unacceptable state of the room, I cannot recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with huge rooms, and none of the resort crowds.”
Reviews.Author: wcrankshaw
Reviews.Content: Basically the website and other reviews say it all. It's at higher elevation than the resorts, and doesn't have direct beach access...but my wife and I thought that was a blessing. There were plenty of people staying at the hotel, but it always sort of felt like we were two of very few. Privacy was top notch. There is a right of way to the beach, and a resort fee covers the use of chairs, towels, and umbrellas. The beach itself is basically the front yard of the Grand Wailea resort, but most of the crowd stays behind the sand and in the pool area of the resort. One look at the stacked in rows of people sitting around the resort pool made me thankful to be staying up the hill. The rooms are pretty much as they are described. They have a large living room with shutter doors to the lanai, a kitchenette area, a separate shuttered off bedroom, and a 3 room bathroom area. Even though people have complained about the shower situation, I thought the huge open shower was great. Service was excellent all the way from the management to the grounds crew. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel to someone looking for a quiet private getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Best honeymoon..!!”
Reviews.Author: optimus913
Reviews.Content: Location, perfect. Service, perfect. There wasn't a single thing that went wrong. Very laid back, went fruit picking, marvelous pool/spa, shuttle to beach/shops. Huge room with great view. Very kind staff, we loved it, and will go back for sure..!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Teppo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while in Maui. Good location for going to Haileiakela, shopping Easy transport to Grand Wailea beach Nice pool area Rooms were spacious

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the fact that it's not on the beach keep you from staying here”
Reviews.Author: Lindo07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Wailea in early November 2010. I was a little hesitant initially because the property wasn't directly on the beach, because, after all, we were visiting Hawaii(!), but the website seemed to indicate that it wasn't far, other reviews were good, and the price was reasonable, at least compared to other "luxury" hotels, so we went for it. We were not disappointed: from the moment we arrived, until we left, we were continually impressed The grounds were beautifully landscaped and maintained; the rooms were clean and luxurious, with a large, nicely appointed bathroom and a small fridge, stove and kitchen sink, which was very handy, although we never actually cooked there(!). Our room overlooked a road but it wasn't heavily trafficked, and beyond the road, the view encompassed luxury homes and hotels, with the Pacific on the horizon. Very peaceful, and we enjoyed a couple of evenings sipping wine on the balcony. However, and this leads me to my only complaint, the photos on the hotel website, which seem to me to be all young, "beautiful" people, many of whom are on the beach, are both misleading and a bit off-putting. First, the hotel is probably a mile from the ocean. Perhaps a relatively easy and pleasant walk (although we were too busy with other activities to actually test that assumption), but definitely NOT on the beach. (The "amenities" section on the hotel's website does indicate "shuttle" service to the beach, which implies that the hotel is not on the beach, but the photos, IMO, are still misleading a bit.) Second, the images of young people laying around in swimsuits did not seem to convey the actual feel of the place (at least not when we were there). I have nothing against younger women laying around in bikinis soaking up the sun(!), but we DID see that type of scenario at another large resort we visited briefly to have a drink, and that hotel radiated a very different atmosphere: LOTS of people by the pool. sipping drinks, talking, music, hustle and bustle, etc. The Hotel Wailea was nothing like that, and in fact, that's one reason we enjoyed it so much: it was just...peaceful. Of course, it may be different at a different time of year, but still, I'm a little puzzled by the hotel's Marketing folks: I would think they would want to emphasize that serenity, while at the same time, targeting a broader mix of potential guests. So, website photos aside, if you're looking for peace and quiet; comfortable, clean, luxurious, and roomy accommodations; a pretty decent continental breakfast; and a convenient location from which it's not too far to get to nearby restaurants and shops and to hiking trails, parks, snorkeling areas, and other activities, I would highly recommend this hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: tinasmiller
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui and the Hotel Wailea. It was a wonderful experience. I had read many reviews and wanted to stay at a hotel that was small and not alot of children. This was the place. You are so secluded, on a hillside overlooking the ocean, with beautiful grounds. The hotel was full but you felt like you were alone. There were not many guests at the pool and no one was usually at the spa. Very quiet....The staff were so friendly and helpful. There were many reviews about some of the rooms needing updating. Our room had new carpeting, the bed comfortable, and very clean. The only place that I saw needed attention was the shower floor. But don't let this hinder your decision, there were so many positives and you don't spend alot of time in your room. We did not eat at the restaurant, there are plenty of places about 15 minutes away in Kihei. We did go down the the beach that was part of the Grand Wailea. Alot of comments were made about the hotel picking up chairs and umbrellas at 3pm. That was not the case we stayed on the beach until 4:30 and had no problem. I will definitely stay here again when I go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: VickyT7
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel (it's actually better than your typical hotel in my opinion), it's reasonably priced, the units are spacious for a couple and the staff is friendly. It's well located on the island on beautifully kept grounds, the view from the unit is beautiful. Internet: They have high-speed internet included in the $20.00 per day fee, it did the trick for staying on top of emails and such. Gym: There's a very small gym which has 1 bowflex, 1 weight rack of weights going up to 15lbs and some yoga mats with exercise balls, I can't remember if it had a threadmill or not. If you're looking to stay fit while on vacation, your best bet is to get a weekly membership at the local gym in South Kihei. The hotel isn't affiliated with other hotels around. Restaurant: The restaurant Capische is independant to the hotel but it is located within the hotel's grounds. I'm not sure if they provide the room service food as I didn't use room service during my stay there. Capische is the best restaurant I've been to on Maui - the food is phenomenal and the staff is very friendly. Spa: I went in quickly to have a look and see if it was worth it, it didn't appeal to me that much so I skipped it and therefore can't comment on it any further. I deducted a star on cleanliness because I noticed that they didn't vacuum or mop the floor in our unit for the duration of our stay. Although they might have swept the floor with a broom - I'm not sure on that one. Sorry I'm a clean-freak I'll admit it myself. There were also little ants in our kitchenette even though we didn't leave any food out of the fridge. They really didn't bother me though but I thought I'd mention it and let you guys know. They serve a continental breakfast every morning which is relatively healthy and fast so you can get on with your day. We are planning on staying there again next year without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin7410
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Wailea and we really thought it was a great value. We took advantage of the advance purchase option on their website and got a really great deal for an oceanview room. The service is fabulous at this hotel. We did not encounter a single person on their staff that wasn't extremely pleasant. The beds were SO comfortable! We really enjoyed having so much space, and the kitchenette was really helpful for storing our own snacks and beverages. I e-mailed the hotel in advance to request a "kitchen set" with extra pans/plates/utensils for the kitchen (learned about that from a review on Trip Advisor) and also asked for a DVD player. Both were in our room when we checked in. The pool is really nice and it was never a problem to get a covered cabana. We went into the spa as well and LOVED the hot tub. It's HUGE, so it's not uncomfortable at all if others are in there. We ate at Capische our first night, and it was excellent as well. It was always easy to get our car from the valet. We left too early each morning to take advantage of the breakfast, so I can't speak to that. We also never took advantage of their beach shuttle - we just drove to the beaches on our own. There were a few negatives, but I still think the hotel is an excellent value and would definitely stay there again. When we first arrived, there were quite a few ants in the kitchenette near the coffee maker. We called the front desk and they sent someone to deal with it while we were at dinner. Never saw them again for the rest of our stay, so in my mind this is not a big issue at all. Just wish they would have caught it before we did. One thing that did bother us was the carpet. There were quite a few very large and obvious stains, which made the room feel dirty. This is my biggest complaint, and it definitely wasn't the best thing to see right when you walk in the door. If they would fix this, it would really improve the perceived quality of the room. The pool bar was closed while we were there, but there was a sign instructing you to call the front desk if you wanted to order something. The service was kinda slow, but not a big deal. I was just happy that we didn't have to walk around trying to find someone to give us a drink! The most impressive part of our stay is this. When we left the hotel, we forgot to get a large sum of cash out of the safe. REALLY stupid move - I thought my husband got it, and I thought he got it. We were at another hotel the next day when we realized it. We called Hotel Wailea and they immediately knew what we were talking about. They had tried to call the only cell phone number they had for us (which was dead) many times, and were so worried that we had gotten on a plane back to the mainland without our cash. When we went to pick it up (and they asked to see my ID - thank you!), they told us the story of how worried there were about it, and you could tell they were sincere. I checked my voicemails for the cell phone that was dead, and sure enough, they had called us before we even realized the cash was gone. Very impressive! And I cannot tell you how relieved we were.

Reviews.Title: “Will DEFINITELY come back for another stay!”
Reviews.Author: Holly017
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful from start to finish. The concierge people were VERY helpful, both on the phone before we booked our trip and then once we were there. Their shuttle service was terrific. We used them a few times daily to take us to the Shops at Wailea, various restaurants, beach, snorkel location. All you had to do was show up, tell them where you wanted to go and that was that. It couldn't have been easier! The continental breakfast was always superb and Mai Tai night on Tuesday evening was a lot of fun. This hotel really seems to cater to making sure you're enjoying yourself. The lush grounds were manicured exquisitely and there are wonderful views from anywhere on the grounds. I would recommend the "ocean view" rooms instead of the partial. It was well worth the few dollars a night more!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay - Best MaiTai's on the Island”
Reviews.Author: janiegogo
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect based on other reviews. Loved our stay and would for sure come back and recommend to friends. Quiet setting, beautiful views, while our bathroom needed some updated our room was pleasant, clean, quiet and very comfortable. Loved the Lani and the ability to enjoy coffee and breakfast on it. The complimentary breakfast was nice, while some others were critical, who needs more than coffee and a bagel in the morning, it was perfect. While not having direct beach access, right out the door, it was an easy drive or quick shuttle ride with easy free parking. We never had an issue with finding a spot at the Grand Wailea Beach and also enjoyed the other close public beaches such as Polo and Makena as well as coming back to enjoy the pool. The spa needs some updating but you also has access to the Grand Wailea spa which is listed on the top ten spa's in the world. Great place, great value and extremely friendly. LOVED our stay and enjoyed our dinner at Capishe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tsenekos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married in Wailea on Oct 27th, 2010. We stayed at the Hotel Wailea from Oct 22nd-Nov 1st. We travel all over Europe, North America and Asia and I must say that this was one of the most relaxing, cleanest, friendliest places we have ever stayed. That is high praise and anyone who has travelled through the Greek Islands (Mykonos, Ios, Santoini, Naxos...) knows what I mean. the room was large, comfortable, clean. The grounds were amazing. The spa (free outdoor pool, indoor hot pools...) were awesome and perfect at 9:00PM before a drink and socializing with friends. The free buffet breakfst was great, shuttles to the beach were friendly and easy. Housekeeping never banged on our door to get in to clean, yet they would come at anytime requested and tidy up and change towels... It didn't matter what time we walked around the hotel/grounds we felt we had the place to ourselves (it was full too) We never woke up or went to bed hearing people talking or banging around. the only disappointment was when we checked out on the 31st to head up to Lahaina to stay 5 nights at the Royal Lahaina. This Hotel cost 50% per night than the hotel Wailea and it was a huge diappointment. Noisy, busy and quite unfriendly. Hotel Wailea included free wifi, parking, breakfast and shuttle service. At Royal Lahaina they wanted $10/day internet, $10 per day parking and $20 for breakfast. Looking back, I wouldn't have minded those extra charges at the Hotel Wailea because it was just that good, but Royal Lahaina - not. the other thing to consider is that by end of October, Lahaina and Kanapali get windy and rainy so we ended up driving to Wailea to go the beach everyday. IWe could have stayed all winter at hotel Wailea as it felt like home and was amazing. On our second night at Royal Lahaina we were ready to go home. We were with 11 other people at Hotel Wailea from Italy, Canada and USA and everybody felt the same - awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and quiet affordable stay in tony Wailea!!”
Reviews.Author: orange-u-tall
Reviews.Content: Wailea is one of the more elegant parts of Maui (and that is saying something, because the whole island seems picturesque), and the Hotel Wailea was a more affordable option than the Four Seasons or Grand Wailea resorts located on the beach. The rooms are spacious, and have kitchenettes/refrigerators in their 900 square feet of space. The beaches are a short drive, which is fine as the less touristy beaches (Big Beach or Makena Beach) require a short drive anyway. The morning breakfast is a big step up from what one normally gets as part of the stay as it featured delicious bagels, muffins, fruit, fresh juices, good coffee, etc. The rooms were quieter than some of the pricier locations on the beach, as the place has almost a condo feel to it, albeit one in which the guests are relatively quiet. There is a nice little pool for taking a swim, and a fine dining restaurant on the premises. The grounds are also scenic in their own right, and a walk around them gave one a glimpse of nature as there is a stream and an array of fish and birds to see. The hotel is located a half-mile from the main road on an pretty steep incline (which is great for taking panoramic photographs, and challenging for finishing runs or walks). It was probably the quietest place I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “This was one of the best experiences at a hotel I have had”
Reviews.Author: Ckerr79
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea is a hidden jewel. Tucked up on the hill above the ocean it has the best views in Wailea. With the Hotel Wailea Beach Club you have the best of both worlds. You are driven down to Wailea Beach where you are provided with complimentary water, beach chairs and beach umbrellas at the hotels designated area. The pool area is so quite and relaxing and you have complementary luxury lounges. I have been to Hawaii over 20 times and this was a wonderful stay. The staff is the best and the service was great. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, nothing nearby”
Reviews.Author: tbgranite
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel with condominium type rooms. Living room, kitchenette, and balcony. Kitchenette basically has a small fridge and coffee maker; that's it. On site eatery is for dinner with a light morning buffet in lobby @ 7:30am; coffee, juice, fruit, bagels, and breads. Room service is available if a more substantial meal is desired. Very nice pool with bar service available. Ocean views, however, the beach is not close. Beach visits require a shuttle trip and/or your vehicle down the hill to one of the public beaches or Grand Wailea privileges. If you use the Grand Wailea option, there are limited spaces. We arrived @ 2pm, waited in the shade of a tree until a space became available only to have the chairs and umbrella taken at 3pm......time to go?? Recommend you bring your own beach gear and visit one of the many spectacular public beaches (requires a car or ability to walk a great distance). Overall, a relaxing stay for three days. The staff is very accommodating. Only comment is not near the beach or any of the area businesses (shops, food, entertainment). $20 per day resort fee for the buffet, room coffee, and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scottfast
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I were on our honeymoon and we stayed at Hotel Wailea from October 3rd-9th. My wife was in charge of the wedding and I was in charge of the honeymoon. So, months before the wedding I began researching hotels on Maui. My parents had always stayed in Lahaina and recommended we do the same, but for some reason my search always ended up in Wailea. Hotel Wailea was a fantastic choice. For the price of a week stay, it cannot be beat. When you first arrive you are greeted with the most spectacular view of the ocean from their lobby. The staff was also extraordinary. From the receptionists to the valets, everyone was super friendly. We had a partial ocean view suite, which means we were on the first floor. The hotel is unique in that there are multiple buildings with each building having 4 suites, 2 on top 2 on bottom. The rooms were huge for just two people. You walk in and there is a little kitchenette (sink, stove top, mini fridge, NO microwave). We only used the kitchen for the fridge and dishes, which were cleaned by the housecleaners. No pots, so if you wanted to cook pasta or something I think you have to bring your own. Connected to the kitchen was a large family room with a pull out couch and flat screen TV on the wall. This room also led out to the lanai (ours overlooked a koi pond). Off the family room are sliding doors that lead into the bedroom. Huge Bed (super comfy), flat screen TV, wifi, iPod dock, very nice room. Connected to the room is the bathroom. While it is true that there is no door that closes off the shower/bath from the bedroom, my wife and I couldâ€™ve cared less. If you are staying with friends or other couples just close off the sliding door the room and you will have no issues. The bathtub was awesome! Huge and deep, perfect for two! The shower was also huge and spacious. The toilet is in its own separate area with a door. I cannot say enough about the staff. Every day we talked to the valets to ask where locals eat, which beaches they go to, and where are the best spots for snorkeling. (Eat at â€˜Da Kitchenâ€™ in Kihei, about 7 minutes drive from hotel, huge portions and great food) We stopped at Costco right after we got off the plane and bought way too much stuff and ended up giving what was left to the valets. Also, if you want to go anywhere in Wailea use the shuttle! The shuttle is a Cadillac Escalade, so you know itâ€™s nice. Might as well use the shuttle even if you have a car because you are already paying for it with the resort fee. The grounds were immaculate! The pool was small but perfect for adults. If you have kids you might want to consider the grand wailea because there pool area is phenomenal. The hot tub area was very unique, very Japanese. They had soaking tubs and a waterfall and a hot tub. It was really nice and relaxing. Overall, our trip to the Hotel Wailea was awesome! Perfect way to start off our marriage. We will definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect sunset view, quiet, and well kept”
Reviews.Author: tchristian
Reviews.Content: We were married on Maui, and selected this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. We stayed 8 nights. The hotel rooms are still undergoing incremental renovations. While our room had not been renovated yet and showed wear (carpet stains and shower tile stains) it was extremely clean, everything worked perfectly. It was an upstairs unit with a perfect view of the pacific, with no obstructions. The hotel is on the hill above the beach in Wailea, and you have a beautiful view of the Pacific, Kahulalawa, Lanai, and West Maui. You cannot see the Beachfront hotels and they do not block your view. It was very quiet, and the hotel did not appear full. The hotel staff was fantastic, start to finish. We didn't ask much of them, but everything we did ask was done quickly, efficiently, and with a smile. They seemed delighted to have us as guests. We understand Capiche, the restaurant in the hotel is very nice and the food is excellent, but we never took the opportunity to eat there. It did seem popular though, and there was an "event" of some sort there almost every night. The good news is though that you can't hear the restaurant from your room. Our only suggestion would be puttting in some sort of more casual bar or lounge. Capiche is pricey, and it would have been nice to have someplace to grab a nightcap at the hotel. We leveraged the "one night free for every 4 nights", getting 2 nights "free". We would recommend this hotel for couples who want a quieter, independent experience. Beautiful grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but dated...”
Reviews.Author: Soph81
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in early October. The price was fair and the morning breakfast was good to start the day. The view was pretty and it was within close driving distance to all things in town. The staff was fantastic and very friendly. Although our room was clean and the bed comfortable, the room was definitely dated and I felt like we had been transported backwards to the late 80's. However, to stay in Wailea for two nights and pay for what you could only get at the Grand Wailea for a single night, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: keppNjenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Wailea for a week. The staff was very friendly and the grounds were beautiful! We had mentioned to the front desk that we were there for our honeymoon, and they surprised us the next day with chocolate covered macadamia nuts in our room. If you can afford it, definitely stay in one of their panoramic ocean view rooms. We had a front row view of the Molokini crater and a beautiful sunset over the ocean every day. Some elements in the room were a bit dated (i.e., furniture, bathroom sink and shower area) but we really didn't mind. We loved how spacious the room was, and you can't beat the location in Wailea. It seemed to rain in every part of the island except for Wailea! Also, love love love your jalapeno cheddar bagels at breakfast. We will have to look for them at home.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: mauiwedding1
Reviews.Content: having the attendants at Wailea Beach was wonderful. They set out the umbrellas and the chairs and always had a cold bottle of water ready for us!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: hmac24
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to visit Maui for a girl's trip in September. We spent hours researching hotels and eventually settled on Hotel Wailea. (Last year our fall trip was to Greece and trip advisor was so helpful in selecting perfect accommodations, we felt the reviews were probably pretty accurate for Maui as well. If you ever visit Greece, I highly recommend Esperas in Santorini!) As everyone states, Hotel Wailea is quite a bargain compared to the other resorts in Wailea. The grounds are beautiful, the staff is friendly and most accommodating and the shuttle service is easy and quick. That said, our problems started with a room that was less than desirable. Our full ocean view was overlooking a pond. After calling the front desk it was eventually resolved, but we wasted an hour on something that should have been in order before arrival. (I even confirmed the room by email twice prior to arrival after reading a few negative reviews) Our new room had a wonderful view, but the view was the only thing I can brag on. The furniture was very outdated and the kitchen was really just a waste of space. The shower/bath was also a little awkward with no door or curtain. Luckily we didn't spend much time in the room, but I can assure you I would be disappointed if I was on my honeymoon and not a girl's trip. The other big let down about Hotel Wailea was the beach setup. We were so excited to spend a day at the beach so we took the shuttle to the drop off and began to look for someone with umbrellas. After much confusion we learned that our hotel's umbrellas and chairs were quite embarrassing. The chairs were absurdly uncomfortable and outdated and the umbrella made us stand out like a sore thumb. The standard issue beach towels were also very different than all of the other sun bathers surrounding us. We were given short white bath towels! To make matters worse, they kicked us out of our chairs at 3 p.m. sharp (note - this only applies to Hotel Wailea guests). Let's just say we didn't visit the beach again. I also must mention that the complimentary water they highlight is nothing more than a water cooler with small cups for self service by the umbrella kiosk. On the flip side, dinner at Capishe? was outstanding. Yoga by the pool was an unexpected treat and the front desk staff was extremely helpful. Breakfast was just average - you'll be sick of carbs by day five! We also enjoyed meeting several other guests around the pool. Looking back I would prefer to spend a little more to stay at a different resort and enjoy the beach and updated room accommodations. Like others have stated, maybe in a year or two they will have the entire property updated (and a better beach arrangement) and Hotel Wailea will be the complete package.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Maui Wedding!!”
Reviews.Author: mburton_81
Reviews.Content: We just got back to Australia after our GORGEOUS wedding in Maui, Hawaii! WOW!! It was so amazingâ€¦Maui is just absolutley breath taking! We went through Rachel Barnard at Hotel Wailea and had our ceremony there on the lawn and our reception in the Taiko room. Everything was just perfect! Rachel was so great right from the beginning! Trying to organize a destination wedding is hardâ€¦I KNOW!!! But keep at it, itâ€™s sooooooo worth it! Hotel Wailea had really affordable roomsâ€¦perfect for the Bride and Groom, and they absolutely make you feel like youâ€™re the only Bride they ever met! From Emily on the front desk, Ann in sales, or any of the concierge teamâ€¦Manny, Jerryâ€¦too many to mention, and then there was Rachel!! She is just soooo cool! Very fun and laid back but at the same time efficient and working hard make sure the whole day runs smoothly! Rachel was more than happy to organize ALL the detailsâ€¦as much or as little as we wanted! She worked with us through some plans we had already made ourselves, such as the officient and photographer, and just made it work. Besides all thatâ€¦the Lawn where the ceremony was held was GORGEOUS!!! There is no better backdrop in the world! All of our guests had the best time and said it was the coolest wedding! :) The cost was beyond reasonable and you can go as cost efficient or all out as you want! I also have to talk about our AMAZING photographer, Nicole Sanchez from Behind the Lens Maui. She too was the absolute coolest! So energetic and organized all at the same time! She got so many pictures organized in such a small amount of time, it was absolutely mind blowing to watch her in action and a pleasure to be a part of it! The we get the photos (a few days later I might add)â€¦.OH MY!!! They just stole my heart and took me back to that day and brought back so many memories. She captured EVERY important momentâ€¦she used some tradional shots and some modern style angles and I could not possibly be happier with her! She is the best Maui Wedding Photographer! Then thereâ€™s Rev. Valentine Rosete (Rev. Tino)â€¦again just sooooo cool! He preformed this amazing ceremony that was just so beautiful! From the blowing of the conch shell, to the Hawaiian robe he wore and the Hawaiian chant he sangâ€¦WOW!!! He does religious or non religious ceremonies as well as a lei exchange! So I canâ€™t say enoughâ€¦our wedding almost 3 weeks ago now, is still so fresh in our minds and we can look back and think how perfect it was! Yes a lot of weddings happen in Mauiâ€¦but for a reasonâ€¦it is stunningâ€¦and all these amazing people are here to help!! Mahalo Rach, Nicole and Rev. Tinoâ€¦you have made our wedding unforgettable! :)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Babymoon in Wailea.......”
Reviews.Author: Mauilover1118
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the Hotel Wailea! This was our second visit (so you have to know that it was worth coming back to). Our good friends of who live in Honolulu suggested the Hotel Wailea for a special retreat away from all the crowds at the hotels on Wailea Beach. I almost don't want to say how much we love it here so we can keep it our little secret. As soon as we arrived we were eagerly greeted by the ever so friendly bell staff. At check in they had cold towels to freshen up with (we had just flown in from Los Angeles on a 6 hour flight). We got a beautiful room with a fantastic ocean view. The king sized beds are very comfortable (this is coming from a 6 month pregnant mom to be). We love the layout of the room (which are all suites) and the grounds and landscaping are more beautiful than any other Hotel in Wailea (and we have stayed at the Four Seasons in the past). In the morning we love walking down to the beach, past all the hotels to the Shops at Wailea where we would call the bell staff to bring us back up to the Hotel, just in time for their lovely continental breakfast which included: carrot cake muffins (yummy), blueberry muffins, banana bread etc. and a variety of bagels (jalapeno flavored-my husbands favorite). They even have toasters to toast your bagels with. This is an upgrade to what they had last year (and we loved their spread last year). Speaking of upgrades, they now also have a pool bar, room service and fitness center (how nice to work out overlooking ocean views). We loved spending time at the pool, which was quiet and relaxing. The hotel consisted of couples, families and adventurous seniors. It's a place for everybody. The staff is always very friendly, especially their bell staff- Rowen and another guy (who also on staff last year -whose name escapes me right now- sorry). My husband loved that they delivered the Wall St. Journal every morning. Overall, Hotel Wailea is the best value on the island with a great service, beautiful grounds and unbelievable views. The upgrades from last year made a great hotel even better. We hope to make this our yearly escape.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this Hotel / Condo Hybrid Catering to Couples”
Reviews.Author: SilkyRichmond
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW - This is a great hotel for the price. It feels geared towards couples rather than families and is very tranquil in comparison to some of the bigger resorts. Rooms are a good size with a separate sleeping area, but could use a major cleaning and grunge removal effort. Pool and spa are nice and the staff are very friendly. Overall rating is 4.5. DETAILED REVIEW: Booking - Very easy online booking. We paid in advance and received a fantastic rate for a panoramic ocean view suite. After reading some other reviews where travelers did not receive their reserved room type or had room complaints, we contacted the hotel and were assured we would not have problems. Check In - Simple and efficient. Cool cloths and cold water at the check-in counter after a day of travel was a welcome surprise. Counter staff were very friendly and confirmed they had placed us in a room that would meet our needs. The check in area is a beautiful open air building and is really spectacular. Room - We requested a room on the 2nd floor to obtain the best views and were provided this. We also asked for a newly renovated room and were provided this. Rooms are a good size (about 900 sq feet) and has a separate bedroom area. Living room has a couch, a small table to eat at, and a small kitchen area with sink, fridge, and 2 burner stove. Nice size balcony that fits a couple lounge chairs easily. Overall, room was good for the price. Biggest negative is that the rooms can feel a bit dirty and grungy in some areas. We had to keep our flip flops on most times as our feet would get dirty easily. Rooms could do with a major cleaning effort and overhaul to remove some of the grunge. They just feel a bit old and dated. Grounds - The grounds of this hotel are very nice. You feel secluded and there are lots of little out of the way areas to explore. It almost feels more like a condo development that also has hotel amenities. We did a grounds tour with a couple staff members and together we picked a variety of fruit right from the trees. They cleaned them for us and later we found a nice basket waiting for us in our room with starfruit, spanish mangos, lemons and sunkists. What other hotel can you do this at in Maui? Amenities - The pool is small, but very nice with a variety of loungers, chairs, and beds surrounding it. We went to the pool every day and had no problems finding space. Only complaint is that there is not always service available for drinks as it is dependent on # of guests. But it is easy enough to bring your own beverages to the pool.
