The spa is also very neat and is apparently a japanese style spa. I know there have been some complaints with it, but we found it to be very relaxing. We would go there either every morning or evening and relax in the soaker pools, hot tub, waterfall room or sauna. No extra charge to use and we missed this luxury during the remainder of our stay at other hotels. We shuttled to the beach one day, but found the exercise a bit strained. Umbrellas are limited and the chairs feel very dated. But at least you have the option for beach access. Breakfast - The hotel provides a simple continental breakfast as part of the room charge. Coffee, juice, bagels, pastries, and fruit. Again, I know that some people have complained there is not enough food variety and that food can run out later in the morning. We found the variety adequate and had no issues. During our stay at the Westin later in our trip we were entitled to a big american style breakfast buffet each morning and found we missed the simplicity of the Hotel Wailea offering. Restaurant - We ate one evening at Capische and enjoyed the meal. Yes it is a bit pricey, but it is a somewhat fine dining experience. The risotto and gnocci appetizers are excellent. Ask the server what they recommend for entree and they will also steer you in the direction of what is best at the moment. CONCLUSION - We will definitely go back to the Hotel Wailea. We found it to be a nice option between a big beachfront resort and your typical condo complex. * Check out my reviews I will be doing of the Fairmont Kea Lani and Westin Resort for comparatives.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hotel Wailea. Relaxing and Fun”
Reviews.Author: criancadodeus
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful 7 night stay at Hotel Wailea. The hotel suite we stayed in was very clean and comfortable. It was a large suite with a living room, mini kitchenette and large walk in shower. There is a coin-operated laundry service for $2 per each machine. The hotel grounds are beautiful and peaceful. Because the hotel is nestled up in the hills, the view was spectacular. We had the opportunity to watch the sunset every night from our lanai and deck chairs. We emailed the hotel in advance to tell them we would be arriving later in the evening and asked for a â€œkitchen setâ€� to be delivered to our room. The set consists of extra plates and pots, plans, knives, cutting board, and glasses. Since the kitchenette is normally equipped with just a few plates and glasses, this was a good tip that we learned by communicating with a fellow Trip Advisor contributor. The hotel promptly wrote back and said everything would be ready. Upon arrival we received water and cold towels which was a nice touch. There is a $20 a night resort fee for several services including parking, morning coffee and pastries, wi-fi, fitness center, business center (has a printer for your boarding pass), yoga sessions twice a week, and a shuttle that will take you anywhere within Wailea. We choose to use the shuttle to take us to dinner spots and to take us down to the beach every morning. The beaches are not connected, so you cannot walk continuously along the beach, however, the paved walking path was a great way to see the scenery and get in a walk. We started at Polo Beach (access near the Fairmount Hotel) and walked down toward the hotels and shops â€“ about a mile. The hotelâ€™s beach towels and chairs are located at the beach at the Grand Wailea Hotel, where you can also eat in their restaurants and charge to your room. There is a beach-side stand next to the Grand Waileaâ€™s beach services cart to accommodate you. We did not know until we go there, but there are two restaurants at the hotel. Capische and Il Teatro at Capische. If we had understood that better we would have made reservations at both places. However our meal at Capische was the best meal we had on Maui. They catch their own fish every day, make their own pastas and ice creams and offer a wonderful view of the ocean and sunset, or have tables in their garden area. We made reservations in advance of our trip by using OpenTable since we learned it is a popular place and can be hard to get in on short notice. We used the hotel site to book the room and because we booked in advanced, the price on their site was better than any other Internet price. The staff went out of their way to assist us and to ensure we had a great stay. We are looking forward to returning to the Hotel Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Japanese bath house-- not working”
Reviews.Author: yes_spa
Reviews.Content: really looked forward to its traditional japanese bath house facility. however, the hotel changed it to co-ed, so you have to wear swimwear to get into the super hot water. because it was not orginally designed for co-ed, there was no dressing room or private shower room. almost half of the shower heads at their washing stations were broken. for people who are familar with the japanese style bathhouse, the hotel also removed all small stools and buckets from the washing stations. if you want to shower before getting into the water, you would need to kneel down on the floor, which was really awkward. by the way, the kitchen was really tiny and our stoves were not working well, either. no microwave, no oven, no dishwasher.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LandT_Barbee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days in Maui for 3 days island hopping for our honeymoon and Hotel Wailea was just what were were looking for. Note that the hotel is not right on the beach but this is kind of a plus because all the beach hotels in Wailea are pretty huge with tons of activity, loud pools, and filled elevators. Hotel Wailea was quiet, remote, and beautiful. The grounds were beautifully kept and fresh cut flowers were placed all over. The pool is small (about the size of a normal residential pool) but there were beautiful beds and chairs to relax in and we never had trouble finding a spot. The hotel had a free shuttle service to take us around the Wailea area to the shops beach to wander the other giant hotels. Also a great bonus the arrangement with the Grand Wailea (hilton hotel) to allow for charging to your room at the Hotel Wailae for items at Grand Wailea. This is great for getting drinks, food, snorkel gear, etc. at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fresh2def1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights as part one of my honeymoon. My wife and I had a panomaric ocean view room, and the view was incredible - overlooking wailea with views of molokini. Sunrise and sunset were great. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful. Shuttle to the beach was easy and efficient. All of the shuttle drivers were great. Took advantage of the spa area and enjoyed nice sunsets from the hot tub. Couldn't have asked for more for the price we paid. Ate dinner at capische. Though pricey, it is within the range of every other nice restaurant in wailea with greater quality. Loved our dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “EPIC experience at Hotel Wailea!! :)”
Reviews.Author: KaiGirl808
Reviews.Content: I originally traveled to Maui for business...I ended up staying an extra night and throwing some leisure time in there!! :) I was so impressed with this amazing island that I couldn't leave! Hotel Wailea rocked! The most breath taking views of the Maui Coast came right from my lanai. The views alone literally took my breath away...I couldn't get away from my lanai, even with business calling! I've stayed beach front multiple times here in Maui... I didn't think you could beat walking out of your room and right into the sand...But being able to see the entire coast line and what the entire beach, sky and Maui beauty has to offer, is incomparable. Large rooms and awesome pool bar scene too... Not to mention...CAPISCHE? Every time I travel to Maui, I make it a point to have dinner at Capische. Best risotto I have ever had, amazing wine list and ono martinis! Fun, good company too, since I was traveling solo. Absolutely insane restaurant. The staff at Hotel Wailea was more than accommodating...very personable, helpful and gave me that real Maui Aloha Experience. Hotel Wailea is also near Kihei, which has some rockin' local bars and restaurants too... (Just in case you like to switch it up!) Love this place...it won't be long before I return! THANK YOU, HOTEL WAILEA, FOR A MUCH NEEDED, AMAZING WEEKEND. :)

Reviews.Title: “retro maui cool”
Reviews.Author: rebeccawow
Reviews.Content: i loved this place. set back from the resort madness in wailea, hotel wailea is perfect for couples without kids and/or wanting something a bit more private -- relaxing, clean and had a great retro vibe. amazing restaurant onsite (one of the best in the area by far), poolside beds and 4pm mai tais. truly one of the best places i've stayed in maui.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise On Maui”
Reviews.Author: Holly86London
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i have just got back from a two week stay at the Hotel Wailea. We spent so much time beforehand researching which hotel to stay in, and after seeing all the others we were very pleased with our choice-(Well, our first choice would have been the four seasons but our budget didn't quite reach!) This hotel is truly a hidden little gem. No one seems to have heard of it, and up until a year ago it was a japanese only resort. There are Japanese traits everywhere-beautiful japanese gardens and waterfalls. But very small showers and strange bathrooms layouts. This hotel is slowly undergoing significant changes, and i give it two years before it's much more advertised and busy. We were told it was at 100% capacity and most days we had the entire pool to ourselves! This is definitely not a place for children. In fact, they should officially make it an adults only resort because there only seemed to be couples there, and there was one family with kids who i heard changed hotel as the children were so bored. This hotl is all about the peace and quiet and that's what makes it so amazing. We walked past the hotels down on the beach and they were so noisy in contrast. The Grand Wailea looked like a circus! Kids swinging from ropes and the pool smelt of urine-awful. Going back to Hotel Wailea was serenity. The breakfast was OK, but only OK. It could have been so much better and they don't need to do much to improve it. A bit more choice of fruit would have been nice, and they'd often run out of jam or juice at 8am- breakfast is 7-9am so it's not very hard to make sure they have enough supplies. The bagels and muffins were lovely but sometimes a choice of cereal or something a little lighter on the stomach wouldn't go amiss. The rooms were really big! It's your own little apartment which is perfect if you want to store drinks/food in the fridge or eat in some nights. They are crying out for a makeover, but i did hear that they will all be updated in the near future. Again, if they just re-carpet and re-upholster the furniture then they'll look brand new! The beds are super comfy. The free shuttle down to the beach is fantastic- not a shuttle at all, a lovely escalade! And the boys who dop you off and pick you up are fab- look out for Max he's just brilliant, as they all are (and they tell you the shuttle finishes at 10pm but the boys said they'd still collect you up until 2am!) It's only a 3 minute car ride to the beach/shops or 20 min hilly walk. We didn't get round to eating in Capishe? as we didn't like the look of the menu- but it's a big deal in Wailea. Apparently Adam Sandler was eating there a couple of months previously! And it has a killer view. The hotel offers free wifi and parking too! All in all we had a lovely relaxing holiday here and if it stays the secret it seems to be then we'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Some great points - Some poor points.”
Reviews.Author: CocoSianElle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked at this hotel for the last part of our honeymoon via a company we used for a multi centre honeymoon. I will start by saying that the location and grounds of the hotel are lovely. However their are a few things that are letting this hotel down. When my husband and I arrived we were shown to reception whilst our bags were loaded onto a trolley. The receptionist took our details and advised us that we would need to pay a resort fee. This was something that we were unaware of so questioned it, however we were advised it must be paid. After a long day of travelling I didn't really want to stand around and argue so we paid up. Now my issue with paying the resort fee is that the hotel sells itself on offering so many of is services 'free' or complimentary but I cannot see how when you are paying $20 for these 'luxuries'. The 'fee' included breakfast which you have to get there early enough to take advantage of. I agree with other comments made that their is not enough variety and it would be nice to see more yoghurts and fruits (we only had yoghurt on 1 day out of 7). My other issue with the breakfast set up is because a local company supply it, they bring in their own staff and one of them was rude to me on one of our last days. My husband and I arrived for breakfast at 9am (it closes 9:30) and their was only 1 bagel left and a hand full of pastries. I questioned the man serving and his response was "Well breakfast closes at 9:30" to which we replied that it was only 9 and was told they bring so much food and when it's gone that's it. So because all the food had gone, we had to miss out on something that we were paying $20 per day for! I then went to get a drink of water and found that their was none there. I asked where the water was and was told that he had already cleared it away. I asked him politely if he could return it as breakfast was still open for another half an hour. Whilst he was clearing up my husband and I had to make do with the left overs. I returned 5 minutes later to find no water. I did complain at reception and our resort fee was reduced for that day. This hotel either needs to restrict people to what they can have, order more food or simply just serve their own breakfast. Another perk of the fee is the use of the beach area at the Grand Wailea. Our first full day this was where we headed. We were taken down in the luxurious shuttle transport and was told to walk around the sea front. So we did this and arrived at the pool for Grand Wailea with the beach just in front of it. We spent a few minutes looking to see if there were any spare loungers on the beach but there were not. Just as we were about to lay our towels on the sand we noticed some hotel staff bringing loungers out for people so followed them back to find a stall with people queuing up for loungers and towels. When we got the the front of the queue we advised we were staying in the Hotel Wailea and was told we would need to go to the stall next door (which was actually renting scuba gear?!?). So anyway, told them we needed two loungers and two towels - We were advised to go to the beach and pick our spot and they would bring the loungers down. Now all of the other loungers were as you would expect - fabric to lay on, steel frame and the top and bottom areas adjust so you can lay dow, sit up, etc and a nice cream parasol. The 'loungers' that were brought out for us looked like something from the 50's. They were more like deck chairs as they had a wooden frame, dirty multi coloured fabric and the part you would put your feet on was a completely separate piece that had to be hooked on, also our parasols were blue and obviously very old. This was the one and only time we went to the beach as we both felt embarrassed as it was like we were singled out as staying in the 'poorer' hotel as the old and dirty equipment really made us stick out. Because of this we spent the rest of our holiday next to the pool. One good part of the fee is the spa and seemed to be a hidden gem. We were told about it when we booked in but it is not sign posted and is out of the way. But it really is beautiful and spotless. My husband would go in here for an hour or so everyday and there is always drinking water and cleaning products readily available which is obviously restocked numerous times through the day. The next thing is the rooms, I'll start by saying the bed is probably the most comfortable I've slept in for ages. Also the bath/shower room is an odd set up but because it was only my husband and I were staying we didn't mind it at all. Was always clean and in a bathroom that is important. The rooms do however require some updating, new carpets, sofa ect. The kitchen does seem a bit pointless as you haven't got any utensils (knifes, forks or pans) to use in it. On the website it states if you are a honeymoon couple you get some extra goodies - we did not receive any of these. I think in a year or so this hotel could potentially be superb but they definitely need some improvements. The grounds are beautiful with fresh flowers every morning, the spa is lovely and the pool is nice but we did have some let downs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Leki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week's stay at this property. It is a botique type hotel, which is what we tend to like. If you like noise and crowds, this is not the place for you. Also, if a "party" atmosphere is what you are looking for, you will not enjoy it here! This is a secluded property that is VERY quiet, which is exactly what we were looking for. It was a beautiful, restful retreat. The staff are amazingly friendly and helpful, especially Emily at the front desk. The only issue we incurred during our stay was when we first checked in we were given a room that did not have the panoramic ocean view we booked that we were expecting from the pictures on the website. We were told there were no more rooms like that until the next day, so we stayed in that room for one night, and then they moved us to a better view room the next day which was a little inconvenient, but not a huge deal. Also, I want to mention that the first room had stains on the carpets, and the couch in the living room was disgusting with large, HORRIBLE looking stains. There was an ocean view, but in my opinion it was not "panoramic". The second room had a much better view, newer carpet and only minimal stains on the couch. The couches are white so perhaps they have been cleaned but the stains are not removable. Be sure you ask for a room that has had the carpet upgraded and the couch is clean. If you want to really cook, do not be fooled by the kitchenette they advertise. One other negative thing I will mention is that the cooking equipment is minimal. We ordered a "cooking set" ahead of time as my travel agent recommended. This only included one very large pot and a very small skillet. No measuring cups, spoons, strainer, etc. The beach in Wailea is very nice, but crowded so it was wonderful to come back to the Hotel to the peace and quiet in the afternoon and watch the sun set from our lanai. I highly recommend paying the extra $ for the panoramic view.

Reviews.Title: “Trying Really Hard To Be Good”
Reviews.Author: Palmsandpines
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 2 night stay at this hotel. I called to tell them that I was on the way and 30 minutes away and wanted to ensure a nice view room and would wait for cleaning if necessary. I was told on the phone that I had a nice room and there was no way to make it any nicer. We arrived to find that they had given away our ocean view room and we were stuck with our choice of two partial ocean view rooms. They said that they would refund the $20 difference, but there is something wrong with that approach. I contracted to show up and they contracted to give me an ocean view. The attendant at the desk, while very nice, said reducing it by $20 (normal difference) was the best that she could do. First, I should have been told that the ocean view was gone when I called. Personally, if I was the manager, I would have given a out a couple of free drinks or waived the additional resort fee to make up for the mistake. The rest of the service was outstanding and the people were very nice. We used the shuttle a number of times and the valets were great! If I was the owner I would replace the carpet in the rooms (#1 priority) and I would add yogurt and maybe bananas at breakfast. I would stay again but would hope to see the slight improvements. I would also call to ensure that I really do have my ocean view. I would have rated service higher if they had done more to fix the overbooking of ocean view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: discerningmom45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent hours online looking for a hotel in Wailea for our FIRST trip to Hawaii. Hotel Wailea had great reviews and the online photos were enticing. We arrived late at night and enjoyed a great reception. The problems began once we entered the room. My teenage daughter literally burst into tears. The room was old and dirty. The carpet was filthy..more stains than clean spots. The pillow covers on the bed were dirty, the linens thin, and the white couch worn and soiled. The kitchenette that appeared so appealing online was old the hardwood floors in the entry and bathroom worn. Truthfully, we didn't want to touch anything in the room for fear of catching some disease. The bathroom had a very strange configuration. Families beware---there is no way to take to exit the shower area without exposing yourself to everyone else in the room. That is, of course, if you'd actually want to take a shower. The tiles were cracked, the grout was dirty. Needless to say, we contacted the front desk immediately. They offered another room, but it wasn't much better. We left as soon as we could find another hotel, which, unfortunately wasn't until the next morning. Also, be warned that unless you get to the complimentary breakfast early, you won't have much to choose from. We arrived 40 minutes before it was scheduled to close and all that was left was a loaf of bannana bread, a few bagels, coffee and tea. The fruit was gone and there were no plans to replenish. The grounds are nice... I wouldn't go so far as to say gorgeous, but 100% better than the rooms. The best I can say about the hotel is that the woman on duty at the front desk was gracious and patient in handling our complaints, refund and subsequent check-out. We had to pay more to stay at the Marriott, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It is a GEM !!!!”
Reviews.Author: aertssas
Reviews.Content: Beautifull place, If you like the " popular crowed thing " stay away. If you like tranquillity, very good and personal service, just go there. Make the popular beach / board walk,...with all the Fairmonts and other places. And enjoy the privacy of the Wailea Hotel, if you are returning to your suite. Yes, the rooms can have a update, but it is still clean and fora nature an silence loving people THE Best place at Maui ! Great views and a magnificant garden, I went down there, saw lots of birds . The Bar and Rest. are good, good value of ( italian orientated0, we arrived late and wanted to have a bite,.. they were very nice and hospitable, dinning outside is nice they even have privacy tables with sea view. We stayed for a week, did Hana, ( by our own Jeep) went surfing and sailing. The Hotel staff was correct and friendly at all times.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: PatGEllicottCity_MD
Reviews.Content: My family spent a fabulous week at the Hotel Wailea in August. We thoroughly enjoyed everything about the hotel would would highly recommend it. The staff was exceptional. They did everything to make our stay extremely pleasant. The pool and grounds are beautiful with a lovely view of the ocean. The continental breakfast was catered by a local Coffee company and was extremely good. The restaurant on premise, Capishe? was an exceptional dining experience. The shuttle service to the beach was great. It is less than a five minute trip and the service was very prompt. The Hotel (although not on the beach) has arranged for towel service, beach chairs and umbrellas at the Grand Wailea. Our suite was spacious with a king bedroom, a living area with dining table, small kitchen, a sleeper sofa and a large lanai. This truly is a boutique hotel, small with all of the ammenties of a larger resort. I have already recommended it to several of my friends and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhh...”
Reviews.Author: nalani65
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I stayed here for Labor Day weekend and we were all pleasantly surprised. The hotel is great, nice grounds, staff, rooms, amenities, and location. The rooms do need an update, but it does not mean that they are not clean. They are very clean and neat. We had a Partial ocean view room with 2 double beds that overlooked the Koi pond. Since we didn't have an ocean view, the Koi pond was a nice alternative. Continental breakfast was great and the grounds immaculate! I plan to stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value, Reviews Helped Us”
Reviews.Author: platinumdriver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Wailea for four nights and absolutely loved it. You are able to drop into the beach-front chaos but retreat to this magical location overlooking the ocean and several islands-from our room! If we had stayed elsewhere we would have driven to hidden beaches anyway-too crowded at the resorts. I enjoyed the new gym and free yoga class. The HW beach club was great-umbrulla and beach chair are heaven for us. Hotel Wailea is perfect for anyone who desires value (best room prices we found for Wailea) but does not require pampering-it's a hotel for "make your own fun" types-we had a beautiful dinner at their restaurant Capische. Enjoy, we will be back in February....It's a classy place!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Ballem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Our suite was fantastic and sooo spacious. We had a suite with a partial sea view. The view was stunning and the sunsets amazing. I highly recommend the italian restaurant at the hotel too. The food was delicious and well worth the money. All in all, a fantastic stay. Just wish we could have stayed longer! The only reason I would not give a five out of five is the breakfast - for what you pay, I think they should vary it a bit more - bagels and cakes every morning got a bit 'samey'...

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: vanessa_bautista85
Reviews.Content: Great location, awesome staff and fantastic amenities. We felt very welcome from our first day checking in to our last day checking out. The staff from the bell boys to front desk to even the gardeners were all awesome, So helpful and courteous. They even had a car service to take us around and pick us up around Wailea when we didn't have a hire car. The hotel itself is amazing. It is situated on top of the mountain and every room had panoramic views of the ocean from Molokini to the West Maui volcano. The gardens were beautifully maintained and it was so nice just walking through the gardens from room to room. The pool and spa/gym area had some of the best views I have ever seen. It was so relaxing and surreal to stay at Hotel Wailea. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot to take care of everything inside the rooms”
Reviews.Author: NikWonder
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our honeymoon stay at Hotel Wailea and it was overall a major letdown. To begin with, we stayed at the Four Seasons directly beforehand and probably were just a bit tainted by the experience, but the deficiencies at Hotel Wailea were so obviously weird, our stay just left us with questions about how the management spends their money and efforts! Cons: - Carpet had HUGE stains EVERYWHERE. We're not talking about the occasional "went hiking and walked a bit on the carpet." These were black-holes of stains all over the place... why wouldn't they change this? When we complained at front desk and asked if we could at least have a pair of slippers (they do have a fully operational spa ... I'm sure slippers could be arranged), they told us they had none but would wash our carpets to make sure they're clean. We decided against this ... it wasn't dirty; it was just old. - The furniture in the place is at least 20 years old. This would have been killer in the 80's, but time for a major facelift. - The bathroom was the weirdest setup ever. This bathtub had a shower stall (with the dirtiest tiles that had paint and caulking bits coming off from the force of the water) directly beside it, then a little hallway leading to the rest of the bathroom, but no curtain in sight. No idea how this is manageable to the general public... - On our last night, a little cockroach fell out of the lampshade. I know we're in a tropical country, but in another resort we stayed at they had a small can of RAID to help with such situations. Pros: - The grounds were beautiful ... they must have some of the best gardeners in the area, because they do beautiful things with their flowers and make a nice little community of waterfalls and bridges on the grounds - But ... forgive me for putting a con in the pro section, but I'm just seething here ... the very fact that the grounds were so immaculate was even more of a turn-off that they couldn't do anything more with the rooms; changing a carpet would have cost a fraction of what they probably do every day on those lawns - Capische is a nice restaurant on their property. Granted, we didn't really love our meal at all, especially for what we paid<!>, but this may have been just what we ordered Overall, the place was really unclean, and out of date inside. As a place for a honeymoon couple, I'd really recommend against this if you have other options. There are just so many beautiful hotels nearby that with some savvy Hotwire searching you can find others. Especially for a honeymoon, you most want a comfortable place that you can come home to, and have a romantic intimate way to unwind. The grossness of the room pretty much killed that buzz right away. BEWARE! This place's website makes it seem like it's paradise, but that it is NOT.

Reviews.Title: “Former private Japanese club a little mishandles by new American owners”
Reviews.Author: gemelie
Reviews.Content: It would be a perfect hotel if they maintained it up to the standards of the builders. It has everything you can dream of at Maui and very attractive low rates. I guess it is the best kept Maui secret and they are still trying to get publicity. All rooms are huge 1 BR suites but make sure you book the second floor if you don't want to keep shutters closed all day and night long from the walking by people. The room size if approximately 4 times that of Grand Wailea room. The cost is 4 times less and you have access and full use of Grand Wailea beach. Yes, you need a car but it is true probably to any hotel in Maui. The Spa, a masterpiece of Japanese design is unfortunately run down and it seems that they just let it be without any use by the hotel guests and minimum or no maintenance, If you decide to book a spa service, you are better off taking their shuttle to Grand Wailea and the Spa Grande over there. It will cost you less, and you will get the entire Maui spa experience equal to none versus the dark small massage room of the deserted spa at Hotel Wailea, which is surprsingly more expensive than the Spa Grande. The restaurant looks gorgeous but is overpriced though you will get a 20% voucher as a guest. We we mournng the sushi bar they nocked down when they took over this private Japanese club. You will enjoy your stay very much. For us, there is nothing like Wailea in Maui and this locaion is the only one which combines luxury and decent pricing. If you don't need the lavish pools of Grand Wailea for your kids, you will never regret your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to Maui and Hotel Wailea!”
Reviews.Author: UCFGrads
Reviews.Content: In a word: amazing. Hotel Wailea is a fantastic resort in a beautiful town on an incredible island. If you've been to Vegas, I liken it to The Mirage of Maui. It has a chic, classy, coolness to it that you won't get in any of the other resorts we saw. My wife and I stayed there for a week. Get a room with a panoramic ocean view. Waking up and walking onto your balcony is almost as beautiful as watching the sunset from your balcony. As others have said, you may wish you were staying on the beach...until you GO to the beach. It's a zoo down there. We went to the spa at the Four Seasons and it's gorgeous, but the number of people and general chaos down there is anything but relaxing. Hanging out on the beach or driving around and returning to the quiet cool of Hotel Wailea was fantastic. We were always able to get a spot by the pool, the spa was never full, continental breakfast was delicious, they have free parking and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Ask them about some of their fave things to do and they'll be happy to share. Wailea itself is beautiful and it's a very short drive from Kehei, which is a great little town filled with lots of restaurants and shops, but it doesn't feel at all touristy. It's a wonderful mix of locals and tourists. Not like Lahaina. We were very disappointed with Lahaina. It was dirty, the locals were rude and it was VERY touristy (Hard Rock Cafe and Bubba Gump Shrimp are there). You can't go wrong if you stay in Wailea and it will only be better if you stay at Hotel Wailea. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Vacation in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: ROKChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Wailea in Maui for one week. We stayed in a second level room, and our view from the balcony was perfect because we had a panoramic view of the ocean. We could see the neighboring Hawaiian islands, and each evening we watched the dramatic sunset. The view form the balcony also included a large pond with coy fish (the pond is located just outside of the building and from the balcony you look down directly at the pond) and we could see the large, upscale homes across the street from the hotel complex. However, not all rooms have this view. We really enjoyed our view and spent much time in the late afternoon and evening on the balcony. To the left of our balcony, we had a nice garden view with trees and flowering shrubs/landscaping. The neighboring roomâ€™s balcony was directly to our right, but fortunately the room was not occupied, so we had privacy when we sat outside. We would not have been happy with neighboring balconies on both sides of our room, which is the layout for most rooms at the hotel. The room was large, but the overall dÃ©cor is dated. At first we were disappointed with the dÃ©cor, but then we did not mind much after we saw what a great view we had! The room was partly renovated with a new stone floor in the entrance area and the walls were freshly painted and we had new bedding. It seems as though the remainder of the renovation is due soon. The kitchen area includes a small sink and a refrigerator, which was great to have. The lobby area is very nice and also had a great view of Maui, the other islands, and the ocean. We went to the Friday evening managerâ€™s reception and stayed for happy hour, which was a nice evening. The continental breakfast is also held in the lobby area and it included bagels, muffins, fresh fruit, coffee, and juice â€“ we were pleased with it for being a contenential breakfast. The pool area is also very nice and has a contemporary feel to it with new, modern patio/pool side furniture, and the pool bar recently opened and only serves soda, juice, and beer. We enjoyed the pool after a long day at the beach! The hotel restaurant, Capische, is completely overrated. However, we do live in a large city and have access to best restaurants as we please, so perhaps this is why we were not overly impressed with the restaurant. We sat in the bar area one evening and watched as the server and bartender attempted to exhaust a flambÃ© dessert that was accidently set on fire â€“ they really need to be careful during the flambÃ© process to ensure that it done correctly and not to set desserts totally ablaze!! Regarding beaches, the hotel is located a short drive away from many smaller beaches in Wailea, which is great if you enjoy going to a new beach each day. We only went to Wailea Beach on one day, but we did not like how crowded it was â€“ several large resorts are located there and therefore it is a very busy beach area. We did use the complementary beach chairs and umbrella, and these were great to have access to since it is hot in the sun. But, if you do not like large, busy beaches, be sure to drive to the smaller ones in the area. Overall, we recommend this hotel given the view we had, the location, the pool, and the breakfast in the great lobby area. We would like to see it when completely renovated. As well, the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need!!”
Reviews.Author: atn4usc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week trip from Maui. First of all, let me begin by saying that going back to reality sucks! Our week in Maui was incredible and much of it had to do with our wonderful accommodations at the Hotel Wailea. Attention crowd lovers, this place is not for you! You are probably thinking, who the hell loves crowds? Well, once you see the people staying at the Grand Wailea, Fairmont Kea Lani and the Marriott, you'll know what I mean. Tucked away on the side of the hill and a short 2 minute drive to the beach, this hotel offered us everything we were looking for. Quiet and spacious suite with full kitchenette and large bathroom, amazing ocean views, gracious yet unpretentious service, beautiful grounds, and sweet breakfast! From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with a warm smile and checked into our ocean view suite just in time to watch the sunset, which became an every night ritual. In the mornings, we often awoke dreaming about the carrot cake muffins and banana bread served for breakfast. Also, we really enjoyed picking the fresh mangos and avocados that grew on the grounds right next to our room. Rates were great, especially considering the area. Parking and Internet were free, which is a plus knowing that most hotel chain nickel and dime you for everything. All in All, my spouse and I highly recommend this hotel. Enjoy the pictures attached :)

Reviews.Title: “Reviews Helped.....This Hotel is fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: View-Master
Reviews.Content: Coming all the way from Ft. Lauderdale, we were heavily relying on former reviews-and we also read about Hotel Wailea in a Travel & Leisure article Great value play- let me explain: My partner and I had a huge room/suite with a three island ocean view for under $250/night-the other hotels were double-$20 Resort fee covered- European breakfast, free beach 5min. shuttle to their beach club (free chairs/umbrellas/water) free Internet use, free use of the new gym-plus free parking! We stayed at the hotel pool (hip!) one afternoon and drank champagne in a cabana and played bocce on the big lawn. The reviews helped us, thanks! here,thanks!fro

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, nice view”
Reviews.Author: adventureCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The room was large, the restaurant (although expensive was really good.) The pool, and spa were really nice. We liked that it was farther away from the craziness of the large resorts in Wailea. It really would have been nice for them to have a bar by the pool :) Hopefully they put one in soon as it is definitely more of a hotel vs. bnb and would benefit from one. The breakfast was continental and adequate. We were fortunate enough to be there on New Years Eve and the view of fireworks from the rooms was AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but in need of an update. And some advice - rent a car.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBros
Reviews.Content: - Very friendly and helpful staff (especially Emily at reception and Max the concierge) - Free shuttle service within Wailea area, until 2am, very handy as hotel is a very long walk from most restaurants, shops and beaches. Without that, you're a bit stuck, renting a car is a good option, which we did, and went to some great beaches that way. - The hotels website is a bit misleading. The spa was a big disappointment. Basically a large, very hot, hot tub, 1 working shower, a very very hot sauna! And a rain type shower. It seemed as though they were renovating this when we were there, but definately needs the update. - Breakfast. This has to be sorted out. It is served in the lobby, its not really an appropriate space to eat, not enough chairs and tables. We would suggest moving it to either the restaurants or downstairs there seemed to be deserted function room of a perfect size. The breakfast itself is out on a table with zero presentation. There are bagels, cakes, coffee, juice, water, muffins, andÂ yohgurts BUT BE WARNED itsÂ first come first served, i'd arrive latest at 9, or its all gone. Its just a bit of a frenzy, and should be a calmer experience and a bit more choice of food, cereals, milk, fruits, jams etc. But having said this, the cakes and muffins were great! - Room was nice. Again, the room needs an update, but there again is so much potential. Big open bathroom with strong shower and nice bath. Really good bed. Free internet, but very slow. - Atm and brochures were hidden downstairs under the lobby in a corner, need to bring it upstairs for people's convenience. - Pool area was ok, but best off on the beaches, i'd recommend Big Beach, on the very south of maui. - Really recommend renting a car, everything is more acccesible, strongly recommend this, and the best food we had was outside the resorts. Its cheaper and more local.Â

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place!”
Reviews.Author: putmeontheplane
Reviews.Content: We stayed while my husband attended a conference in Maui, and were so delighted with Hotel Wailea. From the first moment we entered the spectacular reception area we were greeted with warm and friendly service. Everything we needed was attended to promptly - nothing was too much trouble. We were so happy with the value of our accommodation - the room and view were very special. The pool area and general garden around the hotel was lovely. The hotel was quiet and private, but only a short shuttle trip from the busier hotels on the beach. We really felt the quietness of the Hotel Wailea suited us beautifully as the other resorts had people everywhere. We walked to the beach most days, about 20 minutes, and also back... good exercise - but if you want easier access to the beach then this might not be the place for you. The parking was great - we hired a car for a number of days and always found a park. Breakfast was a little light on, but as it was included in the price it was really fine. We had bagels or banana cake most mornings with some good coffee and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us... Knew what we were after”
Reviews.Author: Davebruin
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had read the many reviews and were prepared in advance that it wasn't on the beach, that the pool was small, etc. etc. I was actually questionning some of the reviews for this place and wondered if they were....ummm...fake (they aren't). The staff were great and I can best describe the whole atmosphere there as laid back and chill. For example, in the mornings I would drive my car up to the valet turnaround while we ate breakfast and just leave it there. The valet guys would say: "no problem. Take as long as you like." Contrast that with the Grand Wailea valet parking zoo/circus, and you'll understand what I mean :) Grounds: Beautiful. Many posters talked about the flowers everywhere, and we watched a man cut flowers from the grounds and place them ALL over the hotel each day. We saw the same man sweep them all up at the end of the day and start all over again the next day. We loved walking with the kids on the paths and stopping to play croquet or bocci ball. The kids also loved feeding the KOI each day. Breakfast: Catered by Honoulu Coffee Company. Breakfast was fine. Decent scones, bagels, etc. and POG. It wouldn't hurt them to throw a papaya in once in a while, but whatever. If you tried to feed your family of four at the actual Honolulu Coffee Company store at the Shops in Wailea, it would easly be $20-30 per day. Other Food: We didn't eat in the fancy restaurant. They now offer poolside and room service picnic items which I thought was a good idea, though we didn't take advantage. Sodas were a dollar at the pool. A dollar. Nothing costs a dollar on Maui. Give points to HW for listening to their customers and offering new services. Pool: It's fine. it's wet and clean. The benefits, especially after visiting Grand Wailea, is the calm and peace in the pool area, even with kids. Our kids had a great time in that pool, and we loved that fact that we could hang out in a sheltered day bed for FREE. We felt like we had the place to ourselves, even though we didn't. Spa: Quirky little spa that was cool. It's now coed and despite rumors, bathing suits are required. Sitting in the large hot tub and looking out over the ocean. Nice work if you can get it. While we were there, they were rebuilding the gym area, and according to Hotel Wailea Facebook they had just opened it...only they didn't...cause we were THERE, and trust me it was NOT open. A little advance marketing is ok, though we were laughing at the time reading the post. Room: We had panoramic ocean view room and it was great. We used the little kitchen and had no issues. The bathroom is big, but my only complaint is that it's open to the bedroom and offers little privacy for a family of four trying to share. Our view was gorgeous. We'd watch the sunset every night and almost NEVER saw another person on a balcony. We loved that feeling of peace and quiet after exploring the Island all day. Overall: I think under current management this hotel is really trying hard to please its guests. We had very little to complain about and thought it was a great base of operations. We surprised the kids with a one night visit to the Grand Wailea in the middle of our stay, and after two days of "Vegas on Maui," were were quite happy to return to the serenity of HW. Suggestions: 1. Get some fruit for breakfast. It's Hawaii for cryin' out loud 2. Finish the gym (ok...check) 3. Don't promote your hotel too much. We like the balance of you staying in business but being a hidden gem (selfish much?) 4. Keep your rates reasonable (we'd like to come back) 5. Keep doing what you are doing Tips to travelers: 1. READ the reviews. It's not on the beach. If you want on the beach, go elsewhere :) 2. See breakfast notes above. If you want bacon and eggs, cook your own or head down the hill. There are plenty of places willing to take your $$$ 3. Take advantage of the "chill" attitude. One night my wife and I went up to the spa in our hotel provided robes, and then we marched straight up to the lobby for a drink. They were happy to see us and even though they were closing the bar, they stayed open just because we were wearing our robes :) Too fun. Feel free to ping me if you have specific questions. :)

Reviews.Title: “This place is a great place to spend your vacation”
Reviews.Author: MsPatty1
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and very well kept. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. The white carpet in the room was less than desirable but it is hard to keep white carpet clean with guest continuously coming and going. The only disappointment we had was the $20 daily hotel fee that is charged for shuttle transportation to the shops and beach and for bottled water while on the beach or pool -- transportation was provided but when we asked for water there was a $5 charge per bottle and we were told that the only water you were provided with was the bottle you received at check in and that is not what is stated in the information section of the hotel. When we called this to managments attention it was immeditely taken care of and they went over and above to confirm we were totally satisfied. This is a great resort and I would recommend it to any and all if you are looking for an enjoyable relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great lower cost lodging at Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Needagoodbed
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our choice of the Hotel Wailea and would definitely return on another trip to Maui. The staff is friendly and helpful, our suite was spacious and airy and had a fantastic view. The price of the hotel is great in comparison to others in the area. But the hotel is not for everyone, and we would hesitate to recommend it to some people we know. If the hotel is for you, stay there. If it isn't, then think twice. The Location The hotel is up the hill from the ocean, so if you like having the convenience of being on the beach, the place is not for you. They do offer transportation service to the Wailea beach and elsewhere in Wailea, however. The valet/transport staff were very friendly. You can walk downhill to the beach in about 15-20 minutes, but it is steep, and coming back up will take much longer and I would only recommend it if you are in shape. Not what you would want to do if you have beach stuff with you. There are also public parking areas at a couple of the public access areas to the beaches, so if you have a rental car, this is a good option. The Suite The suite was large. We had two beds and one sofa bed which made this practical for us and our two older teens. The sofabed mattress was not great, but this is not surprising. The bathroom is odd: It was practical having a separate toilet and a separate sink area. But the shower/tub area is connected to the bedroom and there is no door. This was a bit inconvenient traveling with the older kids. There is a nice small kitchen area with a fridge and a few plates, glasses, and forks, etc. Though there is a two burner stove, there are no cooking utensils, so unless you bring your own, it is not so useful. (We managed to use it to heat up some leftover pizza wrapped in foil.) There is no microwave. There is a nice patio looking out over the ocean. Unfortunately, our unit was close to the road, and it was annoying to be in such an otherwise tranquil place and to hear the locals (I presume) driving by early in the morning. This was one blemish to the suite experience. The Hotel There is a nice balcony area where continental breakfast is served from 7:30 to 9:30. There is an excellent choice of bagels, scones, muffins, breads as well as yogurt and whole fruit, coffee and tee. We found that the some of the items ran out before the breakfast ended at 9:30. The balcony area turns into a lounge in the evening with nice live music. We did not try the restaurant at the hotel. This is not a resort, and most people seem to use the hotel as a base, leaving for the day at the beaches or for exploring the island. The nice pool area was very quiet all the time. There is a small kiddie pool that I never saw used. If you wanted a small pool for toddlers and a tranquil environment to relax around, this would be a nice place, as long as being at the ocean is not a priority. Kids older than toddler age would probably go crazy with the lack of activities. There is also a Spa area open from noon to 10pm. The area includes showers, sauna, jacuzzi, soaking pool, etc. This area seems to be undergoing some renovations, but it was open. It is not clear what people are supposed to do with the thigh-high shower fixtures and shampoo that are arranged around the outer edges of the spa area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mradventurebear
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel early evening just in time to watch the sunset. Our greeting at checkin was quick friendly and informative. The staff where amazingly helpful and seemed very happy and eager to help. We checked into our room and where surprised to find a very spacious living area with kitchen and dining table. A huge bed and a great wetroom. We had the luxury condo which had the absoloutly beautiful panoramic view over the ocean. We had the Ocean view originally which would have been on a slightly lower level but we're surprised to find we had been upgraded which was great! We ventured to the cafe Capiche which is very overpriced but you will be gaurenteed out standing food and service and if you order one entree between two and an apertizer that can keep the cost down. We had the Lobster and seafood special and the risotto which was very tasty. We also got a complimentary 20% discount for staying at the hotel too which also brought the price down. We did have a one night splurge there and it was worth every penny. One major thing we noticed dure in our stay was how quiet it was. It seemes most people don't venture to the spa or know it's there but my wife and I went every evening and we only saw another soul in it once or twice. It's highly reccomended to ease your throbbing feet after a long day and it's free unless you want a massage. The grounds around the hotel are beautiful, carefully and lovingly maintained and a walk at night will relax the weary traveller with great views and lit paths with tiki torches. The only downside I could possibly find would be that it's a short drive from the nearest town and it's not on the beach but secluded in the hills (Although my wife and I prefered that very much to the crowded beach resorts) All in all the Hotel Wailea comes with the highest reccomendation from me and serves as a great base to plan all of your adventures on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor reviews led us here accurately”
Reviews.Author: Chingachgook
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed staying at the Hotel Wailea immensely. Coming to Maui for a meeting at the Marriott, we wanted something less typical large hotel. The Hotel Wailea is as described here. The grounds are beautiful. Though a good occupancy this week, we see few people and the environment is quiet and peaceful. We have a wonderful ocean view. The rooms are large and very nice. The room does need some spiffing up of details related to age but nothing really detracts from enjoying the facility. The refrigerator in the small kitchenette works fine, you just have to adjust the temp setting. We set ours too high because of a review here and things froze. The continental breakfast is fine. The internet works well. The staff as with most hotels in Hawaii lives aloha. We would definitely return here and would certainly recommend it for anyone seeking what it offers and delivers well. It is a beautiful, friendly small boutique hotel, quiet(not a kids place), a perfect base for a restful trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View!”
Reviews.Author: MassCouple2
Reviews.Content: Although not on the beach at Wailea, this hotel is only a short distance away (~1/2 mile drive up the hill), but with a much better view, and much better price! The island views of Lana'i, Molokini, and KahoÊ»olawe are breathtaking! (ask for a 2nd floor room) A collection of 4-unit buildings, with very spacious suites ... ours had a king bedroom, separate tub and shower, kitchen/dining/ living area, with a private lanai (balcony). The pool was nice and very simple (by Hawaiian resort standards), but very well kept, and without hoards of people! The attached restaurant, "Capische?", was great (though somewhat pricey). An included Continental breakfast buffet is served daily in the open-air lobby area ... good views and good food (but you'll have to beat the birds to the buffet table!). Good location to drive to either HaleakalÄ� or Hana ... much closer than KÄ�Ê»anapali or Kapalua. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone (as long as they don't need to be right on the beach)!

Reviews.Title: “Coming back next year”
Reviews.Author: Dilla728
Reviews.Content: I want to tell people to stay away from here only so it says a hidden gem. The staff was friendly, the grounds are well kept, the room are big, the pool is heated to just the right temp, the sap is free, there is a free breakfast, and parking. I loved this hotel so much, it was out of the way and quite. The only con would be that its not beach front, but if it was you would be paying 2x , but they make up for not being a beach front hotel by having a free shuttle down to the beach (and shops) as well as having beachside service. We will be coming back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: millerc33
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from our first trip to Hawaii. Our stay at Hotel Wailea was great. The hotel staff were outstanding and the grounds very beutiful. I would recommend anyone statying in Maui to consider the Hotel Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: lokev
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying at Hotel Wailea... beautiful hotel, superb service, quiet, relaxing & most important romantic setting. Not one complaint... would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit review; already booking the third!”
Reviews.Author: KonaJoe14
Reviews.Content: Wow, its hard to believe I reviewed this hotel 7 months ago, and I guess you'll all be reading my third review come 2011, but let me cut-to-the-chase and give you the hard-core skinny on this place from round two: Wife and I have stayed at the Kea Lani, and Kamaole Beach condos for reference... Wife and I stayed in the same room as last time (requested and received)...partial oceanview... Staff was pretty much the same. Service level? FANTASTIC! Ayumi at the front desk, and Manny, and Max out front were simply amazing! Each one remembered Lynn and I, and made us feel like we were coming back home, instead of on tour, thousands of miles away from home. They all personify the "Aloha" spirit, and I believe they set the stage for wonderful vacation experiences. I had the opportunity to see two other rooms and they were all in about the same condition and here's the deal: large, condo-like rooms.....VERY big and comfy beds....very spacious (it never feels crowded at the resort even at 80-90% capacity) resort...beautiful, well-maintained grounds, set back up on the hillside overlooking Wailea Beach.... Rooms need some minor "refreshing"....my suggestion to management was to either trash the carpeting and tile the floors, or get new carpeting...looks like they are preparing to do just that. Its not that the rooms are in bad shape, but a stain on the carpet in one room, or some thread fringe on a carpet in another, were visible, and I could assuredly see how some folks might not rate them as highly as others (self included). I have said this to the many folks who reached out to me last year, and will say it agin to anyone else who wants more info: This is NOT the Kea Lani. Its not all marble and granite; not trendy and flashy, not beachfront. Its also NOT $450 a night for a decent room there. We had a great deal by dealing directly with the resort and paying 60 days in advance, and shaved off a little more than $300 per night from what we paid at the Kea Lani. Hmmmmm....$300 a night....times 5 nights.....I'll let you do the math. Emails are welcomed if you have questions.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: tre341
Reviews.Content: I wish I was still at this hotel. The rooms were spacious and private. The BEDS... I have never slept better on a vacation (super cozy duvet and excellent mattress). The staff were so friendly and helpful that they really made the experience extra special, and the continental breakfast was very good. Not the usual boring danish and bagels, I ate amazing banana bread and a jalapeno cheddar bagel almost every morning (but there were a number of other options). The beach isn't the most private (shared by surrounding hotels), but staff will drive you there and pick you up and the hotel provides towels. If you're looking for a private, relaxing, beautiful (& inexpensive!) place to stay in Maui, I highly recommend this hotel. It's the least expensive hotel in Wailea that I've found, but you wouldn't guess it from staying there. Wailea is my favorite place to stay in Maui, and I will be back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but flawed”
Reviews.Author: sumokiama
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea is a beautiful place no doubt about it and the price is very competitive. The main buildings housing the lobby, restaurant and spa are architecturally among the most lovely on the island...much classier than the way more expensive big beach hotels. The view from our ocean front 2nd floor room was spectacular and the grounds are very pretty. All of which make the poor detailing of the rooms so disappointing. It appears that the hotel is low on funds and the fixtures and furniture have not been updated since the hotel was built years ago. The bathtub drain would never stay open, the cooktop was decrepit, the shower was chipped, the kitchen utensils were from WWII, etc. The rooms (we moved once) simply did not match the rest of the hotel. Also, many of the pool tiles were missing (sitting at the bottom of the pool), the spa fixtures were broken and yada yada. It would not take much to update the hotel and make it a first class place.

Reviews.Title: “MOST ROMANTIC WEEKEND ON MAUI”
Reviews.Author: AngelikaDickeson
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Wailea was the most romantic experience ever. Stunning views from the Rooms and beautiful garden with streams full of Koi fish, Gazebos and flowers everywhere. I can't wait to spend another weekend there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: legs44
Reviews.Content: Highly recomend this hotel. You are not right on the ocean, but for the price you still have wonderful views of the ocean. Your room is like a small condo with a large open area for shower and deep tub. The room is quiet since you are a few blocks from the beach. Our room had a cook top, coffee maker, fridge. The staff was very friendly and were at our beck and call if needed. The pool was nice along with having laundry facilities near by that made it easy to do some clothes washing. Not really a complaint, but breakfast was basicly toast and juice. I prefer more than that for breakfast so we never ate there. The other issue is depending on where your room was, you may have a bit of a walk from the parking area. You could always get one of the staff to take you to your room on the golf cart. Loved this...it was close to being at home!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, perfect location, relaxing spa, superb food & drinks”
Reviews.Author: HNL-CFI
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea exceed our expectations 1,000%. We wanted to get off the beaten path and get as far away from the glitzy hustle and bustle of Wailea Town. It's only a 3 minute drive from Wailea Beach (where Hotel Wailea guests can get free beach service, umbrellas, towels, etc), but its location situates it perfectly slightly up the hill and away from the tourist traps below. The views are spectacular. Our room had a panoramic view of 3 islands (Kaho'olawe, Lanai, Molokai). All rooms are suites and all appear to have equally beautiful and private sweeping views of the garden grounds and the ocean and neighbor islands. The rooms are laid out such that you aren't aware of your neighbors and nobody can see into your room--all you see is garden and ocean. The Japanese-style Onsen (Furo) was the highlight. This is a big coed hot spring-type spa with all kinds of relaxing water treatments. Of course this is at no charge. There's also a mini-furo in the suite itself, but the spa was uncrowded and we used it a couple times each day. Outside on the pool deck, we relaxed in what can only be described as 4-post beds with sofa cushions and awnings. On the pool deck! These provide ample sun protection and are comfy enough to chill out in all day, while viewing the neighboring islands and the garden grounds. The pool is heated, too. Of course, drink service is available by the pool and drinks here are remarkably well priced (couple bucks for a beer--not like how the big resorts usually rip you off at the pool bar). Other on-property amenities include hammocks, little hiking and walking trails, and a free shuttle to and from the beach. The Concierge was well-trained and well connected and helped us make reservations for fun things to do around the island. We had our big night out at Capiche, the on-property restaurant. It was a 1 minute walk from our room (and the spa) which was good since we drank a bunch of their amazing wine over a leisurely dinner. The food was unequivocally out of this world. Italian cuisine taken to a new level, with classy service, an impressive wine list, and a waiter who knew lots about the food and the wine. We mostly had what the waiter recommended and it was all most excellent. We were full after 3 appetizers and one entree. Free breakfast each morning consists of pasteries, fruit, fresh coffee and juice. Having breakfast provided takes a lot of the frustration out of travel and helped us get on with our day without wasting time figuring out what to eat in the morning. Overall, this has been one of our favorite trips and our new favorite destination on Maui. Word is it's a happening place during the Wailea Film Festival. We can't wait to come back. What an amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: seahope
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby and grounds. Paid attention to details such as placing random flowers in strategic locations like lining the stairs with hibiscus. Front of hotel has a really cool vintage Jeep restored. bellboys are very friendly, helpful, and very smiley! Pool was pretty but small, although we did not use it. Nice Italian restaurant, but we didn't go to Maui to get Italian food. Air vents in room needed dusting, but otherwise clean room. We had an ocean view suite. Living room could have had more comfy furniture. Bed was very nice, and we slept very well. Room looked identical to internet video. Had a chicken outside...kinda funny. On the island though, they are everywhere. It's not on the ocean, but they will shuttle you there in 3 minutes with towels, chairs, and umbrellas for your use down there. Bathrooms prob need to be updated to keep up with the more upscale hotels nearby. Very quiet here, which was nice. Overall I give it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet! Great Value! Nice grounds, accomodating staff!”
Reviews.Author: ginanbob
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay! For a continental breakfast, I would give it an "A" A local coffee shop brought in wonderful bagels you could toast and quality coffee!!! Read another review, and it did not sound like what we had! If you NEED to be ON the beach this hotel is not for you! It is easy to get to the beach and a chair is reserved for you from the hotel!!!! That was great!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: luvinature
Reviews.Content: I just loved Hotel Wailea. The rooms were huge, although they needed to be updated they were still nice. We loved the giant shower & bath tub. The balcony was since to sit on in the morning or evenings. Our room had a small view of the ocean and of a little pond. I loved the Aveda bath products and the wonderbeds including the linens. The maid service was very good. The front desk staff was not bad either. The grounds were just beautiful and all lit up at night. I loved Wailea because it was much less touristy lass other parts of Maui. I can't say enough good things about Hotel Wailea and the city of Wailea. If I can help anyone plan thier just let me know, I know I have gotten lots of great tips from Tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, serene, overlooking the Pacific.”
Reviews.Author: Inluvwithjapan
Reviews.Content: Sometimes when you drive into the parking lot, and it's eerily empty and quiet, that's usually not a good sign. But frankly, it's just what the doctor ordered. Yes, it's not right on the water, but the ocean is right in view. The rooms are suites, and in nice shape with alot of amenities. And get this. The management wine/cocktail reception is ACTUALLY attended by the general manager. Blew me away. Came back and really gave us a welcome and a handshake. Okay, it's not the Four Seasons Wailea, or the Fairmont, or the Grand Wailea which are all on the water and boasts up to 800 rooms. This is about 1/2 miles from those hotels, maybe 150 suites and beautiful grounds.....for 60% less than what you'd pay at the aforementioned hotels. I'm just saying...you want to relax by the pool and save some green....this is a good place to be!

Reviews.Title: “"Very Cool Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: GoldStandard
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just ended a seven day trip to Maui and really enjoyed this hotel. The price was great for Wailea, we had a large one bedroom with full ocean views. The free electric car shuttle to the beach club was great, no issues and fast! Beautiful beaches in Wailea. There was an Adam Sandler movie being filmed on the beach but we never saw him. The restaurant is expensive but we loved it, hey it's Wailea. We also had a great dinner at Spago at the Four Seasons. We would recommend this hotel to people who like peace at the pool by day, fine dining around Wailea by night. If you like crowds at every turn this hotel is not for you. We had a blast and will be back to Hotel Wailea. Winter.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: yandg
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at Hotel Wailea last week, we had a three island view from our room. We initially read the reviews and liked the "value" mentions. It was a fun, fantastic time (lots of beach days)-our best Maui trip ever. We had dinner (incredible risotto!) at the Hotel Wailea restaurant (in the garden) after a long relaxing day at the beach. The fun part was Jennifer Aniston was at the bar with a small group including Dave Matthews who played guitar in the lounge after their dinner-absolutely incredible time! We were told they are currently filming a movie here in Wailea, makes sense because we did see filming crews down the beach. We plan to be back in December and will absolutely stay at Hotel Waile

Reviews.Title: “The Best Botique Hotel On Maui for Events”
Reviews.Author: jimlynchart
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wailea is the Best Hotel on Maui period. For over 20 years we have been conducting and cordinating art workshops in Montana, New Mexico, Colorado and Ireland. In April we co-sposored an event for M. Stephen Doherty, Editor in Chief of American Artist, for over 31 years, at the Hotel Wailea. The Hotel Wailea is our best experience ever. Not only did Mr. and Mrs. Doherty enjoy their excellent accomidations and visit to Maui. Markus Schale, the General Manager and his staff provided the superior service and gracious hosting that soothe the challenges of coordinating an event for people of great diversity and accomplishment. Five stars all around and a special thanks to Ann Ikuta, Sales and Events Manager, and Markus Schael for their incredable level of professionalism, courtesy and generosity. Jim Lynch Marine Art Studios, LLC Maui and Palm Beach

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing vacation of my life. Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: PeggyAnne08
Reviews.Content: Like many of you on here, I spent about weeks reading the different reviews of every hotel on Maui trying to find the perfect place to stay. I was so overwhelmed by the different hotels and variations that I finally just settled for the hotel that had the most consistent reviews within my price range. I can't even begin to explain how lucky that was. 1. The Room: We had booked a "partial ocean view" room. The hotel is situated in 4 room villas, the top 2 rooms had the ocean view where the bottom 2 had a view of the gardens (more on that later). The view we had from the lenai was incredible. Because the hotel sits up on the volcano a bit, we were able to see almost the entire coast of the island. The beautiful ocean was bookended by two mountains. I can't imagine what the view would be like from an ocean view room. What a beautiful way to wake up. The room itself was pretty sizable for just the two of us. We had a small kitchenette, a table, sitting area with the door to the lenai in the one room. And then it opened up to a master bedroom, an open shower/tub area and a bathroom. The room was very clean. A lot of the reviews of this place talked about the furniture being outdated. The couch could benefit from some reupholstering.. but then again, so could mine at home. 2. The grounds were amazing. Everytime I walked around the place I caught myself admiring the meticulously cared for gardens and scenic design. The lobby area was the perfect spot for the continental breakfast that was served fresh daily. The pool and spa were also impeccable. 3. The staff was friendly and helpful. Everyone seemed to genuinely enjoy working for this hotel and helping us out when needed. Hotel Wailea only has 72 rooms and provides a very intimate atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this for couples who are looking for a quite/relaxing trip. There were very few families - so no kids. We found this a huge plus. A lot of the time it almost seemed as we were the only couple there.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tova01
Reviews.Content: My children and I had a wonderful time at this hotel. The service was awesome!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Quiet Resort, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_027
Reviews.Content: I jusr returned from a 10 day stay a tthe Hotel Wailea with my partner and 14 month old son. We loved it there. The grounds are absolutely beautiful, the pool area is stylish and comfortable and the spa has a huge stone soaking pool that is as large as a small swimming pool and slightly cooler than a standard hot tub. It is open to the outside on one side with a great view of the sun setting into the ocean. (They really should market this point - it's gorgeous.) Our little boy actually enjoyed the tub a great deal. There was also a 'baby pool' by the main pool that he enjoyed dabbling in. People have mentioned it is not suitable for children, but I saw at least half a dozen other families with children while I was there. The room was large, clean and comfortable. Very private and quiet. The kitchenette was a bit sparse but functional, the huge bath tub was very relaxing and the bed and bed linens were actually quite excellent. The maids washed our soiled dishes for us every day. We booked the garden view and got a free upgrade to a partial ocean view and were very happy with it. The lanai overlooked one of the koi ponds and our baby enjoyed feeding the birds that hung out near the pond. Negatives - There was a coffee stain on the carpet and the lighting in the bathroom and at the spa were dim and a bit outdated. There was a temperature control knob missing off one of the hotplate burners. The breakfast was basic but fresh - bagels and baked good, coffee and juice. We recieved good service from the staff whenever we dealth with them. We dined at Capiche, the restaurent, for dinner one evening. Fine italian dining with an incredible sunset view. The beef carpaccio and the truffle risotto were delectable. I picked up a cheap cooking pot locally and we cooked in for at least one meal a day. Apparently pots are available from the hotel for a modest rental fee.The resort should really should consider providing a pot free with the dishes in the kitchenette. It's an annoying point that everyone picks up on that surely wouldn't be a huge expense for them to accomodate. The major drawback to this resort, is that it is not on the beach and it is a bit on the quirky side with it's somewhat austere japanese styling. (The baths are now co-ed and non-nude, by the way.) However I took that into account when I booked it for the excellent price in comparison to the big resorts down the hill and, after touring one of those major resorts (en route to a luau) and seeing how cramped and loud everything was, I was happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Enjoyed the Drive up the Hill, Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Alisonlm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights and enjoyed our stay. Be sure to check out the spa as it's very unique with interesting water features and warm/hot pools. The breakfast suited our needs, and the scones and oat cakes were hearty. The coffee is fabulous here and elsewhere on the island. The fruit is limited in options and quantity (so don't expect to gorge) but we were served only tangerines (terrific) and apples. I brought a sharp knife from home to cut the apple with, as well as to cut up other fruit we picked up from roadside stands that included pineapple (fabulous!), mango and papaya with lime. The hotel provides shampoo, conditioner and soap from Aveda. Towels were plentiful in the rooms, by the pool, and at the beach. The beach chair, umbrella, and towels were a huge benefit! They were comfortable and we loved having this amenity. We found it confusing at first. You need to follow the paved path from the Wailea Beach public entrance to the Grand Wailea. Continue down the path until about 1/2 past the pools and you'll see 2 stands for water activities. They can help you there. You can have the hotel take you and pick you up at the Wailea Beach public access - just remember to bring a phone and their number to call them. We used the Hotel to start, but then found it a bit more convenient for us to drive. We loved driving on the island in our Jeep, so driving up and down the hill to the hotel was fun for us. We also kept our snorkeling gear in the car and found a good snorkling spot to the south of Wailea Beach. The hotel is very quiet. We never heard or saw our neighbors in the 4 unit building. The beach however was littered with kids on Spring Break. We drove down past Kihei 1 day to enjoy time on a quiet beach. You will also find quieter beaches south near the Fairmont. This would not be a place for kids, babies ok, but not kids or teenagers. There were also a lot of stairs and it was quite a walk to the car, even though they do offer valet if you wanted that. I would not recommend the hotel for people who don't get around well. We did not cook anything (no microwave in the room), but found very reasonably priced and convenient places to eat. We'd recommend WokStar, Cafe Kiehi for breakfast, and Pupu Lounge Seafood & Grill - go before 6pm for happy hour drink specials ($2 large Mai Tais and dollar off beers) and get the fish and chips - ask for the organic side salad and get the fish grilled. The tempura fish was good as well, but the grilled was more flavorful and healthier. There is a small refrigerator where we stored drinks. It didn't feel cold enough to store milk in. The ice machine is up by the pool. We got plenty of beach time and so not staying on the beach was not a problem. We did a lot of driving to other towns, hiking spots, including a 12 hour trip to and from Hana. We went to Lahaina for the Old Lahaina Luau which I would highly recommend. Where else would I like to stay? Maybe next time at the Fairmont or Four Seasons if we could afford that, a condo in Kehei would also suit us nicely. I'm not familiar with the other parts of the island to make any determination. Have fun and enjoy Hotel Wailea if you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Time to Relax”
Reviews.Author: WAILEALOVERS
