Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Wailea for 8 nights and we did NOT want to leave! From the time when we arrived until the time we left we were treated wonderfully. We loved the beautiful grounds, the shuttle to the beach, the beach chairs, the beach itself, the view from our lani, the yummy banana bread at the morning breakfast, and the bed was very, very big and comfortable...never been so rested. Oh, and the cabanas around the pool were the perfect place to take an afternoon nap. The spa was kinda weird but definetly not to hot, which others have mentioned. We would definetly come back and stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE FOR CALM AND RELAXATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: Micmac85
Reviews.Content: I shall start with mentioning this is NOT a hotel for families with young children. This hotel is the place to stay for a serene and pleasant holiday in the sun, with a view to exploring the island of Maui, in my opinion. The good bits; We arrived late one evening, check in was great, quick and friendly. Rooms are large and spacious. Yes, they aren't all modern and refurbished but the current owners only took over a year ago. The gardens are immaculate and there are amazing ocean and sunset views from the lobby/restaurant and spa. Staff-extremely helpful, the shuttle guys are great. Always picked us up within 5minutes and even came out at midnight to fetch us from the shops! The spa and pool area are heaven after a long day driving/walking. You can buy a $1 bag of fish food from reception to feed the lovely koi carp. Improvements: They could do with a hotel brochure in the room. There is no information about opening times etc so we had to ask all the time. The restaurant, although nice enough food was way overpriced and closed at 8:45! There is nowhere to buy snacks or a shop on site. There a $1 soft drinks in a barrel by the pool until 4pm daily. We, a young British couple, thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would definately return. Yes, we aren't right on the beach front, but i dont think it is worth the extra money when you can have a free shuttle ride down there anyway. We left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated and hold only fond memories of our stay here. Heaven at a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, relaxing hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: travelingDrM
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Maui, I picket this hotel based on the reviews. I attended a conference at the Grand Wailea but decided to save some money and get an ocean view room at Hotel Wailea for less than the garden view room at Grand Wailea and I am SO GLAD I did!!! The grounds were beautiful, the staff was extremely gracious, helpful, and friendly. My room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. I agree that I wouldn't consider them having a 'kitchen'-there was no microwave, and I had little use for the 'hot plate' like burners that were in the rooms. There were no utensils, pots, pans, etc to make use of anyway. However, the restaurants on the island were so good, I don't know why you would want to cook anyway (I would have liked a microwave to warm up my leftovers, though). The breakfast consisted of only pastries, no protein but I luckily packed protein bars after reading the previous reviews. The gym was closed and the 'business center' consisted of only one computer (and they were thinking of charging for its use in the future). The spectacular views from my lanai, the gorgeous grounds, and the ultra relaxing, quiet environment was really all I wanted and well worth the price I paid (including getting 2 nights free for paying for 8). I visited several resorts while in Maui and was so pleased that I chose Hotel Wailea instead of a busy, crowded, tacky beach 'resort' that was full of loud tourists. I will only pick the Hotel Wailea for my future stays and can't wait to take my boyfriend on my next trip to Maui--the boutique resort is perfect for couples-extremely relaxing and romantic. I recommend a rental car (and you'll need one anyway for the drive from the airport). A short drive down the hill (or the shuttle service the hotel provides) make for easy access to other restaurants, golf, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Maui”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller234
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at the Hotel Wailea in Maui and had a great experience. The rooms could use a bit of TLC (there was a small rip in the couch), but we didn't care because we didn't spend much time in our room. They were clean and comfortable (the bed was incredibly comfortable!) and had everything we needed. We had no stains on our carpets and never encountered a cockroach. We got an oceanview room which had a wonderful lanai and we were able to watch whales spouting and breaching right from our room. The washroom was large and comfortable, with a huge shower/bathtub area and a separate toilet. Breakfast is included and is basically what others have written: bagels, muffins, scones, banana bread, a bit of fruit, tea, coffee and delicious passion-orange-guava juice. Personally, we are cereal people, so we just bought a box and some milk at the local supermarket (go to Foodland in Kihei and get a savings card) and supplemented it with some of the pastries, tea, coffee and juice provided by the hotel. We grabbed the tray that is in the kitchen under the coffee maker and brought it up to the lobby everyday to get our breakfast and then ate on our lanai overlooking the ocean. You really can't get much better than that! As for the location, we thought it was perfect. It is not on the beach, but whenever we wanted to go to the beach, one of the staff was there promptly to take us (in a Cadillac Escalade, none the less), and picked us up right when we asked. You can get beach chairs and umbrellas from the Grand Wailea, which we never had a problem with. And after going up to the north and seeing the hotels at Kaanapali and Kapalua, we still felt that Wailea was the best place to stay. We would agree with some of the other people who have posted reviews that it would be nice to have a casual snack/lunch place to grab food at. But we were rarely around the hotel for lunch since there is so much to see on Maui, that it didn't really effect us. And there are tons of options in Kihei or at the beachfront hotels in Wailea to choose from. The hotel was pretty quiet, which we loved, but if you are looking for action, this is probably not the place for you. There is no bar/nightclub, and we found guests pretty much kept to themselves. We booked well in advance to take advantage of the 60 day discount offered on their website. Long story short, if we returned to Maui, we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip to Maui Yet!!!”
Reviews.Author: MN_Traveler010
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just got back from our trip to Maui and stayed 8 nights at the Hotel Wailea. We arrived Late at night and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful to two weary travelers. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever stayed in. The room was a bit dated but felt clean. The view from the rooms cannot be beat. I think the hotel has been reading some of the previous posts becasue while we were there they made a few changes. They added oranges and apples to the breakfast, they made the Japanee spa co-ed and they added beverages at the pool. They had a huge bucket with cold beverages in it and you can pay there or add it to your room bill. My Husband and I enjoyed the trip so much we are starting to look into making our reservations for next year. We did talk to one couple that had a dirty room when they arrived. But they talked to the staff and they moved them to the only other available room and they said that was much better. We highly recommend this hotel to people who love Wailea but do not want to stay in huge hotels and do not want to pay an arm and a leg to get to see the ocean from their room.

Reviews.Title: “Taking a step back in time-in a really bad way”
Reviews.Author: babosa79
Reviews.Content: Let me begin this trip in time by stating we thought the lobby and grounds were beautiful. We were really excited as we walked to our room, taking in the wonderful view and thinking our room must be really great from the look of things. The beauty ended there, as we went down into the dark, dank abyss of our room. Upon entering, a musty stench slapped us in the face so hard I thought I was in Rocky 3. We literally felt like we stepped onto the set of The Golden Girls, and I expected Bea Arthur to pop out of the lanai wearing a hawaiian shirt and sipping a glass of Ovaltine. The carpeting was stained-not just a couple of stains here and there-but huge brown stains that resembled a blowout from a baby's diaper. The couch was at least 30 years old, with yellow spots. They tried to make it look better with some new throw pillows, but as the saying goes, "you can't polish a turd." I looked in horror at the bed and noticed a dark spot that was MOVING under the duvet cover. Yes, it was a cockroach, and that does not include the one my husband stepped on in the kitchen while he was barefoot. Oh yeah, kitchen it is not. There was one plate and two scary burners with white residue on them. Yes, I love to cook and was planning on making meals, but no, I do not want to get swine flu or warts from this process. Next let's talk about the "spa." The water looked so inviting until we both stepped in and it literally scalded our feet and legs, hence our nickname for the remainder of our trip "red pants." The only good feature was a water pipe that slammed water onto our backs like a weird massage. When we asked about the burning water, which several other guests also complained about, they told us it was "standard temperature." I guess "standard" means fire of hell in Maui. But doesn't the room come with breakfast, you ask? Oh yes, it comes with bagels, muffins, pastries, and more carbs. No choices other than that. The lobby and grounds and the restaurant are wonderful, but we will not stay here again unless they want to bring the rooms into this century.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Bargain - But think of It as a Condo, not a Resort”
Reviews.Author: NorCal8
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of HW - overall wonderful experience, and for the price we paid, an amazing bargain. I'm a little dubious of some of these reviews though, reading them now after we just checked out - some seem a little too good and off the mark. Here's our experience: Pros: - The location is spectactular. Too much of a premium is placed (in my opinion) on being *on* the beach. In most beach hotels, your room is far from - and it's a decent walk to a beach you want to be at. Being up on the hill, as HW is, you get an AMAZING view - you could enforce Federal laws on boats getting too close to whales from up there - a view I never had from the Kea Lani or Grand Wailea. The best beaches in South Maui you have to drive to regardless - Big beach, little beach, etc. Wailea beach is pretty weak, and Polo beach isn't exactly walking distance from anywhere other than the Kea Lani. The HW also offers a great shuttle service - never waited more than 10 mins for rides to any of the Wailea resorts or the mall. - Our room was great. It seems they have upgraded and non-upgraded rooms from aksing around - ours was upgraded, and it was perfect. Great balcony, two flat screens, little mini-kitchen, new carpets, nice bed, free internet. - The grounds were specactular - very well maintained. The Cons - This used to be the Diamond Walilea resort, a Japanese hotel aimed at Japanese visitors. In and of itself, no problems, but the spa is a traditional Japanese one - not the kind you might be used to. Much of the staff is native Japanese-speaking as well - requring some patience. Overall, no problems though. - The Pool is ice cold. Seriously - like they have to cool it to keep it that cold. The guy at teh front desk told us it was "semi-heated" - not sure what that means but I think I saw a polar bear swimming around in there. We love hanging around by the pool, but realized this trip that hanging around sucks if you can't get in the actual pool. - There is no real bar - they have a temporary set up on Fridays and Saturdays in the lobby, but it misses the mark and has no food. You also can't get a drink by the pool. (The pool attenednt, also the activities coordinator, told us that drinks would be availiable by the pool "later" - not sure when that meant...) - The restaurant Capiche?, has some great reviews, but we were never in the mood for Italian. Too bad that's the only restaurant - no pool fare, no lobby stuff - just that one restaurant. All in all, I'd reccomend this to a friend wanting to get a great bargain, who was OK sacrificing some of the hotel experience. It really is better compared to a condo than a hotel - with that mentality, you'll walk away very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “much to love, but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: NanaAGEOhio
Reviews.Content: The lovely grounds, responsive, friendly service, spacious guest rooms and relaxing atmosphere made this beautiful boutique hotel a great place to spend 8 glorious days in Maui this month. With the "4th night free" the price was right. Had we been paying more, however, I would have been less tolerant of the meager/boring continental breakfasts, unheated swimming pool, non-existent fitness center, very small refrigerator and unavailable cooking implements and well-worn beach chairs/umbrellas (that could not be used past 3:00 PM.) Nonetheless, the Hotel Wailea is in a wonderful location, and proved to be an easy drive to the attractions that interested us, and a respite from some of the hubub.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel surpassed all of our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Grammayamma
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Hoel Wailea. We were a bit hesitant in making our decision to stay there because it is not located right on the beach. But, as it turned out, we were actually glad we didn't stay right on the beach. This hotel was immaculate and beautifully landscaped and quiet! The views were spectacular from our ocean view balcony. We were even able to watch the whales every morning spout and breach. The pool area was extremely comfortable and private and did I mention...quiet? Our room was furnished in a very tasteful, island theme and the bed was heavenly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More than a Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: drmoleVirginia
Reviews.Content: We spent nine days at the end January and couldn't have enjoyed our selves more. The room was oversized and had all the comforts of home. We did not cook as we were on vacation. However, the kitchenette, dining, living area was well used by us. We had coffee every morning and ate the continental breakfast a few times. The staff was great, the pool area was great, the hotels grounds were beautiful, and the hotel location provided us with a stress free environment. Close enough to the beach and Wailea attractions without being in the thick of things. We would go back tomorrow. Susan, in fact, asked for a job at check out. We brought home 2 of the Hotel Wailea robes so that we can pretend that we are still there. Great value, great service, We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Just don't expect the fitness centre to be open”
Reviews.Author: islandcabin
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Maui in mid January and spent 3 nights at the Hotel Wailea in part due to the great ratings it got from others on Tripadvisor. The staff at the hotel are excellent and very friendly and the reception area, koi ponds, and grounds are wonderful. The rooms are a bit "tired" but are good value compared to other hotels in Wailea. If you are planning on being there and want to cook in the room, don't expect much from the kitchen, and the pots and pans they provide (only if you ask for them) are poor. One small pot with no lid made cooking pasta and other dishes an adventure. We were disappointed to find the fitness centre closed, and after searching tripadvisor a bit more we realize that it has been closed for at least a couple of months now. It does not appear that they are working on it or have any plans to open it again. We mentioned this to the manager, and a polite smile and shrug of the shoulders is all the response we got. Over all, good value for Wailea, but just don't go in expecting too much from the rooms, kitchen or fitness centre. Pool is also very cold, so kids will shy away from all but the quickest of dips. Pull out couch has definitely seen better days, and only has the thinnest of blankets.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: echo_cabarnet
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We found the Hotel Wailea after a bit of a rocky start to our Christmas vacation in Maui. It is absolutely lovely. It looks exactly like the pictures on the web. The view from our room was breathtaking. The view was of the ocean and gorgeous landscaping. The staff there were always courteous and helpful. Though the hotel is at the top of the hill, the shuttle driver was always available to take you anywhere you wanted to go. I love it there and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: bittyNanaimo
Reviews.Content: Initially I was disappointed that we weren't on the beach, but after a couple a trips to the beach I recognized how crowded and loud the other resorts were. We definately appreciated how quiet our resort was . From our balcony each night we witnessed an amamzing sunset and saw numerous humpback whales breach the water. What a gift! The resort seemed empty for how quiet it was at the pool each day. We were shocked to hear the resort was at 100% occupency. The ground were well kept and serene and koi were fat and colourful. The staff was helpful and pleaseant and always said always greeted us with us with a smile. We would return to Hotel Wailea on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: Floridafans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week over New Year and had a great time. The hotel is about 3 minutes' drive from the beach/shops but the resort fee ($20 per day) covers free transportation by shuttle as many times as you need â€“ all the drivers were friendly and helpful. The hotel has a lovely, relaxed and sophisticated atmosphere with landscaped gardens/waterfalls. The staff were friendly and helpful and our ocean view suite was perfect â€“ we could actually see whales breaching in the ocean from our balcony. We watched the sun set every night from our balcony too which was so romantic. Pros â€“ Beautiful hotel, our room was huge, luxurious and absolutely immaculate Location on the hill means youâ€™re away from the hustle/bustle in Wailea but close to all activities Laid-back atmosphere Beautiful pool area Fabulous view over the ocean Balcony restaurant with fab views over the ocean and amazing food Cons â€“ We canâ€™t think of any! Our only niggle was the New Yearâ€™s Eve dinner â€“ we had booked in advance but were only told at the last minute that it was a 7-course banquet at $150 each (plus there was a no-cancellation policy within 48 hours so we would have been charged if weâ€™d cancelled). There were a couple of seafood things on the menu that my husband couldnâ€™t eat but the chef was very helpful and changed the menu for us and we thoroughly enjoyed it - the food was beautifully presented and tasted wonderful. We then watched the fireworks display in Wailea at midnight from our balcony â€“ what an amazing way to welcome in the New Year. We loved this hotel and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views & not over corwded!”
Reviews.Author: Kate013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Wailea for 2 nights and we were upgraded to a luxury Suite, the suite was very nicely furnished and the size of the suite was massive, which would be ideal for families. The hotel sits on the hill behind the main area of Wailea - about a 5 minute drive down to the beach. The hotel has a resort fee of approx $20.00 per day. Most resorts will only give you free phone calls and a newspaper for this, however the Hotel Wailea gives you internet access, continental breakfast and a free shuttle to and from the beach or shops in Wailea and then back to the hotel, which was so handy and all of the guys that drove us down and back a million times were so friendly and were always up for a chat! Wailea itself is pretty expensive so be prepared to pay more than you would in Waikiki or in Lahaina. Everyone raved about the beach here being so nice although i thought it was over crowded but it was still not bad. Overall Hotel Wailea would be my choie if returning to Wailea as it's a very spread out resort with only 4 rooms in each block, we almost felt that we were one of only a few guests at the hotel, however when we ask if the hotel was empty they told us it was running at about 65% capacity!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJack2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Wailea for 2 weeks prior to Christmas. We were very pleased with all the staff at the hotel, very attentive, and always remembered our names. We booked an ocean view-deluxe room and were at first very pleased with the room. After being there the first day we noticed the carpets were very soiled and the counter tops needed to be replaced. Overall, the room was very nice and quiet. The rooms come with a "kitchen" but really the come with a small (hotel sized) refregerator and a cook top, but nothing to cook with or put food on. You have to ask and pay extra for cookware (which is old and needs to be replaced.) We did ask for a microwave after the first week and were not charged extra for that, but it was not in the room to begin wth. The beds are very comfortable with several choices of pillows. The shower and bath are very nice and spacious also. You can see the Japanese influence in the bath area with the deep spa tub and the bidet toilets. "Breakfast" consists of bagels, scones and coffee and tea. If you want something more, you will have to travel to a restaurant or shop at the local Safeway (and check out the kitchen supplies) from the front desk. The shuttle to the beach was a nice feature, but they only have one cart and it needed recharging after a few trips, so they then used a very old and worn van that was held together with duct tape....another cart would be very helpful here. The spa was very nice, but we really didn't use it much. They have a large spa with a small waterfall, a steam room and a nice dressing room with all the needed necessaties. Overall, I would stay here again and hope that the management would have updated the carpets and included some of the needed accessories in the room without an extra fee. We did eat at the restaurant "Capische?" where we were given a 20% discount from the hotel. Well, the food was fine, but not exceptional, and the service had much to be desired...we were left sitting for long periods of time and one of our salads didn't come at all until we asked about it. Also, we are charged an 18% gratuitity on the bill, so 20% really isn't a discount at all. We probably wouldn't have given them that large a tip on poor service. You are charged a "Resort fee" for using the fitness center and internet....well, the fitness center was closed for renovations so, it was $25 to use the internet and the spa PER DAY!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ebaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Wailea Christmas 2009 for 8 nights. We found this hotel on this site and would like to thank tripadvisor just for its existence. When we first arrived and were looking for the hotel we became concerned since no one we asked knew about this hotel. When we found it we were in a pleasant surprise. Wailea is a beautiful area of Maui. This hotel reflects all the positive sides of Wailea: beauty, peace and perfection. We stayed in a room with an ocean view which was wonderful. We got to see the sunset every evening right from our room. The hotel is close enough to the beach yet not right on the beach where all the crowds are. The hotel offers shuttle services to the beach at Grand Wailea where you can get a place to sit and towels. As a guest you are allowed to charge to your hotel account for expenses at the Grand Wailea but are not allowed to make use of the pool. If you prefer, as we did, you can drive on your own as parking is available. If you want crowds, things happening at the hotel non-stop then you should stay at one of the resorts. If you want peace and tranquility with a choice of resort life then this is the place. To sum it up here is a list of pros and cons: Pros: -Quiet, peaceful yet very family oriented. We have two boys under 10 and did not feel uncomfortable for the noise they make often. -Helpful and friendly staff that answers to every need. -Great Italian restaurant at he hotel. -Ocean view rooms excellent -Comfortable rooms to accommodate a family of 4 - bedroom, living room with pull out couch and a small kitchenette. -nice sauna, hot tubs -nice pool lounge area (we didn't use) -laundry room available Cons: - bathroom, toilet are needs a makeover. Paint chipped. -sports center closed due to renovation. Which was not cool since we were there during high season. To be honest we wouldn't have used it since the outdoors is so beautiful. We can't think of any other cons. The only improvement would be to have small beach chairs in the room so that the guests can take them (like umbrellas) to nearby beaches. We will definitely go back and we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: vagabondsChicago
Reviews.Content: wonderful place to stay. Everyone was welcoming and helpful. Utilized the shuttle service often even though we had a car.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place! Wow!”
Reviews.Author: travel_incognito1
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the Hotel Wailea! It's such a great place. Quiet and cozy - a great place to escape. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are great. The huge showers are fabulous! We were upgraded to a partial ocean view upon arrival and had a fantastic view of the sunset each night from our balcony. Continental breakfast in the mornings was simple - coffee, juice, bagels, scones, banana bread - highly recommend the banana bread! - but certainly served our needs. Great view from the lobby while having breakfast. The grounds are so quiet, even though there were some other families there with kids, you felt like you were all alone. The beach is very close by and they have shuttles to take you there, plus you can get beach towels, umbrellas, etc. if you go down to Wailea Beach, all courtesy of the hotel. The rooms had high speed wireless which was great to be able to use while sitting out on the balcony in the mornings or evenings. Another great feature was that there was always parking available and the daily resort fee ($20/day) wasn't outrageous like we found it to be in Oahu later on our trip. Plus, you get so much included for that $20 -parking, breakfast, high speed internet, beach transportation/amenities, etc. We didn't use the pool (went to the beach instead) but it looked like a very nice pool. We didn't use the spa or eat in their restaurant either so can't comment on that. This was our first trip to Hawaii but we would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing getaway boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Reum
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent two nights in a one room suite here and had an amazing time. The room amenities were fantastic; wireless internet, flat screen tv in the bedroom and living room, fridge, two-burner stove and a bed so comfortable we bought one when we returned home. Cleanliness is not an issue at all. It is an amazing boutique hotel with beautiful views from the room, the pool and throughout the grounds. The service was extremely friendly and helpful and the shuttle service was easy to use. The pool area is very nice, with chairs, lounges, and canopy beds surrounding it. The only thing missing from the pool, and possibly the hotel, is a bar near the pool, or even in the resort, at which to obtain cocktails while you're poolside. We were informed that the hotel was in the process of adding a bar because they were under new management...I can only hope, for the sake of future guests, that they update that amenity. We will definitely stay here again and we will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Maui/Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “away from the madding crowd, hawaiian elegance, top notch service and charm as well”
Reviews.Author: smailemaile
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for fast food and a loud party, this ain't it. This is the slow food version of Hawaiian hospitality. Elegantly and thoughtfully laid out, this place and its employees made us feel like a million bucks, (which we aren't.) From Kimi, the graceful maid service, to the manager who welcomed us at a lovely evening reception, this place made us relax and thrive during our brief vacation. Spacious rooms that have been very recently updated while preserving the high-quality wooden features that may date to the 50s (?) we were impressed with the quality and intelligent use of space. High-ceilinged rooms with ample windows placed so no one could see in but we could see out, made us want to renew our vows to have an excuse to stay. Very romantic yet perfect for kids (our kids were welcomed to pick fruit from the banana, mango, avocado, papaya and citrus trees among the landscaping) there was also room to explore a cascading creek with waterfalls, look for fish in the ponds...and also room to toss a frisbee or kick a soccer ball on the lawn. It is high above the beach, which meant no loud tacky luau and firedancing noise into the night. A hike up to the room for exercise or a free shuttle, your choice. Obviously, I am missing it already, although I just came home today.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingfamily696
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to relax and enjoy time together with loved one (s) this is it! The bed is big and comfy and the view is to die for! Everyone at the hotel is so nice and friendly, they really make you feel welcome and at home. My daughter enjoyed the heated pool and we enjoyed the spa with the Japanese touch. You kind find this any where in Hawaii. The spa was a great way to end the day! Definitely, would go back here! The only draw back, is not bar or store on property, when you want to just get something to drink

Reviews.Title: “Serene and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: RoxanneDarling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is up on the hill with amazing views - which creates a truly serene and relaxing stay. The beach is a short hope away via the free courtesy aqua jeep, and the staff here are all amazing - from desk staff (Aika is charmed!) to housekeepers and the managers Marcus and Kyoko so courteous and helpful. There are many delights to this place - chief is that the 72 suites are spread out across about 15 acres of gorgeous landscaping and a stream with waterfalls running through it. If you want to be close to the action but nestled in a quiet beautiful place, with amazing architecture and a Japanese bath like few others in the USA, then choose Hotel Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Peace & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: bennyscuba
Reviews.Content: As other have mentioned this is really a quiet getaway place. If you like being anonymous you will love it here - if not, you probably won't... We had a long weekend in Maui and we really used this place as a base to do some diving, and get away from crowds. We didn't want to stay at a big resort and in that sense it was perfect. This isn't really the place where you can spend the day as there is no daytime food options and no bar near the pool (a big bummer). The pool though is nicely set up with private lounge beds. Plus the Japanese Spa is a nice change. The rooms are large and the bed very comfortable. While the datedness doesn't bother us, our screen door was falling off it's hinge, and at one point our shower nozzle broke (but was quickly replaced). This is what kept it from receiving 5 stars. As others have mentioned the staff is wonderful. We never actually found the section on the beach with chairs, but since it was low season it didn't matter - we just crashed the 4 seasons and grand wailea! Hotels.com had a great deal for $160/night. At that price, this place is a steal (considering the locale), however I may reconsider if I had to pay rack rates - not having a bar was really a big bummer!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wailea was a completely unexpected experience, a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kip2me
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, we were wowed by this hotel. A friend had recommended we check it out and so we finally did. Wailea is special place in and of itself however this hotel made it all the more enjoyable. The massive ceiling in the main lobby area, the waterfalls, koi fish and beautiful grounds made for a relaxing retreat. The friendly attentive staff who treated us as guests from hello to farewell, I just can't say enough about this lovely hotel. We had an ocean view room with sunsets that will be forever with us. The room was clean and home-like. The bed was amazingly comfortable with plenty of pillows. There was a living room, kitchen, dining area, lanai, walk in shower, tub for soaking, free internet and 2 flat screen televisions. We felt like we could live there forever. Oh and let's not forget the personal hygiene cleaning apparatus attached to the toilet...that was a first for us. The most unexpected treat was the spa area, authentic Japanese style with separate facilities for men and women so you can totally relax. There is a huge jacuzzi, soaking tub, dry sauna, and pressure body shower, taking hydro-therapy to whole new level. The best part...complimentary. The pool area - well decorated with private cabanas and high-end loungers. This is definitely a boutique hotel that is catering to the whole experience. And if that wasn't enough, "capische?", the hotels restaurant that we had heard so much about was all that and more. This meal made for an evening that won't be soon forgotten. We highly recommend this hotel...you'll certainly enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “As close to heaven as I have been.”
Reviews.Author: RobinCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in the hotel. I had read the reviews and wasn't sure if the room was going to be particulary nice ( I read a few comments about it needing updating), but was very pleasantly surprised. Maybe there were other rooms that have not been updated, but my room was gorgeous. My lanai was perched over the koi pond and the landscape was beautiful. The suite was spacious and furnished nicely. The bed was SO comfortable, and I am very picky about my beds. There were 2 flat screened tv's, one in the living area and one in the bedroom. The bathroom was wonderful. It had a very large tub and a large open shower. The shampoo products were Aveeno (love it). The kitchenette was a little small but I only used the sink. You need to ask for cooking pans and utensils if you plan to cook. There was a small refrigerator but no microwave. The grounds really were beautiful. You need to make sure to walk around the pathways after checking in. I didn't discover just how amazing they were until the day before I left. There was a stream with benches and walks along the side. And a little foot bridge that crossed the stream. I also noticed a banana tree with banana's on it. The front desk had a bowl of star fruit that they said were picked from a tree on the grounds. It is a quiet and private location but if you want activity the personnel are extrememly attentive and will give you a ride where ever you want to go in Wilea. I called for a ride to go to the Wilea shops and was picked up at my door in an electric cart and then taken up to the hotel van for the ride to the shopping center. When I called for pick up I was surprised at how fast they showed up. The hotel also has access to the beach in front of the Grand Wilea, where you can use their towels and chairs. They also give you a card so you can charge drinks, food, etc. to your hotel room. I didn't try it but bet it would be wonderful. I can't say enough nice things about the employees. I was treated well by every staff member I dealt with. And was greeted by name by many of the them. I was especially fond of the valets, who were particularly warm and friendly. In addition I would highly recommend eating at The Wok Star. It was a little hole in the wall place across the street from the beach in Kihea and was delicious. I also ate at Ruth Chris Steak House in Wilea but thought it was overpriced and just so-so. I had a fabulous lunch at the Five Palms in Wilea and sat on the outside terrace. The food was amazing and the view was even more amazing (good cocktails too).

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: char3901
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful but the hotel is in need of a major overhaul..Everything is old and dirty..The spa is flithy my husband came home with a rash..And the air conditioner never worked properly.. over priced ...

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Beauty”
Reviews.Author: McJam
Reviews.Content: I visited the Hotel Wailea for the second leg of my stay in Maui and found it to be top notch. The rooms are divided into quadplex units (2 upper and 2 lower), and were quite spacious--with a mini kitchenette. The hotel provided a complimentary continental breakfast which made up for the absence of a cafe. There is an excellent Italian restaurant on site, but no other eats to be had. The hotel is located right next to the Wailea Golf Courses and has a shuttle to its beach area located adjacent to the Grand Wailea Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wailea was a wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: cutler39
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Wailea for 4 days on my honeymoon through the islands. The rooms were a little dated but the bed was comfortable and the views were awesome (good sunset from our room). The service was great and friendly, we were a little concerned that we saw maybe 5-10 guests there the whole time but after talking with a bell hop we were informed of the recent ownership and name change. I sure hope it stays a secret and the rates continue to be low. You are within minutes of excellent dining, free access to the beach and equimpent. If you are caught up in the newness of a hotel room this isnt the place but our room was clean and rather large and had great views. Besides it is Maui what are you doing in a hotel room besides sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “We were able to see "Paradise" from our balcony at the Hotel Wailea”
Reviews.Author: 17meemaws
Reviews.Content: Our son Tom's wedding site recommended the Hotel Wailea for our stay while we there for he and Jennifer's August 30th wedding. From that moment on we were treated with such respect and kindness that we would definately go back to the Hotel Wailea. The young men who took care of our luggage greeted us as if they had known us forever and when we checked in...the same thing happened. The room was beyond our expectations, it was beautiful and the view was spectacular. Anything we asked for was at our door swiftly and with a smile. My husband and I used the Spa's for the men and women and I couldn't keep him out of there....He loved it as well as I did. Nice touch.....We met Henry Perez at the Manager's get-together the night we left. He explained many of the questions that I had about the different Islands surrounding the Hotel.......since I had the pictures....I thought I might need the names. He was so gracious and so professional....I thouroghly enjoyed talking with Mr Perez. Can't say enough about our stay at your beautiful Hotel and hope to see you some day soon to spend yet another vacation in Paradise. Thank you so much to ALL of you!!! Terry & Karen Shannon (karen1543@wowway.com)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wailea”
Reviews.Author: LisaA77
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Hotel Wailea through travelzoo. Very nice grounds, partial ocean view, extremely courteous staff. The rooms remind me of an apartment. Although very clean, the rooms were very outdated. It depends what you are looking for. Probably would not stay there again, but if looking for a real reasonable clean hotel, would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed By Hotel Wailea!”
Reviews.Author: duke86
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and our 2 teenage daughters had a terrific experience! Our suite was large (bedroom, living & dining areas), well apointed and had a phenonenal ocean view including breathtaking sunsets. The well managed staff was extremely friendly and accomodating without exception and willing to do whatever they could to make our stay memorable. The grounds are beautiful with water features, Koi ponds and plenty of grennery, all very condusive to relaxation. My oldest daughter claims she wants to get married in a gazebo they have on a lawn with ocean views which tells you how much she liked the grounds..... my wife and I just hope that usage is many years from now however. My younger daughter was thrilled to learn that earlier in the summer, several episodes of "America's Next Top Model" were filmed at the resort. We made use of the shuttle to close by beaches where guests enjoy use and signing privledges at the Grand Wailea (without having to pay Grand Wailea prices). As a golfer, it was great to be right next door to Wailea Golf Club, home of the famous Old Blue, Emerald and Gold courses that presented both a challenge and breathtaking views. In summary, we had a terrific time and can not imagine a better value in beautiful Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: pdiaz1
Reviews.Content: The stay at Hotel Wailea was pleasureable. It was close to the beach and many shops in Wailea and we were shuttled around as needed. The staff was very friendly and would recommend this place to anyone. The room we had was a little bit older, but they were in the process of renovating a lot of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Elessodan
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for your trip to Maui. While it is not on the beach and is a difficult walk (up a steep hill) to get back from the beach (it's a short, very easy drive), the serene and well manicured area around the hotel makes up for it. Indeed, most of the rooms are going to have some view of the ocean (ours was designated garden view and was on the first floor but had a very nice view of the ocean). The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, despite needing an update. I will tell you however, that our friends stayed in the Fairmont, and the rooms at the Wailea are just as nice, even more spacious, at a fraction of the price. Also, we enjoyed eating at Capische?, an Italian restaurant at the hotel. This restaurant not only affords incredible sunset views, but has fabulous food and service. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room with some amenities of a condo-great for families”
Reviews.Author: joantri
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in Wailea (don't want to pay $300+ for a room) with a few condo type features, then the Hotel Wailea is for you. We just returned from staying 4 days at the Hotel Wailea. We had to change rooms once due to the bathroom tiles in the first room having chips/peeled paint (looked worse than it was) and our view was the back of a house). The staff was very helpful and changed us to a partial ocean view with a deck over the koi pond which our son loved! Note that there are no King beds now at this hotel and they push the twins together to make a King bed with a connector. We are not tall people, but my husband at 5'11" just fit the length of the bed. The kitchenette came with 2 electric burners, coffee maker and a mini bar fridge (empty). They will bring you plates, a couple of pots/pans and utensils. The room is very clean, but furniture, carpet is dated. The room is very minimal with little decor, but very simply decorated. The grounds are beautiful with water feature/water falls throughout. Also, since the hotel sits above the Wailea "strip" of hotels, it has a great view. The continental breakfast is included (cereal, toast, coffee, tea, milk, apple, banana, oranges, Costco muffins or some type of sweet roll) and was served from 7am-10am. We did not see many people over the course of our stay, but was told the hotel was full. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We did not dine at the restaurant, but were told by many that it is excellent. We also did not use the shuttle service since we had a car and with a child, it was more convenient to park at the Wailea beach. The Wailea beach where the Hotel Wailea offers complimentary chairs (more comfy/nice than the Grande Wailea), umbrellas, towels and ice cold water is located at the beach in front of the Grande Wailea. Also, Hotel Wailea gives a card ,so that you can sign for meals at the Grande Wailea and it will be charged to your room at the Hotel Wailea. You cannot use the Grande Wailea pool. The beach amenities, room amenities, free breakfast and location in Wailea made this hotel the best kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “What a Scene...! Don't miss...!”
Reviews.Author: SlipSampler
Reviews.Content: I went with a couple of mates and the placed simply ROCKED! Sophisticated styling in the large rooms and great food in the new restaurant. This place seems to be a secret spot for celebs (we had a laugh with Eddie Murphy by the pool...). Keep this one on your short list if you;re looking for a hip spot at the right price...Aloha...

Reviews.Title: “Truly Extraordinary Escape”
Reviews.Author: EKWaters
Reviews.Content: After visiting Maui time and time again, we have finally found the perfect hotel! There is nothing ordinary about this gem boutique hotel. Each room is a suite and has a full ocean view (not the bend over the railing type of view). The service is exceptional and the decor is soothing and ultra-tasteful. We were so pleased with the amenities and the little electric shuttle to and from the beach made it a perfect mix of quiet relaxation and beach resort fun. We ate at their fantastic Italian restaurant, Capische, which we later learned won some award recently. We actually saw Tyra Banks there, which was a fun surprise. All in all, we wouldn't stay anywhere else on the island. It has everything one would want for a truly extraordinary escape.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wailea at an affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoLinda
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Hotel Wailea (formerly Diamond Resort) and were very pleased. We had a great time and would stay there again. If you're looking for action and lots going on, this probably isn't your place, but if you want something serene and peaceful and want to stay in wonderful Wailea without paying $500, $600 a night or more, this may be your place. The grounds are lovely and well taken care of, and the sweeping views are fabulous and can't be beat. There are two things you should know. One, the hotel isn't on the beach. Rather, they're a half-mile up the hill, which explains their amazing views. However, they have a speedy shuttle service that whisks you down to their own little section of Wailea Beach, and considering the size of some mega resorts, you may find you're at the beach quicker and with fewer steps than if you were paying a small fortune for that oceanfront location. Plus there are so many special beaches on Maui, and we wanted to visit them all, that we ended up driving to different beaches around the island anyway. Second, the rooms are a little tired. The hotel changed hands and just changed its name as of June 15 (used to be Diamond Resort) and I'm assuming the new owners will be freshening things up. At 900 square feet, they're very spacious, and our room was quite clean. When a few minor things happened (the type of thing that can happen anywhere) housekeeping and/or maintenance was there within five minutes. (These two items are why we rated the hotel as very good, rather than excellent, because we understand for some people they may be a deal breaker. However, as far as getting a great hotel in an excellent location for a reasonable price, we'd rate it as excellent.) The staff is very friendly, with the aloha spirit that makes you feel quite welcome. And with only 72 rooms, you don't get lost in the crowd. You can get bargain rates just north of Wailea in Kihei, and if you want the frenetic strip-mall pace of Kihei, there's lots to choose from. But if you want to stay in dreamy Wailea, without paying a fortune, Hotel Wailea may be just the place for you. My husband says to mention how handy the shuttle service is. They'll take you to and from restaurants, golf courses, or anywhere in Wailea. He says be sure to say how prompt and friendly they were. Aloha, and say hi to Wendy, the rooms manager, and Max, the shuttle driver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful,secluded resort”
Reviews.Author: thehatArizona
Reviews.Content: The rooms were suite size and very clean. The friendleness of the staff and their knowledge of things to do and their willingness to book reservations at even other restaurants added to the enjoyment of our stay.The location is off the beach which makes it a peaceful place to stay. They provided shuttle service to and from the beach with ammenities provided once at the beach. The grounds were immaculate and the dinnig on the lanai was superb with great views. Those things were the best. The thing we liked the worst was dinning inside the restaurant, the heat was opressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: fiveo5
Reviews.Content: What an outstanding Resort. From the moment we arrived we were treated great. We had an ocean view room. Rooms were very clean and had everything we neeeded. We enjoyed not being right on the beach. The resort is very peaceful with nice ocaen views. The staff is very friendly and you can tell they are proud of the resort. Thank you Wendy, we really enjoyed our stay. We are looking forward to our next vaction at the Diamond.

Reviews.Title: “nice condo resort in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: AgieLu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in spacious ground level room with a nice size patio. Rooms are 80's style but clean and comfortable. The grounds are beautiful with waterfalls, lakes and plenty of bird life. There is a very cute family of 3 ducks that roams the resort along with quails, cardinals, etc. Very friendly staff and a generally quiet and peaceful resort. We did not try the restaurants but they looked nice. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quite secluded place - ideal for nature lovers and the low key”
Reviews.Author: turquoisekitty
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place - very quiet - you often felt like you were the only guests at the resort. Rooms aren't the most modern but clean, situated in separate bungalows throughout the property - which was very beautifully landscape. The staff was very nice and accommodating. It's off the beach so you will have to walk or drive but they do also offer a shuttle. The restaurant Capiche was excellent but definitely on the pricey end. Overall a good value but not the kind of place you want to stay if you are lively atmospheres - it's very serene.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Bamboo_Screen
Reviews.Content: I approached a stay of several days with a little trepidation given the reviews for some of the rooms. As far as the room goes it was basically fine. There was a slight musty smell upon entering which disappeared as soon as the windows were opened and wasn't a problem the rest of the stay. The only thing that could be considered dirty was the carpet with a few stains but it wasn't bad. The only thing that should have been fixed or replaced was the shower nozzle which leaked a bit. Everything else was clean and functional. Since this is a hotel and not a collection of separate condos I can't imagine a room being too bad, if it is I'd ask for a change and they hopefully would comply. The views are great. Most rooms have a deck though they are not private, you'll be looking at neighbors and all walking by. The grounds are very well kept. According to the GPS it is 330 ft. above the beach. They have a shuttle to the beach. If you want to walk it's a nice walk on pleasant streets. It takes 15-20 minutes to reach Polo Beach and an additional 15-20 minutes to reach the place at Wailea Beach where the Diamond has a place where you can get a beach chair, towels and umbrella. The pathway along the shore appears to be unlit past Polo Beach at night. The one place where they've dropped the ball is the kitchen. They give you a stove with two electric burners, a small refrigerator and a small bar sink. But all you have to support that is 4 coffee cups, 4 spoons, a small assortment of glasses, a Japanese tea set whose small cups can be used for cereal bowls in a pinch, a wine cork remover and a bottle opener. Anything else you bring yourself. I see others have requested a kitchen set from the office, no mention of that was ever made, if it was the pasta and other items brought would not have been left over. As other have mentioned just a small improvement in this area would be welcome. The room did have Japanese sleeping mats stored away for use if wanted, along with Japanese style bath robes, a combo bath-shower area and a toilet with various spray controls and heated seat... I'm giving it a 5 star rating because the staff was friendly and responsive and seemed aware of improvements that could be made.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet Retreat.”
Reviews.Author: Exploretheworldnow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in March. Check-in was quick but the resort wanted to charge us a resort fee of $10/day but when we questioned why they quickly waived the fee â€“ we had booked a package and there had been absolutely no literature about an added resort fee. We were upgraded to an Ocean View room. The room had a nice size bedroom as well as a dining/sitting area and a nice large bathroom. There was ample closet space to hang clothes and drawers to put things away in the bedroom. It also had a kitchenette which was great â€“ it enabled us to have breakfasts and a few dinners in! The parking for the resort was either valet or self-parking. The resort has a Diamond Beach Club located at Wailea Beach â€“ they provide beach chairs, water, towels and beach umbrellas as well as a shuttle to and from the beach. It worked well and was in a good location. The only hotel restaurant that was open was the Capische? restaurant as the Taiko and Hale Honu were closed for renovation. We had breakfast at Capische? and the menu had very limited choices but it was nice, although very expensive. The place was clean and comfortable as well as being very quiet. A few things that you may want to know: The kitchen set had to be requested and when provided had a saucepan and a fry pan that were Teflon coated and badly scratched and worn and we would not use them, the plates and dishes were fine though. There were signs that the room was well used and it really could do with updating (like the tiles in the bathroom being worn) but as the place was clean it did not bother us. Overall this is a wonderful place to stay and we would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value with Beautiful View and Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Heinkar
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations through priceline for this hotel and was upgraded to a partial oceanview room. The room had an amazing view of the ocean (seemed like a full ocean view room) and the grounds were beautiful. The staff were friendly and we had a great dinner at the Italian restaurant, Capishe? (the food was excellent, but expensive). The actual room was very spacious, although had outdated furnishings and wallpaper. It was clean but did have some scratches on the wall and could use to be remodeled. Overall, was a great value, especially in Wailea, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, comfortable with great sunsets and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: roaminsoul
Reviews.Content: Our stays in Maui over the years have ranged from Ritz Carlton in the North to Grand Wailea in the South. With budgets a little tighter, value becomes important. For the things we assign high value to (space, comfort, view as measured against cost and contrasted to buzz and the latest), this was an excellent hotel. It is away from the beach, but a shuttle takes you there. In terms of density, you are away from the hordes of Grand Wailea. The lanai is was private, a great location to watch sunsets. The bedroom was quite large (with an emperor sized bed of 2 double box springs under a giant mattress). The living room is large and kitchenette was ok for minor food preparation. The hotel was formerly owned by Japanese and was geared to appeal to the Japanese golf players. A good portion of the clientele remains Japanese, and many aspects of the service remind you of a good Tokyo hotel. While the age of the hotel creates more intense maintenance needs, the staff is prompt to address them. Plans are being formulated for a major remodeling, but presently there is nothing in the appearance of the hotel that would turn us off. The pool is very clean, though we spent our time at the beach. Definitely a place we will keep on our return list.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a serene setting”
Reviews.Author: karisue
Reviews.Content: We chose Diamond Hawaii based on their great rates and good reviews we'd read. We stayed for 5 nights in January and had an excellent visit. The rooms have some outdated furnishings, but everything is clean, spacious, and well maintained. The grounds are beautiful and QUIET - a nice respite from the madness of the beach. We spent a lot of time at the resort's pool when we didn't want to be overrun with little kids and college students at the beach. Disappointingly, the poolside snack bar was closed while we were there, but they did not mind us bringing our own sodas & snacks from the room so it worked out great. Service here is exceptional, they went out of their way on numerous occasions to make sure that we had everything we needed and were pleased with our room, the surroundings, etc. We tried out the Asian-style spa, sans swimsuits, and felt completely comfortable using the various spas, showers & saunas available. There are even great views from the spa down over the ocean! The only restaurant open while we were there was their fancy Italian place "Capische?". It was pricey like a lot of places in Wailea, so we had just one meal there on our last night in Maui. The food was excellent, and the service superb. Overall it was a great experience! Our Deluxe Ocean View room had two queen beds and a hide-a-bed sofa in the living area, with sliding doors between, and it was so spacious I can definitely see sharing it with two couples on our next trip to save even more $$!

Reviews.Title: “Service exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: supermank24
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is that the service here is top knotch and far exceeded my expectations. Max at the Valet Desk, remembered my name everytime he saw me and always had my car ready for me when I needed it. The hotel is quiet and peaceful. Lots of beautiful landscape and a spa to go to and unwind at after a long day. Loved the Diamond and will return again. Diamonds are a mans best friend too!!! Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet getaway”
Reviews.Author: DTAlaska
Reviews.Content: We booked this property at a good rate through priceline compared to the regular advertised rate, but I really feel we paid it's true worth. It was a quiet getaway with exceptionally friendly staff. The pool was nice and the spa facilities were a bonus (if you like japanese style spa). The rooms were spacious and the furniture dated, but comfortable. The main drawback was the lack of cleanliness. The daily housekeeping was fine but they could really use some detailed cleaning and freshening up to bring it up to standard with the rest of the area. The facility was away from the beach but they provided shuttle if you didn't have a car and the drive was so short it didn't matter. One restaurant was closed for renovation and the other was way over priced. We don't spend that kind of $$$$ for food. Don't expect to cook in the mini kitchen, they don't supply cookware or dishes, except coffee pot and cups. There are enough places a short drive away to eat though. The reservations were down significantly while we were there which made it a quiet place to relax. Just what we ultimately needed. For the area - it was the best overall value offered.

Reviews.Title: “not bad. depends what you're looking for. location location”
Reviews.Author: drpoundsign
Reviews.Content: old priceline "pig in a poke" deal. 100 bucks/niight. front desk mostly Japanese poor English. Valet parking friendly BUT I do not LIKE mandatory valet parking. haveing to tip someone for almost no work. Capecse? is a good Italian restaurant on campus but ridiculously expensive 90/person including tip. they charge for the view of the pacific. The apartments? The kitchen is ridiculous with only a cooktop NO microwave NO dishwasher. European style shower which is bad. quiet place with the bad economy. Elderly woman activiities planer when she is actually there. the diner is only open for breakfast and is also too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: cpbea
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights here for a wedding in Wailea. Its the cheapest resort in the Wailea area and also the only one not walking distance to a beach. I have to agree with the review right before mine about the general idea of this condo resort. When we used the pool one day, we were the only ones there. How nice it is to actually be able to sleep by the pool! We liked it so much we just forgot about going back to the beach for the rest of our days there, the beach is crowded anyways. Bonus is the free internet if you are lucky enough to snag the computer in the library. That is VERY nice compared to the robbery prices I paid at another hotel in the area for 15 minutes of internet. The staff were the nicest I have ever dealt with in a long long time. If i stayed in Wailea again I would stay here. For the money I saved over nearby beach hotels I could rent a limo to take me to the beach on the couple days I would go.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: morganspal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 3 days recently. It was lovely and very quiet. We paid a reduced price via Hotwire and we were very pleased with the value we got for the price we paid.. The room/suite was large and comfortable, with a huge bed and bathroom. Ceiling fans in the living room and bedroom, and a small kitchen area. All good quality stuff. Also a nice deck with a view of the water and Molikini and the grounds within the resort are lovely and well cared for. I went to the pool and the hot tub every day and they were not crowded at all. To be sure this is NOT the fanciest, most lively resort. If you want a party atmosphere, don't come here. But if you want a quiet, lovely place for less money than other places in Wailea; come here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With Our Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Thankfully
Reviews.Content: We just came back from spending a weekend at the Diamond Hawaii Resort and we just loved it! We are locals (from Oahu) and came to Wailea to go to a wedding. As the hotel staff will tell you, very few locals have heard about this hotel and it is a gem! They do very litttle advertising locally. The grounds were beautifully landscaped. My mom had a great time picking avacados and star fruit off the trees. The ocean view was sensational! The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice and went out of their way to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet, amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: Csaw712
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews I cautiously made my reservations for a weekend in Maui. The reviews about the place being dated and the single sex nude bathing were a little off-putting. Plus, the great rate my friend found seemed to good to be true. However, we went ahead and stayed there, with our friends also staying in a nearby room, for a weekend of sightseeing. We got an amazing rate (less than 300.) I called the desk directly and they quoted me a higher rate but then when I told them what Expedia was offering me, they matched it. Because I was getting such a great deal, I upgraded to a "Deluxe Ocean View". We had a king, non-smoking, and it was upstairs. I'll post a picture of our view ....180 degree view of ocean and we could see Molokini crater where we snorkeled! The grounds were very beautiful and quiet. Many wonderful flowers. We noticed that the staff would purposely walk or take their golf carts another direction rather than enounter you on the path to disturb you. The places are really 2 story mini-condos....large bedroom, kitchenette, small eating table, microfidge, living area, and lanai (balcony) complete with lounge chairs and flip flops. The bathroom was interesting - a toilet room with a Japanese style bidet; a shower room that was reminiscent of a college shower with a hand held nozzle...and a bathtub in that area also. The shower was probably my least favorite part of the room...they could have cleaned the shower door mildew a little better, but it was clean enough that I didn't hesitate to go in barefoot. The water pressure and hot water were great so I had plenty of long showers. There were terry robes in the closet. The closet also had extra bedding (for the sofabed, I assume), 2 large umbrellas and 2 beach towels (bonus!). It is true that the decor was dated...mainly whitewashed wood, pinks and blues from early 90s, but it was all clean and didn't look old. The carpet was comfy and pretty clean. The bed was very comfortable. The sheets were crisp and smooth. We only ate at the Italian restaurant. We went the first night we were there because it was easy. We sat on the balcony, enjoyed the sunset and listened to their live music playing below. I think the prices were a bit higher than I'd have liked (30 -50 range), especially since I didn't much enjoy my meal that well, but others really liked theirs. My veal parm was a slab the size of Texas, but the pasta with it was really salty. The quail appetizer someone had was very flavorful, but $19 worth was 1 little bird..no sharing there! The service was excellent. As far as the spa experience - we didn't have the time or inclination to try it...so, don't miss out on a great place to stay (with free parking, just a few minutes drive from the beach, no resort fees, no screaming kids, etc.) if this is your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good but dated”
Reviews.Author: yorks_nameless
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Diamond Resort very late after flight delays from LAX, I had called to warn them we would be late but check in was no problem and the night security drove us to our room in the golf buggy. There are four suites per detached bungalow. We booked a partial ocean view and were not disappointed the following morning when we looked out across the resort grounds and a great view of the ocean from the balcony. Inside the suites are large with a kitchen area, lounge, bedroom, bath/shower, seperate toilet and sink area. In general the bathroom and kitchen fixtures are looking dated and some of the furnishings are getting tired but they are all in good working order and more than adequate. The resort itself was very quiet when we were there, the only other guests we saw were sat in their suite when we were returning in the evening. We didn't use the communal areas but what we saw looked very nice and clean. The resort is located on the hill overlooking Wailea, on the first morning we walked into the centre. Although not a huge distance it was quite hard work in the hot sun, especially the uphill section on the way back. In the car it is a short drive to the nearest beach and Wailea itself. We did not eat at the resort restaurants whilst we were there and ate out instead. We would recommend Ferraros at the Four Seasons for dinner and Longhis (located at the shops) for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good but dated interior”
Reviews.Author: tompisa
Reviews.Content: Diamond Resort was a strange experience. The positive side is that the rooms are big , with a nice balconery . We had an ocean view suite , and the view was really stunning. The resort itself is a bit dated. All furnitures are 20 years old . The pool area is small and dated too . The Yakuzzi was not useable. The restaurants (Japanes and Italian) are not to recommend. Espacially the Japanese Restaurent was not Japanese at all ;-) . The Sahimi and Nigiri Sushi had a "ok"-quality and looked like dangeours bombs. Not for food asthetes. So you have to go out for dinner or lunch better to the Four Seasons or other Hotel restauretns in the Waleian Area. Or you cook on your own. The kitchen inside the rooms is ok and usefull. The best was the friendly Hotel staff and the fantastic relaxed atmposphere inside the Resort. There was no noise, Baby Crying, party Music or simliar. Diamond Resort is a good place for people who wants to stay out of trouble or fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel for Maui”
Reviews.Author: pengysan
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced hotel for Wailea area. The rooms are a little old but overall satisfactory. You're not right on the beach so if you are looking for direct access this is not it. The resort is located on a tranquil hill and a short drive to public beach access. Rooms are spacious with a lanai and kitchenette. Staff is friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Mauid07
Reviews.Content: We booked our entire Maui wedding/honeymoon online through Expedia.com. We chose this resort because of the beautiful grounds and it's Japenese design. We wanted a quiet resort because we have 4 kids, that were not with us!! LOL!! And that is exactly what we got. Very relaxing and peaceful. Everything about this resort was perfect. We were on a tight wedding budget and booked a Partial Oceanview Suite, however, when we checked in we were told that we were "upgraded" to a Deluxe Oceanview Suite. The view was amazing!! We look at our wedding and honeymoon photos everyday and it's been almost a year. We cannot wait to go back and we would definately return to the Diamond Resort and Spa!! Mr. & Mrs. G in Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kmalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two other adults for one night during the peak Christmas / New Year's season. This was one of the only hotels in Wailea which had room availability and was not requiring a seven-night minimum stay. The hotel is catered to the Japanese tourists, so the staff speaks Japanese and the suites have Japanese bathtubs. There is also a public bathhouse (ofuro) which is free of charge and open at limited hours. The suites themselves are roomy. Ours was on the top level and overlooked a Koi pond. The room was a bit of a walk (2-3 minutes) from the lobby area, but you can call for a cart to pick you up if you have heavy luggage. Rooms are a bit run down, but clean and can fit four adults comfortably (two on the MASSIVE bed in the bedroom and two on the pullout in the living room). We hear the hotel is going to be renovated soon. This resort is not near the water, but you can walk down to the beach in less than 5 minutes. The hotel grounds, koi ponds and landscaping are very nice and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again at Diamond Resort Maui”
Reviews.Author: LeslyePDX
Reviews.Content: Bought this hotel on Hotwire, so I had no idea what I was getting. (BTW, when I bought it, Hotwire was advertising car and hotel, but it turns out that was just a come-on to buy both, so I ended up having to book them separately at extra cost. I contacted Hotwire about the misleading headline and I notice it is not there now.) Nevertheless, even on Hotwire, the price was not cheap, so I was a little nervous, since I thought with a 4 star hotel in Wailea, I would get oceanfront, although not the Four Seasons or Grand Wailea. It turns out the hotel was up on a hill behind the oceanfront resorts. I read the reviews on Tripadvisor extensively and really liked the one who called himself Diamond Guy. Anyhow, these are my observations once I got there: 1) Very easy to find and very easy to access all of Wailea and Kihei for shopping, eating, and beach. 2) The valet service and all other staff were beyond friendly and helpful. 3) We were upgraded to ocean view which was lovely to watch the sunsets each evening and sit and read. 4) Property is beautiful and unbelievably quiet. 5) Went to the pool for hours everyday and saw almost no one else at the pool or on the property. 6) The spas are separate for men and women and don't believe that bathing suit optional stuff - they are not optional! I only went once to the women's and there were several others there, but it was still quiet. I did not partake in in any of the extra spa activities. 7) Never ate at the restaurants, but the Italian restaurant looked packed all the time and seems to be very popular for all visitors to Maui, not just residents of the hotel. 8) Now the room - a) the bed, as mentioned by other reviewers, was the biggest bed I have ever seen. We had our adult daughter with us and told her to just stay in the bed also since it was so big, but she decided to stay on the couch in the living room and we closed the doors between the two rooms (not too sound proof though). I never heard another sound in any other unit, but I think we were the only ones in our building (4 per building). I like that instead of putting everyone together in one part of the resort like some hotels - they spread guests all over the resort. b) The bathroom was pretty cool. The huge tub and shower are together behind glass doors with a little stool for the shower, so one can hold the shower head in your hand and bathe like the Japanese (there were many stations like this in the spa area too). The toilet was in a separate room all by itself, which was nice for the three of us to be able to use it without getting in anyone else's way. c) Kitchen is not full, but frig was big enough for us to keep adding soda pop, snacks, milk (and especially lots of poke if you like that sort of thing - great poke from the deli dept. at the local market in Kihei). No microwave, but a little sink and burners (which we never used). The kitchen is not stocked with dishes, etc., but we called and the supplies were brought to us immediately for the duration of our stay. d) I guess the only complaint I have about the whole resort was that the room was not as immaculate as I would have liked. I am a mirror fanatic and I could tell that they did not clean the mirrors regularly. They did clean everyday - kind of late, and we often had to call - but still no mirror cleaning. The rest of the room as cleaned though. On our last day, they were having a bug cleaning service come in which is apparently something that needs to be done frequently in Hawaii. We only saw a couple of bugs - and neither of them freaked me out. 9) Bottom line - I would definitely stay here again. The friendly staff, the huge suite and the quiet property were right up my alley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: mdabul
Reviews.Content: As others wrote... excellent hotel for price in Wailea. Staff was OUTSTANDING! Only "issue" was Capiche restaurant.. Appetizer's were good, but entree's were below average for the price. For the price I'd go to The Waterfront, Spago, or even Sarento's. But the hotel employee's were so friendly and rooms such a good value that it still rates an Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and very quiet and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Relaxandfun
Reviews.Content: We (two couples) stayed at the Diamond resort October 14 through 20 in an Ocean View suite. The suite is very large with a nice bathroom (Japanese style) and small kitchen area with very basic amenities. The rooms are a bit dated but nothing out of the range for the great price we paid. The lanai was fantastic and the view of the ocean was fabulous. This resort is at the top of a hill and is not right in the middle of the beachfront hotels. We didn't really think this was much of a problem because the walk wasn't too far for us. Most people would probably take a car down but we just walked. We were often times the only people at the pool and hot tub. The pool is small but heated and relaxing. There was no competition for lounge chairs or shaded tables. We are beach people and took the short drive to Big Beach/Little Beach which is only 5 to 10 minutes. There were plenty of towels and it was nice to come back and use the pool for a bit. The Japanese baths were included in the price and worth every cent. We went at night and after 30 minutes were relaxed and ready for bed. This is an overlooked amenity. We researched the proper process on the web and had no problems. We purchased the breakfast option and it was worth the extra money. You could choose from the Japanese style breakfast or American breakfast off of the menu. No buffet or food that was prepared hours ago. There were several choices and it was all quite good. The restaurant Capiche on site was fantastic. The entire staff was very wine knowledgeable and we ended up eating there twice - the second time at the bar. You should not miss this wherever you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: esurman
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews. My wife and I stayed for 4 days in October. The rooms are great, the service is excellent and its much quieter than other resorts. We would drive to the big hotels for dinner and then return to the Diamond Resort for a quiet evening. The pool is a bit dated but nothing terrible. I would definetely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town!”
Reviews.Author: happy2getaway
Reviews.Content: Loved the Diamond Hawaii Resort and Spa! We stayed there (Sept 25-30) for my sister's wedding (which took place at the Four Seasons - about a 5 min drive) in an ocean view suite on the 2nd floor (Rm #163). -------------------------- Pros: -------------------------- - Price ($209/night) - Complimentary valet and parking - Quiet, beautiful location set on top of a hill - Spacious condo (~900 sq.ft.) with kitchenette (mini fridge, hot water dispenser, stove, sink, complimentary tea) and balcony - Japanese style bathroom (walk-in shower room with tub). This was convenient for rinsing shoes, snorkel gear, swim suit, etc.. - Sliding doors to separate bedroom from living room and doors to separate sink area and Japanese style toilet (another fun feature!) - great for privacy if you're sharing the room with friends - Free broadband (can borrow a laptop from the front desk) - Free use of the Japanese bathhouse spa (12pm-10pm). Never crowded. Had full use of their hot water spa and sauna. All the amenities are already in the spa (ie: towels, toiletries) so all you need to bring is your room key to access the spa. There are no attendants in the spa; only guests.
